_853eu5x-BQ2vGt5NU_rQw.text: What a great restaurant! The food was great, the view was magnificent. What more can you say, they lived up to their reputation!!

xh0qVqOTrnwGSqvYxv7cnQ.text: I took my girlfriend here about a year ago when I first asked her to be my girlfriend.  At the time the food was amazing and the view was about as good as it gets.  The price I remember was pretty reasonable.  Honestly, my view of this place may have been colored by the fact that she loved it and said yes.  Good food, AMAZING views, and pretty reasonable definitely adds up to a place I'll visit again

Ex32DjszDWVsGzJPFUYilw.text: Excellent meal with lovely views. Duck confit with risotto was delightfully crispy and flavorful. My husband enjoyed a perfectly cooked fillet. Wonderful place for a special occasion. We'll be back!

Gwbt-MaEe8XrmhmjEQxMFg.text: The setting itself at DPOV is magical. It is great news that the food is equally as wonderful.  We dined outside on a beautiful evening. We were offered delicious focaccia bread with 3 fun spreads to start, while we sipped our drinks and enjoyed the view. We next shared the grilled endive salad.  The grilled endive and pancetta were fabulous atop mandolined fennel and apple in a very light vinaigrette. The tangy salad flavors were deliciously complemented by full flavored gorgonzola.  I enjoyed the hangar steak for an entree. It was perfectly cooked (ordered medium, came medium/medium rare) and seasoned. The beef was well-marbled and tender. Its buttery and char-grilled flavor was beautifully complemented by the smoky tomato basil emulsion that accompanied it. As well, the cauliflower and sherry risotto was rich and layered.     My daughter had the seared free-range roasted chicken. I was invited to taste a bite; it was moist, delicious, and very well seasoned. The accompanying swiss chard and carrots were lovely, and the potato gratin was outrageously delicious.   We shared a fantastic chocolate confection for dessert, as we savored the special meal and continued to enjoy the beautiful evening. Different Pointe of View is a gem!

v3a0QTIprXblkfdi2-HoeQ.text: Top 5 dining experiences in the Phoenix area!  My bf and I went last night, and, from start to finish, it was perfect.  When we arrived, we were seated in a corner with a spectacular view.  We were immediately greeted by one of our three servers, and they were extremely attentive all night.  We shared the pork belly appetizer to start.  They split it without us having asked, and both of our plates were like works of art.  More importantly, the dish was stellar!  We are both hesitant when it comes to pork belly because of the potential to be too fatty, but this was fantastic.  For our entrees, he had lobster on top of some sort of raviolis, and I had hangar steak with risotto.  They were both excellent, but I preferred mine.  It was cooked perfectly and was a good portion size but not overwhelming.  The dessert menu looked great too, but we were stuffed!  So we moved outside and just enjoyed the view with our cocktails for a little while.  I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster and hangar steak entrees--both amazing!

x-23woann3YKjnUmOinvhw.text: Great food, service and views. Hard to beat. This is our favorite "high-end" restaurant in the valley.

lXQTQInYt8lYUL8rWiT0RQ.text: This was the second time I had been to this place. Atmosphere is unbeatable. Service incredible. My friend and I ordered the lobster and it was very rubbery and fishy tasting, and I love fish. Our server noticed we weren't really eating it and ask us what was wrong. We told him and they actually gave the meals for free. Love that kind of service. I usually don't send food back or complain, it was very nice that server was trained enough to notice the problem and take care of it! I will be back.

jHHzQ8wQrLRuP58gnT_W5Q.text: I went here with a friend for restaurant week tonight. I was teetering between 3 and 4 stars but decided the amazing view and service made it a 4 star experience. We started with the short rib ravioli, which was really delicious. The short rib was tender and it came on top of some corn that was sweet and tasty. Definite win with that dish. They also brought out bread with pesto, garlic butter, and a goat cheese dip so that was also fantastic. My only complaint was that the entrees were a little hum drum. I had the hangar steak and my friend had the pork and both were just lacking in overall flavor and both were a little on the dry side (and I ordered mine medium so that's not really expected). Had it not been restaurant week, I would've been upset to have spent as much money as these entrees normally cost. The desserts were also good, we split the turtle and the espresso cup, but they weren't mind blowingly delicious. I would maybe come back here for the view, but the food was not good enough to warrant the price.

F05tzoqfbwAy-OYyBsbUoQ.text: Had a great time. The view was fantastic. 5 course meal was awesome. Can't wait to come back. Top notch!

akFc1jrgZAZcXqhMi6gqdA.text: Nice view of the city lights because the restaurant sits 4 floors on top of North Mountain. Good fresh food I had a hammer steak for the entree with lobster bisque as the first course which is always satisfying, my desert of choice was chocolate  turtle. Service was excellent and people friendly. Great place for a romantic dinner and afterwards you can enjoy the outside terrace one floor down with their beautiful firepit and warm comfortable seating. Their you can enjoy the stars as well as the city lights and snuggle next to your loved one while enjoying your favorite drink. Good place to get back on track if you lost your way. WORTH IT

1KUUOmAoG0xpnbHmcwiHbw.text: Hands down... If you're ready to "pop the question" then come here because she will be lost for words. A little pricey but worth it!

FM8PuGc9n5pCmn5mSkocDA.text: Update to my review, dined here again recently and it gets better and better.  If you go here, and the special is a meat or fish that you would like, get it.  The specials are SOOO good and really big!  They stay seasonal and change things up, so hard to say exactly what you should get, but the food honestly speaks for itself.  It's worth every penny.  Service is great and friendly as well, and every seat in the room has a good view, so not worth complaining if you don't get a window seat.

q9cgBUKwQ9r_VDO87BDPqA.text: Beautiful views this is a great place to enjoy dinner with someone special or even a group of people.  Also a great place to just go have drinks at. The views are breathtaking.

s6uX4ZAP_8oVSu3vPV7w6A.text: The food, the ambiance, the service, it was all amazing.  I think everything was awesome because I was with awesome people.  The view outside is also gorgeous.    We were here during restaurant week and had their 3 course meal.  I got the duck ravioli, the filet minon, and the creme brule for dessert.  I sampled their lobster bisque and I wish I had gotten that instead of the duck ravioli.  My filet minon was cooked well done because I am currently pregnant and it was still surprisingly tender.  The creme brule was delightful as well.

xAMIsCCWsDtdW0dtHQGoZw.text: This is my FAVORITE place to dine out in the greater Phoenix area. The food (I recommend the steaks) is almost as good as the view and the service is impeccable. My boyfriend took me here on a date a year ago, and it was definitely one of the most romantic restaurants we have found in Phoenix yet.   The prices are a little high ($25 - $40 per entree), but it's well worth it and you won't leave disappointed. If you like American or French food (who doesn't?) and have a special occasion or just feel like doing something different, I highly recommend Different Pointe of View to everyone!

S9GdFsY4HOjJ97BsM74xqQ.text: The food was very good, and the view is spectacular! This is a great place for a nice meal out or for a celebration. They were generous with their portions and even brought us two soups (when we had only asked to split one). The service was also very friendly and knowledgeable.  Our main issue was that the soup we had was WAY too rich (too much creme or butter or something?). It was delicious, but part of the way through, we suddenly felt massively full. We had a hard time eating the rest of our meal and had to bring most of it home. We both had that sick-full feeling throughout the rest of the night. Maybe it was just us, as we normally eat healthy, so it might have been a shock to our stomachs. Otherwise though, the food was very good!

IBdLwHY1EqFRniHxN4Rhqw.text: We chose Different Pointe of View to celebrate our anniversary and were not disappointed.   What an amazing view of the city...we sat inside but it would have been lovely outside as well.  The strawberry and arugula salad was wonderful and our waiter took the initiative to split it for us since our plan was to share... Corey, our waiter, was extremely helpful as I'm gluten-free.  He went through the entire menu with me on what I could and couldn't have... so nice that the majority of items were gf or could be adjusted to be...   I had the Scallops and hubbie had the halibut -- both really, really good.  We shared the citrus almond/honey cake and it was nice... but next time, we'll go for the flourless chocolate instead.  Wonderful evening... this is a great place for a special night out or to impress visiting family and friends... We're planning to return more often to the Terrace Room for a lower-key evening with a view...

AORY8JOg_0Uzj2CgHNDMsg.text: Amazing experience. Our first time there and it was for our anniversary. Louis was one of the best servers I have ever had. He made sure everything was perfect, gave us a history of the restaurant and went above and beyond to ensure our evening was perfect. The food was incredible, the views breathtaking, and the atmosphere great. This has become one of our favorites!

Acat16_M7g5V4CoT93Kuvg.text: You are definitely paying for the view and service here. The food are quite pricey and nicely presented, but nothing impressive toward my taste buds. I really love their clam appetizer though, the clams are huge!! It's a nice place to take love one to see the sunset while enjoying dinner up on the mountain.

vI5dZKZdBS5-oySNxFhyjA.text: This restaurant is elegant and lovely. The staff is friendly and professional, and the food is amazing. I took my parents here on our vacation and they were extremely impressed. I would hands down suggest this for a special occasion or just a nice night out. If you're not interested in eating, they have a nice bar below the restaurant where you can enjoy the view.

PVrzDeiKWKtBoIFecSWCbg.text: Outstanding service!  Thank you Luis!  Amazing food. Romantic!  A fine dining experience I'll never forget. Perfect for special occasions. Food was delicious, fresh and extremely high quality. You can't beat the view, day or night. Sit on the side of the mountain top edge or in the floor to ceiling windows. There is not a bad seat in the restaurant. Luis, you were the perfect waiter and made our special occasion and evening even better than we expected. Thank you again. I will be back soon.

7vv78a7QVcsofTPc1UC0hw.text: Beautiful night.  Great service and delicious food.  We enjoyed drinks on patio with amazing views and then definitely dinner on upper patio.  Server was friendly and fun.   Everyone enjoyed their meals.  Had filet - highly recommend.  Several gluten free options

razLhRMSluvrRuG4Cb7ETg.text: The food was amazing! I took my sister here for.her 21st and it was an amzing experience. The waiter was very polite and friendly as well. However, it was a bummer to see some people dressed pretty casual at such a beautiful fancy restaurant. I dressed up well and felt amazing though.

OLEgLASuldvYkdAcp4cw-w.text: What can I say?  I just can NOT be disappointed with this restaurant!  We've been going for over 15 years, have gone for New Years, birthdays, anniversaries and countless other special occasions and they've never dropped the ball. Not once!    The view?...Even if you're in a miserable mood this amazing mountain top floor-to-ceiling panoramic view will make you feel like all the stars in the sky are set out over the valley just for you.  It is incredibly relaxing, breathtaking, romantic and makes for beautiful pictures!   The food....well, I must be honest, I'm not sure how the menu fares as we don't even read it...we've only ever ordered the chef tasting menu, but I've never been let down. In fact, I get so excited when we make reservations it's all I think about for days. They do ask if you have food allergies, but be warned, if you're not up for trying new foods or eating favorites in creative, inventive, non-traditional combinations this might be too much of an adventure for you:) That being said, I suggest "Live a little", try new things and allow this artist of a chef to take you on a flavor ride.  He will convert you to allow someone else to take the wheel.  The beauty of the plates, the flavors and combinations are always memorable...  This particular evening we started with pan seared foie gras on top of French toast with a chestnut smear and huckleberry jam.   Our second course was a light and crunchy breaded soft shell crab with a frisee salad tossed in lemon vinaigrette and dotted with fried slivers of jalapenos.    Course 3 was an impeccable pan seared diver sea scallop atop a lobster Parmesan risotto cake served with lobster knuckles, caramelized shallots and (I believe) rapini.  4th course was pistachio crusted rack of lamb with natural lamb jus reduction over a celery root puree and, spinach and roasted chanterelle mushrooms.   Dessert was a 4 piece sampler per couple.  1.) a citrus bread pudding (mandarin ?) 2.) a s'more type layered chocolate and marshmallow cake 3.) traditional cream brulee with berries 4.) an amazing combination of peanut butter, chocolate and banana...don't know what it was, but we almost fought over it and it was gone too quickly to break it down, but if you get a choice (as sometimes we have been offered during the tasting) get the peanut butter, banana & chocolate dessert...all of us agreed!    The wine...well, they have many many many choices and I'm sure you can find your favorite, but why not let your server/sommelier make a pairing to the chef's menu?  I've experienced many wines I might not have bothered to try, and, as an interesting twist, several didn't care for when poured, but fell in LOVE with when the course pairing arrived. What a gift they have to elevate both the food and the wine!  I wish I had written down the wines from this evening, but my phone was not charged, so I am going without pics and from memory (which got fuzzier following 4 glasses of wine;)). Many of the food courses had extra oils, drizzles and smears as well that made for unctuous bites, but again I apologize for the lack of "notes" taken.  First was a sweeter round white from France, second was a crisp, fruity (pear/Apple) white akin to a Pinot Grigio from Italy, third was a Chardonnay from California and fourth was a cotes de rhone (blend of Grenache/Syrah). Again, I apologize for no names.   The service...I've always felt service is at LEAST 1/2 of your dining experience. I cannot say enough about the atmosphere created here. They make you feel special without being stuffy. We joke around with the staff and are always made to feel comfortable.   If you ever get the chance to splurge on a special meal, I HIGHLY recommend this as an all around amazing experience.   Compliments to the chef and the entire staff at Different Pointe of view...I look forward to the next time I'm lucky enough to return!

isc63EFzpGJmtyS3riojTw.text: Beautiful restaurant but my steak was gravely overcooked. I could not find even a hint of pink. Really disappointed- I couldn't even cut through the steak. I had high expectations of this restaurant and I could not believe how bad the steak was. We were here for a company dinner and I heard that a few others had the same problem. The salad was delicious as was the dessert but the steak was an absolute disaster.

LdKVOWeO39mZmorM-Q6Utg.text: Update: I returned here with high hopes for my fathers birthday celebration on Sunday night. While the view was still amazing (and we were awarded with a fantastic window seat), the food wasn't that great. We ordered two apps, both of which were quite good but in my opinion you can't really go wrong with anything pork belly or anything to do with burrata. The entrees were pretty bland though. One member in our party even requested that they be brought salt, always a bad sign. I sampled everyone's food (for science of course), and the duck was probably the worst - bland risotto and a poorly cooked duck leg. My steak was passable, although the sides were a bit cold. I feel I've had a tastier steak at a chain like Ruth Chris. I would probably return here and sit on their patio for the view and a cocktail, but I don't think I'll be returning to spend top dollar for their dinner.

y2hLNSNvu5a3UfhpgC8IWA.text: This is an upscale restaurant located in the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort. If you're looking to impress your date, celebrate a birthday or anniversary, this is the place! The food was amazing, service was impeccable and the view was just breathtaking. I came here with the PHX Yelp family, that recently adopted this Nashvillian, during Restaurant week earlier this year. They offered a 3- course Prix Fixe at $40 which was very affordable for what you get. My dearest Mike D. and I shared our selections: Guacamole, can't remember what the other app was (sorry), pork tenderloin, seared ahi, creme brulee and chocolate mousse. Everything was delicious...except for the pork tenderloin; I found it to be a bit on the dry side.   Different Pointe of View will always hold a special place in my heart.

dxRaVAWem4H0KkaSBJEJZg.text: The view is spectacular. You really get a beautiful scene with your meal. That being said, it doesn't necessarily make up for the food or service. We went during the off season on a summer holiday so maybe that was a factor. Our waiter asked us what we wanted to drink and hadn't given us a wine or cocktail list. The food was mediocre. We got the prix fixe. The verjus infused watermelon salad was bland and the verjus just made the fruit seem like it had gone bad. The lobster bisque was so so with no lobster meat in sight. The shrimp I had was a bit rubbery and over cooked. Overall it was just ok. It isn't the fine dining it's trying to be. No matter how big and white your plates are it doesn't make up for taste. I'd go back to enjoy the view at the bar below instead.

3v2lDYwIW7AW7e9T98Qq4w.text: Beautiful views and excellent food. I had the shrimp with polenta plate and husband had the short rib. Both were delicious. The service was great without being pushy. They recommend reservations but we were seated rather quickly on a Tuesday night.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from an inside table

yQM_EcIPzT1Hv3FxI-l7xg.text: We celebrated my dad's 90th birthday here on March 17th with a large group of 15 family members.  Luis was our primary sever - he was fantastic- perfect service!  His whole team took great care of us.  The chef and the food was truly exceptional: short ribs, lobster, scallops, bass, sword fish, prime filet of beef - appetizers- everything!  The pastry chef, Lara, created a scrumptious scratch vanilla with fresh berries cake which was too die for!  The atmosphere and of course the view were spectacular elements of our special evening.  We can't wait to go back just for a great meal! Thanks everyone- simply the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K9ieQUVEedlsOEonoOc5Dg.text: Delicious food and an amazing view of Phoenix!!  I will start off from the beginning of our experience. I made reservations for mine and my husbands one year anniversary. We were not seated until 20 minutes after our reservation time which was a little frustrating. Once we were seated (in front of an incredible view), we didn't get water or a menu for about 7-8 minutes which was awkward. All up from here though... Our waiter was very friendly and guided us through the menu and provided us with recommendations. At one point, my husband mentioned it was our on year anniversary so a few minutes later the waiter brought out a complimentary appetizer...lobster bisque! Very delicious and the perfect portion. For our entree, my husband ordered the short rib and I got the beef tenderloin. Both dishes were amazing but my tenderloin...oh my juicing beefiness! It was cooked perfect; medium rare in the inside with a nice crisp char on the outside.  For desert, we ordered the peanut butter chocolate which comes with house made banana ice cream. Drool, drool, drool! Another amazing dish! They even put a piece of chocolate in the desert that read "happy anniversary".  Next visit I will be bringing my in-laws from Oregon!

38XNePUu_JNjDasQjcJtbg.text: A Different Pointe of V  iew has great ambiance, Amazing flavored marshmellows and out of this world views!

WT0c4iC2tIgnH1L3if-blw.text: This is a wonderful restaurant! The views are unbeatable inside and out. And  the food and the service are also exceptional!!!

6Au8_UwAyhWkGN7WiHMNnw.text: A Disappointing Pointe of View Let me start out by saying that the meal we had here was outstanding, and our server Brian was great. Unfortunately, the topmost selling point of this restaurant is supposed to be the sunset view. They did, after all, name the place for the view. That is the main reason we came here to celebrate a special occasion, and I made a reservation a month ahead of time.   We were seated in what is likely the worst seat in the place, in the east corner. There was not much of a view, my wife's view was the mountain behind the restaurant and a huge red pillar, but I had a view of the east valley. That only got worse when a party of 40 or so people arrived and stood out on the patio for the entire evening. Our "lovely view" was that of 20 butts, all lined up to watch the valley view. Other tables are positioned where the patio descends, so they got to see heads. Very disappointing.   But the food was wonderful, fine presentation and a pleasing blend of flavors. Would I go back? Meh. There are so many fine restaurants in the Phoenix Scottsdale area, I think we will continue exploring them.

j6WG53L6FV-np7Bw-tFXNw.text: I was a little iffy about this place because it's inside of a hotel, by I was totally blown away. The view is incredible, service was phenomenal, and the food was to die for. I definitely recommend for a special occasion and will definitely be back!

P44QMw7-kB_n1vydkFGPhw.text: I adore this venue! I've been here both for a personal dinner with a loved one and in the past I used this restaurant for a huge business event with 50+ clients, both experiences were absolutely perfect. The views from the back patios are amazing and the food is excellent. The event coordinator and kitchen staff are very attentive, I was very satisfied with the level of service they provided. Worth the expense!

1s-4QkEaLF743aYV32R2xg.text: Not worth it. We waited over an hour for our food, our waiter never checked on us until after we finished eating. The food was okay but not out of this world. My husband ordered the fillet mignon which was good. The vegetable side dish was bland. I ordered the chicken dish which was flavorless and had more mashed potato than anything else. The views and outdoor area are beautiful but not worth dining here.

gDpMnTBiOjfFc84YCukr0g.text: Yes 5 stars for the view. It ends there. It's old, dated and in bad need of a mark over. The food is high priced and not very good. I had the short ribs (chefs specialty), it was very boring. Wife's filet was tough. They boast "awarded five stars for years". By who? Do your self a favor. Go for the view, have a glass of wine or two on the patio at sunset. Then go somewhere else for dinner. If you eat there, good luck.

GpWuUUynOkVR6wDCZ8ZZfA.text: Stayed at the Hilton Pointe Tapatio hotel and enjoyed this restaurant onsite. The view, ambiance, service and food were fantastic.  A great place to spoil yourselves. Was a little chili to sit outside at the lounge but such a romantic night it would make when it's warmer.

ICWKyS0swOfSf1yqDb_zPA.text: I had my first experience here last Friday night. The service and food was excellent. Things started out a bit shaky as they had a very loud wedding party in the dining room and I was concerned it would ruin the evening. Luckily they left about 20 minutes after our arrival and the rest of the night was perfect. I am a fan and I will go again!

Yy2DYt2ong7RSL0Pzrd1-Q.text: Great place to celebrate.  Had the osso bucco special.  It was fabulous.  A great value for the price. I was told that it was nice/casual and felt underdressed when I arrived.  The staff were gracious and kind.  A great experience.

4qG5S89pKEYuAHPTrJ4IVA.text: Attended a networking luncheon here.  If you've never been here before, the drive up to the restaurant is a bit confusing.  The directional signs to guide you to your destination are non-existent.  However, once you reach your destination, you're in for a real treat.  The restaurant is perched on top of a ridge that overlooks part of the Phoenix Valley.  The view is spectacular!  The food is great too.  There was passed hors d'oeuvres at the beginning of the event that were very tasty.  Then just before the main speaker began, we were all seated for lunch.  We were served a Petite Filet and some Veggies with a light Citrus Salad as an appetizer.  Both were very good.  The servers were great.  They kept our water and Iced Tea glasses full throughout the lunch and promptly took away our dishes after each course.  For dessert, we had Cheesecake topped with Berries...it was delish!  Overall, it was a very good luncheon.  If they hold one here again, I will definitely attend.  I will also come back for a dinner with The Better Half.  Return Factor - 88%

xW8tgLVsWZzeW_j07PgtZw.text: This review is for the Terrace Room downstairs from Different Point of View.  Yelp doesn't seem to have a separate listing for it.  This review is for the bar/lounge and wine list.  Although I do get food when I am there, they change the menu often so i don't feel it's fair to review food that won't be on the menu in a few months.  I have been going here for five years now and I never get sick of it.  They have a fabulous wine list and one of the most breathtaking views in all of Phoenix.  This place is a hidden gem and I'm always amazed when people say they have never heard of it.  The bar/lounge is completely walled with glass so you can see the city view from any seat within the bar/lounge.  The seating outside is a fabulous set up.  You can sit in a circle seating area around a fire pit, at a communal couch area, or at separate tables right at the edge of the mountain.  There is also a hidden seating area off to the West side that gives you a completely different view of the city.  Sometimes in the winter the chef will make homemade marshmallows infused with different liqueurs.  The cocktail servers will give you sticks to roast your marshmallows at the fire pit and they also provide different dipping sauces.  This is one of my favorite times of the year!!!  Don't miss out if you are there in the winter time!  The only complaint I have about this place is that it can be rented out so it is frequently closed for private parties.  ALWAYS CALL AHEAD TO  FIND OUT IF THEY ARE OPEN!  The staff is always amazing.  Bill, the manager, is always making sure you are enjoying your visit and April and Richard down at the Terrance Room are fabulous!   Don't miss out on a drink and view at the Terrace Room!

fb8Ye8qBcDThi9iirg9Yuw.text: Elegant, romantic, and delicious! Had an anniversary dinner here and with a reservation, was seated right away. Waiters and all other service personnel were very polite and ensured our cup was never empty. The food was phenomenal. Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to celebrate a big occasion.

lLllJ0ZYYEL86NJaRb9vhQ.text: Went Saturday night for restaurant week menu.  Food was good and view great.  Unfortunately we had a waiter  that was so hyper he basically ruined the evening.  From the minute we sat down he was in our faces talking a mile a minute and rather condescending. Thanks to the busboy for filling water glasses and bringing bread-he was professional and polite. When we left I mentioned to the hostess the odd behavior of the waiter and she knew immediately who I was talking about.  They really need to reevaluate their personnel.  We dropped over $300 and expect a lot better experience.

JrPNbw-G-zQ4L6eEenXBlg.text: Disappointed  Planned for months for a fine dining experience.  Checked reviews and picked  this spot at the Hilton.  The setting was spectacular but...  Service was slow and inattentive.  I have had more attention and smiles at Culvers.  The food was  just OK  Pork chop was not tneder  but it was large.  The food was presented nicely but just not that good.  Tenderloin was  up to par but  have had better.  The accompanying sides were unique but some were overcooked,  Thought maybe dessert would excel but  creme brulee was average.  For the price I expected more, Did we just hit a bad night  other reviews  rave!!!

v3Rr4y34QZl4Q0-tCMSCXQ.text: WOW! my girlfriend and I ate here on Valentines weekend and we were blown away.  We were greeted and sat down promptly (before our reservation time... we were about 10 min early).  Not only was their staff very hospitable but we greatly enjoyed our meal, and of course, the view.   This restaurant on the mountain oversees Phoenix and could not be a more beautiful location for dinner.  Our meals were fantastic. I enjoyed the tasting menu, and she tried the steak and lobster, which was amazing. After our meal, we spent some time on the patio, which is well equipped with seats, fire places, and heaters.  Overall, a wonderful evening with my Love and an excellent dining experience.

WSxwAw9hvZu7GbMaVzvBLQ.text: The August issue of Wine Spectator is out and Different Pointe of View was awarded a Best of Award of Excellence.  Congrats!

CzAHGo6MzWp0yKIckg77_Q.text: This was a treat a fiesta in my mouth with delicious. "All shit was good" it was good from start to end. Would love to come here again and try the chief specials. Very nice chief, he came out to greet us while we complimented his wonderful exploring work.  Everyones tastes buds and bellies were 100% happy :)

iFpz2IfJYecCrSZzy7s2TQ.text: This is a great place to dine and enjoy exceptional views.  We ate early so the crowd was just picking up when we were leaving but the service was excellent and the food was terrific!  My wife loves to have photos taken and one of our wait staff was eager to cater to her wishes, selecting several places for us to have photos taken while waiting for our food to be served.  We will likely be back soon!

qNK4H3lWlCOFfab8HDTngA.text: We enjoyed great tenderloin dinners and views of city were amazing! Special treatment for our birthdays!

tycsONnKaKSKemABz8zshA.text: Not just your average review.  Great story and example of how good the service is...even when your not the diner.  I wanted to do something really nice for two of my friends on Valentine's day.  One problem though, they live in Arizona and I'm in California.  I know! I'll send them to dinner...wait, but where?  I have no knowledge of the restaurant scene in AZ.  So naturally, I jump on Yelp and start looking up restaurants.  Different Pointe of View comes up and it looks like a fantastic choice.  I check with one of my friends (she is in on the surprise) and turns out this is one of their favorite places to eat.  They are both foodies so that told me immediately that the food must be excellent.  So I found a place, but how do I arrange this so that everything goes smoothly?  Enter Catlyn, the hostess who answered the phone when I first called.  I explain the situation and what I would like to happen.  I was expecting something to the tune of "I am sorry sir but we cannot accommodate a request like that," or something of that nature.  Catlyn responded enthusiastically to this idea and said she would email me the correct form to fill out so that dinner would be taken care of.  She then took my reservation for my two friends and assured me that they would be well taken care of.  Within hours the form was in my inbox.  I filled it out, preselected a bottle of wine off of the website and faxed it back to the restaurant.  Catlyn responded to each and every email correspondence  I sent her regarding my requests as well as making sure her managers were aware of the situation.  Her enthusiasm and professional manner made me feel at ease with regards to how the evening would unfold.  I knew there was only so much I could do from California so I was reliant upon people I have never met.  I spoke with Catlyn on the phone once again to confirm the reservation and that everything was in place.  She assured me everything was good to go.  I was trusting the staff and the restaurant to come through for me.  A Town Car (not arranged through the restaurant FYI) picked up my two friends on Friday and drove them to Different Pointe of View.  Friday evening came, hours later so did the phone call.  Just hearing how happy and surprised they were on the phone assured me that they had a tremendous dining experience.  They said the food was "amazing", the service was "incredible" and that they could not have had a better evening at dinner.  Their experience held True to every promise that Catlyn had made, and in turn made me me feel like the trust I placed in the restaurant was more than respected.  The restaurant went above and beyond.  I could not of been more pleased.  I am so thankful to Catlyn and the staff at Different Pointe of View who played a part in my little surprise.  Thank you for helping me bring joy to two special ladies.  The way the evening went made me feel like they were just as important to the staff as they are to me.  Next time I am in Phoenix I will be stopping by to say hello and enjoy the food for myself, because I already know it is excellent.  Bravo DPOV!

S9nWO9TZZu7fMTfBKj_qaA.text: Best food in Arizona. The chef here is just amazing and the scallops are to die for.

Rv0uxzKq8R4xH5XTna2KiQ.text: What a great experience, wonderful view, excellent food choices and a very hard working friendly staff.  The entire evening was enjoyable.

iNljAFIimz1k4P0lbIPcIg.text: This is the place to go to if you just want to have a drink and sit, look out over the Valley and relax!  My new go to place definitely! The only downside here is the parking.  You park yourself, and when you step out of the car the ground is slanted which makes your brain feel like you are somewhat drunk...very weird feeling.  Then you huff and puff up the hill to the location...not that hard but I like to be dramatic. The building is 32 years old they told me, but, to me, looks older because of the design.  It is lovely, tho, and very serene. I had parked at the end where the parking lot ends facing the hill going down.  Now comes the fun when you leave.  You gotta go into reverse cause if you go into drive you shoot over the parking lot, down a super steep hill and kill yourself.  So, it's important you go into reverse, turn your car around carefully because all the smart people parked in the rows back of you and slowly get out of the parking spot.  Once you do that and straighten the car out it's literally all downhill...not scary once you get out of that parking spot. The head Manager of the restaurant have big delivery trucks that are scared to drive up there.  I get it totally with a big truck! Saturday night had a steady stream of couples coming in to sit, have a drink and stay for a little while before dinner (I guess).   Like I said, this is my new go-to place.  Very pretty, very serene--not cheap as my martini was like $13 or so--but so worth it just for the view and sitting pleasure.

mcDYFqqF-uESqSr-lWLGIw.text: Food and the view were simply amazing. Service was a bit slow. A great place for a date night

dBer51A39L_1H4TPe4yStA.text: The view is amazing and we were lucky to be there in time to watch the sun go down. We chose to eat outside which was taking a chance because when the sun went down it got cold pretty fast. I would have thought they would have had some heaters outside. Both the service and food were outstanding. We never felt rushed and we were given great suggestions for food. We also received information about the mountains and areas around the property. The restaurant is high up the hill so make sure you keep following the signs to the restaurant. There is also a great lounge area and we were planning on having an after dinner drink there but it was so cold inside, we had to leave. The restaurant was very cold also. I would have never been able to sit there and and enjoy my meal. We so wish we could have stayed to enjoy more time there. Hopefully they will take care of this.

k6H3aNCtPoRAYWMexDQcfg.text: Ate here back in Feb 2016 for a sampler as possible choice for my birthday dinner. I had the Lobster Bisque out on the terrace with my friend, and I must say it was the worst I have experienced. It tasted like a pudding (very sweet), with a dash of chili powder, and minute slivers of lobster. The price should have commanded a great Lobster Bisque. It prevented me from ever considering dinner there, even though the view is as beautiful as any place I know in Phoenix. Sorry about the delay in writing a review, but due too many bad food experiences with sizeable price tags, I have decided to speak the truth about food. If we all say nothing, bad becomes the order of the day.

BJCZbvLrmPXceeixY6gXoA.text: Tim Robbins was our server!!!  Just kidding, it was really Corey, but the resemblance was pretty amazing. Anyway, I had a fantastic dinner here the other day which started off with a delicious glass of  Seghesio Zinfandel ($12) and an amuse bouche that was some sort of minty-pea gazpacho soup. Both delicious, leaving me excited for the rest of the meal.   For my appetizer I got their Hydroponic Butter Lettuce Salad ($13) which was super tasty with the caramelized nectarine dressing. I found the the toasted pistachios one of the best parts of the salad as it helped offset the sweetness from the dressing, which was always a yummy experience in my mouth. The bread service came with choices between a foccacia and a mild sourdough to try with their three different spreads consisting of a goat cheese olive oil emulsion, some sort of pepper pesto olive oil, and a spicy butter mixture. The pepper pesto spread was the table favorite.  I ordered the Grilled Cedar River Marinated Hanger Steak ($32) that come atop a scrumptious basil blue cheese risotto mixed with chopped portabella mushrooms and drizzled with a roasted tomato garlic olive oil emulsion. Oh my gosh, so good! I was debating between the Hanger Steak or the Featured Risotto, but get the steak because you get the best of both worlds! My lovely date ordered Pork Tenderloin Noisettes ($26) that wasn't nearly as exciting as my entree, but still good.  Dessert time left us trying the Classic Creme Brulee ($9) and Apples on the Rocks ($9). The creme brulee was the typical rich taste, but it came with a buttermilk blue cheese cookie! Oh man, that led to another party in my mouth with the combo of sweet and salty goodness. The Apple dessert came in a lowball glass (get it, "on the rocks") which was pretty cute. It came with a scoop of apple spice ice cream and a scoop of vanilla cream ontop of an oatmeal cranberry cookie and drizzled with caramel. It was good, but the blue cheese cookie was really memorable so I recommend getting the brulee for that reason.  The restaurant is located on the top of North Mountain in North Phoenix with floor-to-ceiling glass windows. This creates a fantastic view overlooking Central Phoenix from wherever you are seated in the restaurant (but if you can, request to be my the window). Also, try and come around sunset because its really neat to see the transition from day to the sparkly lights at night. There is a patio that would be fun to dine at when the weather is cooler. I find the prices to be extremely fair with portions and taste, so don't let that deter you from trying this restaurant.  Five stars for impeccable service by Tim Robbins, aka Corey, quality tasting food, and, of course, the view! I want to come back very soon!

YvGBOPwmXRY0InXJr1wi6Q.text: Pricey cocktails for sure but tasty and the view can't be beat. Outside was chilly but lots of patio heaters

7PN3wrjhxH_MBjjp8BywPA.text: The view is great but everything else failed. 3 times!!  Ordered a Grey Goose Martini straight up shaken ice cold with blue cheese olives.   Came dirty and warm. Sent it back and I watched them make it from my table...made it with Absolute.   It's not that hard folks. Then it became MY FAULT. Never again. Don't waste your time.

_CVNP9nOZMdIVqvVYcAcUg.text: Gorgeous view. Food is good along with good service. They will make sure to meet your dietary restrictions. Their menu is small and the food comes in small portions for how much is costs. They try to fill you up with bread before hand so you don't leave hungry, but for people who are gluten free, that doesn't work too well. I would go back, but I will book a table on the outdoor patio and not wait all day to eat to ensure I don't leave hungry. The fish is really good and so is the streak. Wish there was more to eat there.

7EFVI6qMj12PB3YMEfDRng.text: My husband and I chose this restaurant for our wedding anniversary dinner. I'll start off by saying the views are beautiful and our dinner was delicious (compliments to the chef!!!) However, the service was not what we expected at such a nice restaurant.... not just the server but at the main entrance as well (outside) when we asked to have a photo taken and felt like such an inconvenience  to do so by the valet driver. Also... we were really surprised the restaurant didn't provide and free desert or drink on the house for it being such a big celebration. I've even had that at very casual restaurants and it's always so appreciated. The food and ambiance was great.. just expected more for the service and treatment at such a high end restaurant.

_gtX1RsRcpFDl4jfJ0H24w.text: Best view  in the city!  Awesome for a romantic date night this service was a little slow in the beginning but picked up toys there in the full most definitely made up for everything I got the surf and turf which was the biggest lobster I have yet to see on a plate and my wife got the filet mignon which was cooked to perfection.

It was perfectly prepared and paired with potatoes and some kind of pancakes.  Normally I would not think pork tenderloin and pancakes to complement each other but they do.  The presentation if the food was fantastic... pleasing to both the eye and the palette.  I will go back.

7BLyFk9bj2BP_MNAbeQNig.text: We did a double date here for restaurant week and it was amazing. The ambiance was really nice, excellent service, wonderful food, and the best view in Phoenix. Highly recommend!

li4E_7kH5TQNp46GeKhJcg.text: I made a reservation a couple of weeks in advance for a special occasion and was glad I did! The service, food, ambiance, and views were wonderful! I would suggest reserving an outdoor table on the patio in the warmer months for the best possible view of the city. In the winter months make sure to reserve a table by a window, otherwise it's hard to see the view.  The food didn't disappoint. I had the Corn Quinoa but tried the Stonefish from others with me, and it was incredible. The desserts are pretty small, not really sharing size so keep that in mind. As for prices, most entrees are around $30 and most desserts are around $10.  The only negative was the scotch and whiskey selection. It was very small. For instance, I wanted a Glenmorangie 21 but they only had bottles aged much less.  Tip: How to get all the way up here, when you enter the Hilton follow the little signs, they will take you all the way up and continue until you see "Public Parking for Different Pointe of View."

Also minor note for such a high-end restaurant the bread was served ice cold. Service was impeccable. Again view is lovely.

6sF_5WKXvGBHGdGkF5wNag.text: Let's start with the view offered on the terrace.  It is breathtaking!  Grab a glass of wine and get there in time for the sunset. You truly will be in awe. My suggestion is to arrive early enough to do this before your reservation time.   Once inside at dinner, we requested window seating.  It was nice to look over the city while enjoying the meal. From salad, to steak, to dessert the meal was delicious.  I truly can offer no complaints about the service, atmosphere, or meal. Even if you aren't staying at the resort, you should definitely find time to eat here during your Phoenix stay. It was well worth the cost.

bEZFebtTjJz0POD5WkmpDw.text: The view here is AMAZING!!! Food is very pricey but to be expected, tasted really good. Service was decent.  Came here for a work dinner one night and got to see the sunset on the patio. The hor d'oeuvres were not very good but nicely presented. The view on the patio was very beautiful! We eventually got seated for dinner and had a 3 course prix fixe dinner. The salad was very fresh, my steak entree was delicious and cooked right. The dessert was the highlight of my meal, loved it!  The service was decent, decor is good, and the bathrooms are clean.

S6LpYPcgRK-Xf7Kjqo-MLw.text: The food was amazing, the views were even better. My only disappointment was I made reservations for 10 people for my husband's birthday.they sailed to even acknowledge the slightest little card or complimentary dessert or anything to celebrate his special occasion. this was a big disappointment as many other restaurants we could have gone to do acknowledge celebrations.I know I could have ordered a cake three days prior however life just got in the way and I forgot to order but I just assumed that something special would have been at his management should know that this is not a good way to get future business.  The other issue was that nine of our dishes were incredibly delicious, very well done but the birthday boys short ribs fell short of that. He stated that it was very dry and although he tried to moisten it in the sauce he just couldn't eat anymore. When he informed the waiter of such, nothing was done to rectify this.

JmHuFk9nUsfoy5eUL8-xdA.text: My boyfriend and I have been here twice in the past year, and both visits have been exceptional. The view is absolutely gorgeous. It's also upscale food that doesn't feel pompous or overworked.   The service has always been lovely and the dirty martini spot on  I have had the duck entree which I highly recommend.  Overall, I definitely recommend this restaurant for either drinks or full dinner, especially to wow some out of town guests.

8pvkfG7i4jOLURZ4sRzJSA.text: Where to go for a special occasion...must have fabulous City views, great service and food to temp all the senses...well look no further!...Different Point of View is the place. From the  moment we arrived we knew we were in good hands... the evening was cool and rainy and the valet greeted us with a large umbrella, the receptionist was warm and welcoming and  waiter was very accommodating and helped seat us a lovely table with a great view...even a miss delivered appetizer was handled professionally. The beef carpaccio was light and perfectly dressed, the beet salad with gorgonzola was refreshing and the perfect setup for our entrees...scollops and port tenderloin...both of which were prepared to perfection and delicious. Ohhh and the lemon drop martini was the perfect blend of sweet and tart and the Spanish white a perfect pairing for the scallops. Overall a wonderful evening...great company, beautiful restaurant, great food and caring and attentive service. Very happy with my first visit to Different Point of View!

1ghcyRzuHbxaYNpeRsxj8g.text: My bf brought me here for our anniversary last year. I don't even remember what we got, but everything was delicious and he Service was really great! I'd love to go again!

u4-qJnqyWPXNzwM9BFqYQw.text: Enjoyed an amazing dinner during restaurant week. I had the bass with Lobster Bisque. Husband had lamb sausage with swordfish. Delicious! New favorite restaurant! Stunning views. Impeccable service. We'll be back!

HzUgMXjG7xHKcEj84HQYyw.text: Four stars for the food but six for the view so we average out at five. Dinner was very good, not great. My wife had the short ribs and I had the chef's special which was Chilean Sea Bass. One of the few times I think my dinner was better than what she ordered. She enjoyed her meal while I thought it was very similar to her fall-apart roasts she bakes at home. This was our first visit for dinner and will return to test other entrees but to also enjoy the splendid views.

gI86ngMHhZB57rlVz_8dLA.text: So if you want to impress that special someone come here. The view is amazing.  The food let's just say I had a few orgasms while dinning. Ordered the short braised short ribs. If it's on the menues just order. Desert was margarita gelato and creme bru le. Order the cream brue le.   In short. Is it expensive. It's pricy. Is it worth it YES!

g3SLvzH7vy3Gac0BWNsODQ.text: One of our "go to" restaurants in the valley. Stupendous views, great service and the lobster bisque... don't get me started! We have gone with friends for Easter brunch. Amazing!

kBvTUDLGmwHvePi5-CIMcg.text: My husband surprised me with a date night and as we drove half a mile from our home I didn't know what to expect . The drive up to the restaurant was a lil tight but when we go up to the top , the view was beautiful. Our reservation was late since we had a toddler to put to sleep but we did end up getting there early.. We decided to get a drink on the lounge downstairs before we went up stairs for dinner, the bartender was very nice and personable I asked for a lemon drop martini that o haven't had for years .. It was amazing . When we went upstairs we had an amazing table right by the window to overlook the twinkling city lights . The food was delicious , you could tell the chef is amazing with his pairings and preparations .. I had the scallops which were the size of my head lol and my husband had an amazingly marinated and flavorful filet that was prepared to perfection ... What can I say even my vegetables tasted incredible like they were marinated before hand . The staff was on top of everything .. Took away my plate I said thank you .. "With pleasure" the bus boy states " no really thank you" I say " no no it's my pleasure o love to clean" he says lol what a great staff very on point and ready to cater to your ever need. The  architecture is very beautiful .. So after dinner we decided to visit the many fountains and check out the scenery . We just had a really great time on the rare occasion that we do go out . Thank you Different Point of View for the beautiful evening .

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband and I exploring the patio and shamelessly taking date night selfies .

3W19-KpmwR46FDh2VFQI7A.text: We went here on our last night in Arizona.  The food was exceptionally good and the view of the Phoenix skyline was impressive.  Both my husband and I had the Lobster Bisque which was off the charts delicious and creamy with the right balance of sweetness.  I had the Cobia while my husband had the steak special.  Both were cooked to perfection with a great balance of flavors.  We ended the meal by splitting a deliciously decadent, creamy Creme Brulee.  It was the perfect restaurant to end our stay in Arizona.  If you want to go to a restaurant for a special occasion, romantic meal or just a splurge you can't go wrong here.

eIZqsENLZb0hnUyljEbFIw.text: Amazing view of Phoenix.  Have only had drinks by the outdoor fire pits - no food to rate. But! What comes with each drink purchase while sitting by the fire are their homemade alcohol infused marshmallows on long sticks to toast!  Amaretto was the marshmallow flavor tonight and it's a must to head to the top of this Hilton Resort to sit outside, soak up the view, and enjoy.

RtSGWKiJhC2r_z20Y6bCvg.text: Came here recently for an anniversary. Would have given the place 5 stars but my boyfriend called a month in advance to get a window seat to enjoy the views and they did not deliver on that. Anyways with that being said the food and service was great. The views are to die for and was definitely a memorable experience. For a high end restaurant the prices are affordable at like 25-40$ generally per entree. We will be back again!

MMjzaIlg7vfrs8WI6kTpRg.text: Wow..one of the best dining experiences I ever had. The restaurant is absolutely beautiful and makes the Tapatio hotel seem 100x better.  It is an up-scale fine dining restaurant with breathtaking views of the city. The service is timely and professional. The food was remarkable, the grilled shrimp and forbidden rice I had here was one of the best dishes I ever had.

WDbrWtij3OlTPkYsP4bfvA.text: Wow wow wow! What a view! Everything else is secondary. This place is amazing! And the food is great also!

QU4hfo1PNQvDfh-3p37oDg.text: Very romantic and elegant place. Enjoyed a 4 course meal on New Years Eve. Not only do you enjoy the amazing food but the view is also breathe taking. We will definitely be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Romantic place to ring in the New Years!

xrdfCW0R9jK7IheT2Q5SzA.text: Came here last night for an early Valentines dinner since my husband won't be in town.  Let me just say that the view from this place is amazing!  Very nice restaurant up hidden in the mountain.    We started with an appetizer was something called belly pig and it looked weird but was delicious.    I had the seared fish and my husband had the filet mignon.   For dessert we had the peanut butter with banana icecream.  The patio and bar area was cool to hang out and have a drink before and after dinner.  They even brought out some marshmallows for us to put over the fire.  The only complaint is that our waiter tried to rush us in placing our order.  Other than that I would return and recommend this place.

Xf2fm4ae26fUT5T1hnz2RA.text: We hadn't been to Different Pointe of View for at least 12 years, so we decided to make a visit during Restaurant Week.  First off, the restaurant can boast 5 star views of the Valley...truly stunning!  The service was quite good too...everyone that came by the table was professional and friendly.  The decor is actually quite dated when you really look at it...however, you are so distracted by the view that you barely notice.  The food was 2 stars at best and quite disappointing.  We started with the pear and butter leaf salad (best food of the night) and the lobster bisque (my husband said it tasted burnt), continued on with the pork chop (dry and chewy) and the fish special (overcooked with rice that was crunchy) and finished with the carrot cake (something crunchy other than nuts in there...not sure what that was) and the peanut butter chocolate mousse (hard, didn't taste at all like peanut butter and appeared to be full of sugar/caramel in the center).  In my opinion, they need to step up their food game in order to be competitive with the many first rate restaurants in the Valley!

iv33xmknTXHvKJZsehqsgQ.text: Over rated. Staff seating tables weren't very friendly at all. Food was okay. View was great. Management needs to talk to the girls hostess though.

WDJDGvX03izNOFIMevP3Ag.text: Very awesome place for a special dinner.  Lovely starters (lobster bisque and housemade ricotta), very attentive and relaxed waiter(thank you!).  Entree that my spouse had (bistro steak) was tender and juicy. My entree, however, was --- eh.  I ordered the vegetarian plate, and with all the wonderful vegies and creativity of this kitchen, I got pasta with a tomato sauce and a few roasted vegies (the vegies were terrific).  Really?  There are so many creative ways to put a great vegetarian dish, and I got pasta with tomato sauce??  So disappointed.  That said, the dessert was great, the views wonderful, staff awesome.  Just up the vegie plate!!!!!

VMG8OeKjCBrydzSBEGtP7A.text: After hearing about the dazzling views, wonderful food and intimate atmosphere, I'd be saving my first trip to DPOV for a special occasion. When two of our closest friends announced that they'd be moving to California, we decided that the perfect occasion had arisen!  The location feels secluded and tucked away, but rest assured - the rumors about those views are True! Even on a cloudy night, it was beautiful. We walked the gorgeous, landscaped grounds a bit and continued up the stairs to the restaurant, where we were seated at an indoor table overlooking the city. Immediately, we decided that a bottle of wine would be the perfect call to kick off our farewell, and shared a lovely pinot noir. (Anticipating their raved-about steaks, of course.) We kicked off the evening with some fresh oysters that were fantastic! Each of us ordered a steak, and I asked for mine to be medium-rare. Unfortunately, my steak was pretty overdone, and while I indicated this cutting into it, I said I'd go ahead and accept it, as I hate to send food back unless it's inedible. The waiters were kind enough to make this up to me with a free dessert that was delicious! The waiters, too, deserve a shout-out for being absolutely wonderful and keeping our glasses (and bellies) full!  After dessert, we strolled around the patio, and went down a level to check out the beautiful fire feature. I'd definitely recommend this place for a special occasion... it was a lovely way to wish our friends well before their move!

JPiV30MuWHQoIgwerbiwaQ.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the Valley. It's worth the price. The food is excellent because of Chef Anthony DiMuro. The view is spectacular. The wait staff is well trained ... excellent. It's our 'go to' restaurant for all the special times.

s2Rksuj5JIrhAPKYstIVwg.text: Just an average restaurant nothing special probably not worth the price. Go for the view not the food

8z4LsbcTO66ph5qfowAllw.text: My Wife and I were taken out to dinner to here by another couple that is friends of ours as a thank you.  Oh was it a thank you. We started out with drinks on the patio while we waited for our table reservation to start.  The view across Phoenix was exceptional.  The drinks where nothing special, as we started with some beers, and my wife a Santa Margherita Pino Grigio. The ambiance outside was fantastic as we had a reservation for 7 that allowed us to enjoy the Famous Arizona sunsets.  Once our table was ready, we continued to enjoy outside for a bit longer.  It was fantastic to just sit, relax, and commiserate with our friends with out feeling rushed into our seating. After going in, we were at at a table next to the window, the only issue with the seating was that their was a small but powerful light shining down into my eyes at table position 2, but our server Ian was more that happy to fix it by turning the ambient lighting down in the entire restaurant so it wasn't grating on my vision. The dinner was started with drinks, Crown Royal Cask no16 for me, beer for My friend and his wife, and my wife was still working.on her 500ml bottle of Santa Margherita. We ordered a full 5 course meal.   My wife and I split the Seared Berkshire Pork Belly as my appetizer, the other couple had the Sweet Italian Sausage and Fresh Mozzarella Raviolis.  The arrived hot, and Fresh.  The flavor was incredible, and the presentation a master-piece. I then had the Belgium Endive with Blood Oranges.  I will say that this was in fact one of the best salads I have ever had.  I ended up sharing a leaf with each of my friends and wife just so they could taste it. We took a short break from dinner, talked, order more drinks (beers for all of us except my wife who had a Stella Red), and then shortly after dinner was presented.  I say it was a presentation, as again, the attention to detail and visual aesthetics that went into the plate presentation where astounding. I had the Rosemary Sented Grilled Venison Tenderloin.  This was cooked to a perfect medium-rare, sliced into medallions, then placed on what could be described as sweet potato hash browns.  The Port Demi Glace was just perfect.  The presentation was beautiful, but the flavor was incredible! Both woman ordered the grilled New York Strip Steak.  My wife had her prepared Black & Blue.  For those of you who don't know, this is difficult to do as it is blacked, but not charred on the outside, & only slightly warm on the inside.   Blackened not charred  means the meat is crispy, but no large hunks of carbon hanging on the outside of the steak.  It is absolutely fantastic when done correctly, and can be a pit fall and ruin the steak when done poorly.  This was the epitome of a Black & Blue steak.  Perfection.  My friend's wife had hers medium-well, and while not my cup of tea, it was still very moist and tender, but deep read in the center.   My friend had the Brandy Vanilla Poached Maine Lobster.  It was also just fantastic.  The lobster was silken in texture, not a single rubbery or chewy bit.   For dessert the women split the Chocolate and Sweet Basalmic Cherry Cake.  It was gone almost as soon as it hit the table top. I had the Warm Cinnamon Bread Pudding.  It was good, but the sauce was really what made it.  Wasn't fond of the partially spun sugar that it was topped with, but only becuase it was the ONLY part of the meal (the garnish on the desert that is) that felt not 100% authentic, but kind of short cut.  (It was done on a mat instead of the traditional hanging style that I would have preffered).  But seriously, that how nitt-picky you have to be to find something wrong with our meal. You have to decide that a completely subjective choice by the pastry chef wasn't the best call.  Seriously though, it was very good.  The coffee after the meal was good.  Strong, some what acidic, but not bitter.  My wife drank it black while I needed just a touch of cream.  Over all, the quality and presentation of the food at Different Point of View, as well as the exceptional service provided by Ian made it THE most memorable date, let alone double date I have ever been on. We will be back.

XLHaeBiiQmy0XBfVa4ectA.text: The view is amazing.  Menu is really blunt, best dish  would be duck confetti. Nice place to go on a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h6r08_MnwnD9doQbq1Z24g.text: I have been here many times for various events and yet it is showing as my first check in. Weird. At any rate I was here for my birthday dinner with four other girlfriends this past Friday.  The company I was with was worth five stars in itself along with the view. Our server was friendly although preoccupied and quite busy. It took awhile to receive menus when we sat down which was a little odd but we shrugged it off. We ordered two bottles of the Arizona Stronghold wine, the duck confit ravioli, pork belly, short ribs, steelhead trout, filet, and the pork tenderloin. Holy cow the food (all of it) was absolutely amazing. Even the bread along with the three different dips for it was delicious.  We shared all of our dishes and everything was melt in your mouth good and succulent.  The pork belly really did melt in your mouth and the sauce..oh my we were fighting (playfully) over dipping our bread in the sauce. My steelhead trout was the best I have had to date. I was so full but I made sure to eat every last bite (my stomach was not happy with me). All the other ladies throughly enjoyed their meals as well. How we actually had room for dessert I still have no idea but we all took one for the team and ordered dessert as well. I was surprised with a happy birthday creme brulee from the chef which was just as heavenly as the rest of my meal. The wine,  the company, the food, the service  (once things slowed down) was perfect. I cannot wait to come back again!

MbdMzrySl5DS2FXKI4raRQ.text: We went there for our anniversary, as we expected the view was amazing and it's 5/5. The food on the other hand was Ok, a very good prime fillet but it was ruined by the sauce, which was a little salty and they used a lot of A1 sauce :( so that 3/5. The wine was good but not what I expected 3.5/5 The waiter was really nice but for some reason he was incapable of smiling 3.5/5 The desert was very good, but I've been to other restaurant and they always give you complementary desert for your anniversary, but they didn't 4/5 the noise level was high, I did expected to be lower, that's the reason I decide to go there on our anniversary 2/5

CH_KIptetB0CfKe8BQqM8A.text: Exceptional. Fantastic. Mind blowing. Impressive. Just a few words that come to mind. Also, make reservations.   5 course meal called the chiefs special. Not even sure if it's on the menu (?). 5 course meal of pure decadence. I'd recommend not eating the bread because the food is outstandingly filling. We couldn't even eat our dessert as we were too stuffed. I believe it's 97.00 per person.   Considering the food, the ambiance, exceptional service plus the amazingly beautiful views, it's worth every penny. Perfect for a birthday, anniversary, or celebration of any sort.  Have a cocktail one level below at the cocktail lounge and soak in the view.  Let the stress dissipate and enjoy the company you're with.

jtEiRFROjoZK-v0hBAY0qg.text: I decided to come here for my birthday dinner, and made a great choice. It didn't start off great as they lost our reservation, but were able to still get us seated pretty quickly. Service was great, he was very attentive all night. And the food...oh my, melt in my mouth amazing. The pork tenderloin, corn cakes, risotto, steak, vegetables. Everything. We had such an amazing evening, I am so glad we came.

8v-P_yFhYJnAHxgWbuUWCg.text: Way overbooked with a resultant game of musical chairs in the waiting area while we waited for our table.   This heavy overbooking caused delays and a window seating request that wasn't able to be fulfilled.   This is a higher end restaurant that caters to its regulars more than tourists. Don't waste your time with the frustration of being sat right in front of the kitchen and near a waiter station.

NXqDo_9eGwiGIprbAkP35g.text: Three of us had dinner at the Different Pointe of View on the outdoor terrace.  The food was absolutely amazing and the service was impeccable.  We had Ian as our server and received such fantastic service that I would definitely ask for him by name.  He was very knowledgeable about the menu, the wine list, and even the view and surrounding area.  He was one of the best servers we have ever had.  The risotto is absolutely amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View of downtown Phoenix.

UQfbJo1xfJUAR105-eEhew.text: Took my wife here for our 1 year anniversary. The view from the patio is exemplary. The service is top notch and the food is absolutely delicious. They have a good wine list. Recommend the lobster bisque soup as your first course.

bydK36G4Uod9LcmC-bupWQ.text: My favorite part about my first experience at Different Pointe of View was that the food was just as incredible as the view. My wife took me for my birthday and it was a first for us both. We went at night and had a great table w/ a view. The service was incredible as well. My wife and I both started w/ a bowl of Lobster bisque and we both had the Filet Mignon w/blue cheese and a reduction sauce that was phenomenal. We had Zero complaints and the satisfaction of the moment left little room for words. We added a few cocktails to top it all off. I would definitely recommend dining here.

SwRSz7r9dbDaj2AVbU-8BA.text: My wife and I came here to celebrate our anniversary and I have to say the atmosphere and the view are both great. The food was pretty good, we both had the lobster with scallops and enjoyed it. Overall we were pleased with our experience and would recommend anyone to go and check it out at least once, and it is worth the 4 star but I just don't see it as being a place we would frequent.

MO_8hPIcb-eSQK1E4mp2mA.text: We enjoyed the most amazing anniversary meal ever at Different Pointe of View. Phoenix magazine rated them as the most romantic restaurant and we have to agree. The dining room is gorgeous and the views over the city are amazing! Our server, Nash, was absolutely the best. He and his assistant, Yohanan, gave the best service and made the evening delightful. My husband ordered the prime fillet of beef and substituted the fingerling potatoes which were out of this world. I, at the suggestion of Nash, ordered the  chicken dish which was seasoned perfectly and just delicious. We, also, had the beet salad which was very good and for dessert my husband had the creme brulee and I had the carrot cake, both excellent choices. Nash is also a very good photographer and went above and beyond in capturing moments from our special night.

29Bc1qmA7Y2VhG1w9zASjw.text: Came with my hubby to celebrate our wedding anniversary, and was not disappointed. Service and food was amazing!! And the beautiful view of Phoenix at night was incredible. Definitely coming back. Would love to thank our waiter Luis for an amazing service. He went over and beyond to make this celebration memorable. Thank you Luis, you're awesome!! Recommend this spot for a romantic dinner or night out with fiends.

ep9os9VrxPSee0ciQLBsmA.text: I love this place.  The view the restaurant layout the deck with the fire pits the bar area.  They decorate it differently for the holidays but Christmas was my favorite.  Really a special and unique spot.  The food was delicious too - from their salads to desert they are on point.  I do agree with some of the other reviewers that this is an older hotel resort so be prepared for some character but no way is this place run down.  It's truly a hidden phoenix gem. Will be back often

kn5YxM8gGatbyJk1f5iwnA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant!  We came with a party of seven and we got a table with a gorgeous view. We had our appetizers and while we were waiting for our entrees our server recommended that we go outside and look at the view.. I didn't know that was a cue and my fiance proposed here! I couldn't be happier! It was a beautiful view, the staff was incredibly nice (our server was AWESOME!) and the food was absolutely delicious! We cannot wait to return for our anniversary!

khHuDY8KfqTQe5AGDYN06g.text: It was recommended to me to try Different Pointe of View and was not disappointed!  Joe and Bill ensured that our evening was superb!  To start with our table was right by the window and overlooked the gorgeous view of Phoenix at dusk...Appetizers were amazing!  Pork belly, ravioli, white truffle risotto and oysters were the selections. Followed by our delectable entrees! The short ribs were out of this world and the Steelhead w/shrimp risotto was melt in your mouth. Followed by a special anniversary dessert and we added the creme brulee-delicious! q8ej7blRTIvqnnbpgOGUhw.text: Whatever you do DO NOT ORDER STEAK. J/k I went out to a dinner here about 9 years ago. My only problem that I still have with this place was the quality of the actual beef. Or maybe how it was cooked in not to sure. The texture.... I'm not sure. But I still crave that stupid steak from this place. I have traveled the world several times and have dined at many fine restaurants. This one takes the bees knees.

VQ7I5ErU4xB3x-Jl1ksqkA.text: OMG! The food was so amazing. Visited for the Restaurant Week. Appetizer was lobster bisque and wagyu beef cheek braised with roasted cauliflower. Bisque was too rich and of one note for my palate. The wagyu beef cheek was amazing!!! I had to use the knife to cut the cauliflower, but not the beef! It was fork tender and melt in mouth. Entree was duck confit risotto and grilled salmon with basil risotto cake ( chefs daily feature). Duck was good but nothing memorable. The salmon was terrific! It was accompanied by a smokey sauce which elevated the dish to top notch. Dessert was chocolate espresso mouse with orange sabayon. It was not as remarkable as it sounds. Next dessert was almond cake with strawberry rhubarb sauce. This was pretty good and was fun to eat. The atmosphere and view was so peaceful and amazing. Would have given 5 stars but the service was a bit underwhelming and the desserts did not surprise me. So have to settle with 4 stars. Definitely worth for $44 per person.
