-vUfQJgQNOQyr2KhS5q6nw.text: This place has simply gorgeous views of Phoenix. Two levels of this restaurant have extensive glass panoramas that take advantage of the height of the hill on which the restaurant sits.  That being said, the high prices of this restaurant make you think you're getting haute cuisine, outstanding customer service, in addition to the beautiful vistas. This unfortunately fell short with us.  While the food was very well executed, the menu was predictable and dull. We had the venison and the filet. Both were cooked to perfection. The portions were smaller than I had expected, and the desserts were even smaller than I thought possible. For the money I was charged,  I would expect a small, yet satisfying portion. I'm NOT a big eater by a long shot, but had I come in hungry, I would've left hungry, even after appetizer, entree and dessert.  The service was satisfactory for a cheaper restaurant. At these prices, I had expected superior service. We were left waiting for 10 minutes after we finished our appetizers before the server took our order for dinner (we spaced our dinner out and didn't order everything up front). The server didn't ask us if we wanted additional cocktails either. We received better service from the runners than we did our server.  All in all, this is a great place to go for a special occasion, but if you want superior service, reasonable portion sizes, and interesting menu, go to Elements at Sanctuary. The view isn't as "good" but it makes up for it in all other ways. Or consider Orange Sky at the Talking Stick. Julio there gave us the best service we've had since moving to the valley.

93qquIleKAcmJMtpCN28Jw.text: Beautiful place. Beautiful view. Expensive, but that was expected.   Was the only place we could find open Christmas night.    The good was very good and we had a really nice time.   Service was very very good.

rPK97hFR1vmAm5aeZKOz1w.text: This place was absolutely perfect.  My husband and I came here to celebrate my birthday and Luis and Austin took great care of us.  The food, wine and service were all impeccable.  My only complaint is that the Manhattan I started with, their West of Manhattan, didn't taste much like rye whiskey and was a bit too sweet for me.  Other than that, Luis recommended both the pork chop on the menu and the pork tenderloin addition and we ordered both.  Fantastic.  The wagyu beef cheek appetizer was melt-in-your-mouth.  We asked if we could sit on the balcony for our dessert and coffee to enjoy the view and quietness and they accommodated.  This place is a must, you won't regret it.  Ask for Luis and tip the man a whole bunch, he deserves it

8zHwdYKFYQjX0RmCSVYcYQ.text: I came here with my two sisters a couple weeks ago and all three of us agreed it was one of the best experience dining experiences any of us had ever had. We had gotten a limousine so that we didn't need a DD but we were disappointed when the driver informed us he would have to drop us off at the resort so we could take a shuttle to the top (the road is too steep and narrow for a limo). The friendly shuttle driver told us that this is a common surprise to groups coming for special occasion parties like the prom. So, just something to be aware of. Once we got up to the top, it really did feel like the place was built right into the mountain top. You can see the exposed rock of the cliffside surrounding the entrance. It was very cool. We rode an elevator to the top floor and you could see why they wanted to be as high up as possible. The view was stunning. I am sure it would be gorgeous at sunset but this was around 8pm and I personally really enjoyed being able to see all the city lights shimmering below us. The design of the restaurant is upscale but understated; they keep everything neutral so that the large wall of floor to ceiling windows is the main focus.  We decided to do the tasting menu and I am so glad we did. It was worth every penny ($80pp plus $40 for wine). The portions were a decent size and every one was delicious and unique. My sisters requested no shellfish or veal (and unfortunately I had to comply) so the chef substituted two of the dishes with something else. Our waiter was very diligent about making sure that we were all happy. We started with a piece of pork belly with wild mushrooms on a bed of bleu cheese polenta. This was a surprising first course (I think it was supposed to be shrimp) but I loved it! The pork melted in my mouth and I loved the tangy bleu cheese mixed with the creamy polenta. We had gotten the wine pairing as well so the sommelier made his appearance and explained that since we were changing up the dishes he was changing up the wines as well. He selected a very light red that had enough tannins to complement the pork and the cheese but was still light enough for a first course. This wine is not on their list but he had a couple bottles that he was trying out himself and he picked that one for us since he knew it would go with the dish that the chef had changed around for us. I couldn't believe how accommodating the staff was to their guests and how coordinated and educated they were. Second course we got a Pillsbury Rose which was also fantastic and the sommelier told us all about the history of this local winery and some stories about the AZ wine culture in general. It was awesome. The wine went perfectly with the salad we were served of assorted micro-greens with fresh currants and a tangy, fruity vinaigrette. A nice surprise was that under the greens were some hamachi sashimi. The fish was delectable and the salad was an explosion of flavors. I love dried currants in baked goods and currant jam but I have never in my life even seen a fresh currant, never mind bunches of them still on the vine. It was very cool! The next course was the fish course, accompanied by a crisp white blend. I am not a fan of sea bass but this one was cooked perfectly and it was a different type that was pink like salmon. I confess it did not convert me to being a sea bass lover but I loved the vegetables it was served with so much that I scraped up the remaining sauce with the rest of the bread in the bread basket (which was a very tasty focaccia, btw). The last course was the highlight of the whole experience. It was medallions of venison tenderloin. They were well-done (which is how I like my meat) but still completely fork-tender. The sauce for this dish was equally delectable, a sweet red wine reduction. The flavors in this dish were fantastic and the portion size was so large that my sisters had to take half of theirs home. The wine for this dish was a wonderful red that was so amazing I am going to go hunt it down and I will buy at least one bottle no matter how much it costs. I managed to save a bit to go with my chocolate cake dessert. The cake was good but it also came with a small cup of a super-thick and creamy hot chocolate that was out-of-this world. I thought it was great that we each got to pick our own dessert but my sisters both ended up not caring for theirs. One ordered the Apples on the Rocks, which is the one all the Yelpers raved about but it was completely tasteless and boring. It tasted like they had messed up and forgotten a few ingredients (like sugar?). My other sister ordered the chocolate and chestnuts dessert which was at least passable but somewhat blah. The boring desserts were not a big deal, though, since by that point we were sooo full!  It was such a fantastic experience from start to finish I really think this is one of those places every Phoenician must go at least once. Great food, great service, great ambiance. I highly recommend!

GINSAQU1jXqrn-V9YCgtIA.text: Short and sweet: My experience at POV is a really mixed bag.  Excellent service, great view, romantic setting, some of the food and drinks taste fantastic, but the skimpy amount of food offered was astonishing and very disappointing - so much so that its a sad joke if you've come here for a meal.  If wasn't for the 6 pieces of bread I ate, I would have left hungry after dropping $150.  Much of what we were served was sparse and "micro," plus severely bitter greens, which left both my mouth and my wallet feeling ripped off.  See my photos of what we ate.    Wanted to take my wife out to dinner somewhere special, so I made reservations at POV for January 17, 2015 based on Yelp recommends.  She really appreciated that I took her out to such a nice place, bless her heart.  We arrived about a half hour before sunset because I thought it would be fun for us to watch it go down - it WAS fun, great view, had our drinks served to us on the outside veranda then moved to our window table inside.  Drinks were perfect and tasty, but with tax were just shy of $28 for two small drinks.    Ambiance is impressive and classy, but no background music was heard.  Bread was presented to us almost immediately, a generous combination of focaccia and sourdough - tasted good, but wasn't warm.  The meager amount of basil dipping sauce tasted great, but they "ran out" of it at the point when I asked for more bread.  It seems the chef made a special effort to make more for us, and did so, which I appreciated.   But to run out of ANY key staple item like this isn't good.  Appetizers.   She had the Pear Salad ($13) - the menu clearly misleads when it says it consists of "pears" (she got tiny bits of pears). I kid you not, it came to her with about half a handful of some kind of green sprouty looking grass plopped on the plate.  The "pears" consisted of 3 nearly invisible round scoops (maybe half a teaspoon each) of pears, another teaspoon of cheese and some thin dribbles of sauce splattered on this HUGE plate.  The size of the plate literally dwarfed the so-called  "salad" - it was ludicrous.  I mean, I could have played a game of chess on the plate and would never have touched any part of the salad.  Sure, the wife said it tasted great, but REALLY?  Four itty bitty half-bites? The pear and cheese components could easily fit into the center ring of a teacup saucer with room to spare.    I ordered the oysters, which turned out to be 5 of the smallest (1.5 inch - maybe) oysters I have ever seen, laid out on a bed of SALT with rosemary leaves (not edible).  The oysters tasted great, but again, I'm not a midget so why serve me a micro appetizer?  ENTREES  Short ribs. For once they told the truth - these were VERY short ribs!  They were the smallest short ribs I've EVER been served - at 1"x2.5" - on top of a creamy rice mix that tasted just as good as I could get from a box of Rice-A-Roni.  I forced myself to eat it - it didn't taste bad, but - meh - it was oh so ordinary.  The meat tasted excellent, but really?  All that for $35?  This was billed as an entree, but you could sure fool me!  Even most appetizers have more meat than this entree..  I could have ordered a really large steak plus much more for that price at a really good restaurant.  And the butternut squash Risotto advertised in the menu as part of the meal was just the thinnest paintbrush swipe of paste...I could see the plate through it.  Not even worth putting on the menu in my opinion. Then there was a clump of limp wilted spinach-like greens between the rice and the meat.  Those greens were soooo bitter that it totally ruined my palate for the rest of the food.  When I asked our waiter if he had tasted the greens he responded by telling me that they were grown locally by some young kids who were trying to make some inroads selling food to them (thus avoiding an answer to my question).  I asked him again if he had tasted it, and he replied that he had not.  Folks, if the waiter at a place this high-end serves his guests anything he has not personally tasted, then he's not doing his job.  On my way out of the restaurant I deliberately snaked my way through some tables to see if anyone else had left those greens on their plate, and sure enough I saw some plates that had.  Hey chef!  Get a clue! (or do you even bother to check and see what your customers leave on their plates?)    My wife fared much better with two fish fillets and 4 medium prawns on a bed of rice and greens.  She said it tasted great.  I was VERY glad she was happy with her meal.  If she had voiced any displeasure, I would have sent it all back.  I won't go back.  I would have had a better meal at many other restaurants I can think of.  The view and service are nice to haves - but the food is paramount - and for what you're charging, you should be ashamed to offer so little on many of the plates we tried, and fail to ensure that EVERY ITEM on those plates tastes great and isn't misrepresented on the menu

le1KkE59HW3pv6jnM2OTXg.text: While the view is spectacular, I was a little disappointed in the taste of the food. We all chose the first and second recommendations of the waiter.  Beef cheeks were a great appetizer.  The salads took over 45 minutes to arrive; however, the main dishes did come in a more timely fashion.  The wait staff was very nice.  Go for drinks and the view!

bOis4uxy6-8wMCb9dU79Pw.text: This place lived up to all of our expectations. The view is amazing and the food and service were exceptional. The duck confit risotto starter was beyond delicious. My wife had the Butter Poached Lobster with squid ink crayfish ravioli. I had the Bistro Bison Steak. Perfection! Dessert was not too be missed. The tea ice cream was out of this world and the creme brulee was crazy good. This place is a must for any special occasion.

ONKFpInKe26ofsNBzILYQQ.text: The service was great, as well the atmosphere. Uncredible view!  Unfortunately, the lobster was overcooked. (Very chewy)

aXI8cqtVGiCustthRfgGRQ.text: See life through this point of view. Definitely eat dinner from this point of view, and certainly enjoy a moment from this point of view.   I could do this review in three words.... "Awesome. MUST GO"   That being said I will attempt to give you a bit of background and reasoning. However, it's Awesome, just go!  The view is truly something to behold. From a high point get a view of downtown PX as dusk fall and evening becomes night. Make sure to make reservations for a table by the window. Then as the stars begin to shine move to the patio with your drink to view the display that is the natural beauty of our world in the night sky.   My meals and service have always been top notch.  Do not go here for a quick meal. This is a must do enjoyable evening event. Also, don't leave your wallet at home. This splendor doesn't come cheap but also not overpriced by any means.   Finish your evening with a cigar and scotch on the patio. Choose the right time of year so it is not too hot and enjoy.   And THAT.....Is my point of view.

wGd4f6vUYFUrnBPhJLZBsg.text: This restaurant is absolutely on my top 5 for favorite fine dining in Phoenix. As I was here for a staycation during Memorial Day long weekend, I had the pleasure of dining here twice. First night was in the restaurant (upstairs) for Arizona Restaurant Week, with a 3 course dinner for $44. Second night was in the lounge (downstairs) for appetizers and cocktails.  Ambience: Although this restaurant is 30+ years, it is pretty well kept. As soon as you walk into the seating area, you are blown away by the sweeping views of Phoenix through the large floor to ceiling windows. We came around 6pm because we were told reservations are full. We are so lucky there was a cancellation and we got a seat outside on the patio! We got to see the sunset. All the other patrons seemed to be in the same romantic trance as we. On our second night, we came quite late, around 8:30pm, with plans to dine in the lounge. The lounge is open seating. As it was quite late, there were several seats open inside. But we went straight for the patio and lucked out with seats at the front. We had unobstructed views of the city night lights. Food: Most of the entrees are ~$40, which makes the AZ Restaurant Week deal very appealing. However, we weren't too hungry so we did one of the 3 course prix fixe menu and we added an entree. The portions were decent, we even had leftovers! We had the fennel braised Berkshire pork belly to start; it was excellent!!!  We had swordfish for one entree. It was absolutely delicious and memorable. The next morning, we saw the same entree featured in a local magazine! Definitely get that if you like seafood. We also got the port braised rosemary short rib with crispy risotto- DELECTABLE! Our dessert was the PB chocolate and berry. I seldom get desserts as I don't have a sweet tooth, but I was so glad I had it with the restaurant week menu.  When we got our bill, we were served 2 mini macaroons, which were very delightful way to wrap up.  The next night we went to the lounge a d had the aracini (risotto meatballs with short rib), the roasted oysters and duck confit risotto. Everything was absolutely delicious. However, since we were sitting outside and it was quite chilly out, our food cooled down a lot quicker than I would have liked. One key thing to note: the lounge has a wider range of appetizers than the restaurant. Definitely consider dining on two different occasions to maximize your experience!! Service: Lots of employees have been there for several years. Our server at the restaurant has been there for nearly 30 years. The employees snow pride in their work and naturally, the service gets a 10/10. When the sun was setting, there was practically a line of people getting photos. I thought it was very endearing any server walking by empty handed offered to help take photos for the patrons.

L2ycM8l3XZRHA7avCkzLuw.text: Amazing food, great service. I recommend  for a romantic night out. For any special night out or celebration.  Amazing view of Phoenix !!!!! We had the 3 course meal and everything on that plate from the app, to the main course and the amazing dessert was to die for!!!

ToS69jL-P8spLIYNALSV6A.text: I love this beautiful, special place! I took my mom here for her birthday and we had a great time. It's perched up high in a mountain giving it spectacular views of the valley. Come watch the sunset before your delicious dinner. Our waiter was great and all our food was incredible. The salads, scallops, and dessert were tasty. I'm excited to go back!

geF310ROlHICOlQQ2V0QzQ.text: This is one of my favorites always good.  I usually rate based on food, service and environment and to get a 5 star review you must be amazing.    Enjoy.

hdmrahog6RwLTCDamMyyeQ.text: Different Pointe of View is perfect for: - Anniversaries - Business dinners - Drinks on the patio - Dinner with a view - Sunset dinner - Excellent food and great customer service - Fine dining  Tips: - Make a reservation in advance - Ask for a table by the window or get a seat on the patio - Let them know if you're celebrating a special occasion - Check online/ask if they have any special menus  For parking, follow the signs to the restaurant all the way in the back, up behind the hotel. Valet will be present to take your car. We made a reservation for a table by the window (just before sunset) and were seated immediately when we arrived. Complimentary bread was provided with a few different dips (pesto garlic, cheese, etc.). The dips were a refreshing change compared to the usual complimentary butter that is served at most restaurants.  We decided to try the Summer Prix Fixe Menu, going with the Lobster Bisque and Hydroponic Bibb & Heirloom Cucumber. The bisque tasted good, but was very heavy and creamy. It was quite a large portion, almost difficult to finish due to the richness of the cream. Perfect for dipping the complimentary bread in though. The salad was light and tasty. For the entree portion of the meal, we both ordered Grilled Marinated Bistro Steak. My friend thoroughly enjoyed it and thought it was one of the best dishes we had all week during our trip. However, I wasn't the biggest fan of the smokey black beans with manchego pairing. For dessert, we both ordered the Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee. Smaller in size compared to the average restaurant, with a thicker layer of custard base and a thinner caramelized sugar layer. It would have been much better if the custard layer was thinner and the top sugar layer was a bit thicker (better proportion wise). Extensive wine menu on hand. We ordered a glass of prosecco and a glass of red wine, both of which were great.  Overall, a solid place for dinner with a view to celebrate a special occasion or nothing at all.

WgoVgHhV18ugylp_QSIZIg.text: Beautiful view. Would love to be here during a monsoon to watch the storm roll in. The menu was eclectic and priced for the view. Service was very good to start, but got progressively less attentive the longer we stayed. We wanted to order a series of their small plates, and would order when the server would come by, the problem was the server didn't come by. Didn't seem busy enough to explain the lack of service. Trying to pay was hard, my dad gave his credit card and then the bill came back as a cash transaction. Being honest, we went to the post terminal to make sure the payment was processed correctly. Will go again, but will spend less.

6sqRZB-6kEO5n-4Zu7HU3A.text: Amazing view, excellent food.  The server was knowledgeable with a great sense of humor.  DEFINITELY a great date night spot!  Not for broke boys!!!!

rNsglH8a8DaKMNVAl3MAJQ.text: View is awesome.  No doubt.  But service is incompetent at best.  7:45 reservation.  They were 'busy' and asked me to go to the bar.  Would find us when ready. After 45 minutes they were 'confused'.  Looks like they cancelled the reservation instead of accepting.  Of course by 8:30 there are tons of tables open and we were seated.  No apology or explanation.  It was like the place was run by high school kids.  Don't bring anyone there that you want to impress.

bxoOMAyf-MLwKCJTX7XxHw.text: Fantastic dinner last night! Our server Ian was very helpful , attentive and made the night very special for us! As industry people ourselves , we very much appreciated how he took the time to make our experience enjoyable ! We will be back soon !

6C4J0Dab3NNzFUc4solJgw.text: Excellent apps, smart cocktails and a view like no other, this experience was simply stunning. We ordered the Cheese and Charcuterie Board and the Hummus of the Day with Grilled Naan and a few cocktails off of The Signature Sippers menu. The apps were delish (we ordered more Naan as it was so earthy and chewy) perfectly crafted with the basil flavored hummus. Cheese portions were skimpy but the cheese choices from the chef were winners - a smoked cheddar and tangy Brie. Fig and lemon along with some olives and salumi added that awesome piquant cheese board plus. Cocktails were awesomely done and icy cold as we watched the heat of the sun set in the Western sky. Oddly though our wait person disappeared for quite a while (spotted eating behind the bar), then later appeared and apologized for being "busy trapped behind the bar". When the bar wasn't busy at all. Only three tables/party's in the entire place...it was still pretty early. We're all for breaks of course but just say, "I was on a break" and send someone out to cover the section. Just sayin. This service mid step wasn't enough to scare us off though. Staff were otherwise pleasant and personable. All in all a great experience --and a must if one is in the Phoenix area.

MDa2EtKdSsxv2R2J9D3mAQ.text: Gorgeous view and food was amazing! Wait was a bit long so plan on appetizers since plates are smaller portions

b8fGe72PMo6skQpJEdJWRA.text: While eating dinner I remember thinking "I could get use to this lifestyle." We were treated to dinner by a client but the prices were still hard not to choke on. The food might be pricy but the flavors and quality of the food is extraordinary! I'd give it 5-star if I wasn't so tight on my pocketbook. The portions were at first comical (bit small), however, each dish was just right. Nicely plated too! I got the nights special of crusted halibut. Soooooo good  The views at dusk were amazing! Such a neat location!! I'm an Arizona native but never tire of the desert at sunset    The 3 of us shared the salted caramel brownie dessert. Drool, drool... if I'd not had a conscience I'd have ordered one all for myself. Was a great experience!

S6Kd2pfodgVJ66DXVX6weQ.text: The view is nice, but the service that we experienced, coupled with the quality of food on an off-peak night was some of the worst I've ever had. In summary, our server was extremely slow in checking in on our table, despite there only being 4-5 other tables being waited on in the entire restaurant, and whenever she had asked if she should give us a minute to think about a decision we had to implore her to stay. The food came out fast but their "iconic" lobster bisque tasted like liquid butter and didn't even contain pieces of lobster. The $10 lemon shrimp starter seemed nice but you only receive 3 pieces of shrimp, which is ridiculous considering the useless "garnish-salad" they added on to justify the price. My fiance and I have had much better food for way less money around the valley, and to be frank, I would never go back to that hotel or restaurant ever again (it's not our first time dealing with that resort, but this was definitely the last).  To top it off, our entire dinner took over 4 hours because the server was reluctant to come back to check on us. We never received spoons for the bisque, so it sat on the table for 10-15 minutes while we waited for someone to bring us a spoon. When getting dessert, after ordering it took nearly 45 minutes just to receive our tiny "almond cake" and Creme brulee; the cake had an overpowering artificial banana taste topped with two pieces of banana chips, and the Creme brulee wasn't even torched on the top. The thing was pale and barely had any color, so the chefs had covered the top of it completely with an assortment of berries. The taste on both was subpar, and after waiting had long we were beyond ready to leave.  Things didn't get better however because upon getting our server to return to check out, we had to wait ANOTHER 40-50 minutes to get her to take our cards and ring us out. My fiance stood up from the table and had to walk the check across the patio to go inside the restaurant and talk to someone at the bar just to drop off our cards. During this entire exchange, our waitress had several other tables under her watch and 3 of them completely cashed out while we were waiting. We couldn't have called her over either without either getting up or being rude due to the distance of the patio. At the end, we were stuck there waiting to get our cards back and we had to, once again, physically go to go the bar just to get a person to talk to us.   Regardless, the view was nice if you like looking at Sunnyslope with the sun going down, but the food was terrible and overpriced and the quality of service that we had received was laughable at best. Don't bother wasting your time coming here, it's not worth the pricing.

HRRQulRzW792cmX5zcMcJQ.text: Can not beat the view here. Pricey but worth it the food is some of the best in town without a doubt. Fun place kind of had an away and that you wouldn't probably otherwise fine unless someone told you. Perfect for celebrations, there's a lovely patio for cocktails and looking out in the city.

SdsXcoYCbrZ-PXL8XKXtUQ.text: We joined a couple of friends here for dinner and it was a very inconsistent experience. The food itself was good, the location is beautiful (we sat outdoors), the weather was gorgeous, and service was good, until our friend had an issue with his main dish and the server was totally 'blah' when it was brought to his attention... No apology, not an offer to replace it, not even a serious acknowledgement... As if he thought "if I don't acknowledge this, then it is not really happening". It is not enough to have a great location, there is an expectation of extraordinary experience (food and service) for this type of place/prices. As a side note, the desserts were tiny... microscopic almost : P  Oh, and they really earned my wrath when I missed on a credit card reward/bonus because the charge showed on my credit card as hotel gift shop, instead of food and beverage. That kind of 'discrepancy' could cost somebody their marriage : P  Overall, I expected way more.

kdskN13RajJoE9ApWjc2GA.text: One of the most romantic restaurants I've ever been to. The atmosphere, the service, the food, the ambiance... everything was perfect!!

7zLb_86EAbwLjr7q5R_xgw.text: This is a beautiful place to sit on the patio and look out over the city towards downtown. They have a giant fire pit out in the back that you can sit by in the evening and sometimes they give marshmallows to roast. It's an upscale place with delicious food or if you choose not to eat you can just sit out side and have a drink and an appetizer and watch the sunset.

X6kxhzU203YLtRGLuLmrmg.text: Totally romantic and had such an amazing view. I got to see the scape turn from daylight to sunset, and all I can say is wow! Not only that, the service there is impeccable. Yes the menu is a bit limited, but overall it is super delicious and top notch food.

xuwxIFpmkGNJosg14xG-vA.text: ::Disclaimer #1:: This review is based on our particular service ONLY!  ::Disclaimer #2:: If you are going for restaurant week fall 2015, their online menu is not the same as the in house menu!   My husband and I went to DPOV last night to kick off restaurant week. We have both been before and knew the food would be great; and that it was. Our service however, was not. We had an older gentleman with white hair as our server who nearly ruined the experience for us. As I stated before the online menu for restaurant week is not accurate...I had chosen DPOV because it claimed to be serving duck confit (best thing I've ever ate). This was not the case and when my husband went out on a limb just to make sure we couldn't order it our server said "not if you want restaurant week!" okaaaay....understandable but maybe approach it diferently (ie. 'unfortuantely it's not one of the featured items OR I could do that for an extra sur-charge'). We ordered our starters and entrees, never did he ask if we enjoyed our starters but when he did ask about the main course he walked by saying "enjoying?" while not waiting for a resonse. Finally, once the dessert menu was delivered and we had decided he stood at our table pen in hand for about 10 seconds and said "yes?" At this point in time we were done...both of shook our heads and ordered wanting to get away from this guy as soon as possible. Like I said - food is, and always has been then last 3 times we've been, great! I may even go back for a glass of wine and the duck confit raviolis (because duck confit is THAT good) but I will be sure to request not to sit in this gentlemens section. All of this being said - our buss boy (a younger man, with longer, ear-length hair was great: polite, charming...I wish he could have been our server and all our tip could have gone to him.

ZLsewRAtErkkaONk2M6YlQ.text: Me and DH made reservations online for our anniversary dinner at this joint..all I can say is it went uphill from there!  We were greeted by the valet attendant promptly and he gave us directions to the restaurant on the 4th floor. We arrived at the lobby and were greeted by the staff, then we knew that we had to wait for a window table as all the window tables are full then, I guess she had noted that we were there for our anniversary dinner and would want to sit by the window. Then we were brought to our table after a 15min wait, to our surprise, it was a corner table and we absolutely loved the privacy of it, what a spectacular view! Shortly, we were greeted by our lovely waiter which served us a special appetizer of Lamb and roasted beetroot....lamb was not our usual fare though so I skipped it..  After I made known that I can't have any wine (I'm expecting) he offered us sparkling apple juice since we're celebrating we can't be short of any sort of bubbly! Our lovely waiter was nice and fun and gave us clear introductions of what's on the plate with every dish they serve, he used a torchlight to do that too as it was pretty dim, very educational. When we asked to have a picture taken at the table he gladly did it and even offered for after meal pictures, which he so nicely took us to the patio to take with the picturesque view!  Alright, back to the food, we had the lobster bisque for soup and it was delish! However I got pretty full by the time I got through the soup.. Next up the poached maine lobster with pancetta wrapped prawns....omg this is crustacean heaven! It was served with a delicious lemon herb risotto torte that's soooo rich but yummy! DH had the pan seared diver scallops for mains and they were very nicely done and paired with a citrusy kumquat sauce which I think balanced the richness of the scallops....they were HUGE by the way...  When we were done we asked for the dessert menu as usual but our lovely waiter told us that we can't have the menu because......ta da!!! He served us our complimentary heart shaped choc mousse cake to share for our celebration! How sweet!! (He still gave us the dessert menu as requested in the end though but we were too full to go through with it ;P)  Sorry for the long winded story of mine but because this place made our special night perfect and happy they deserved the 5 STARS I gave! MUST TRY!

h672rWlaboSKPdAx8spNGA.text: This is by far my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. The service was excellent and the food was absolutely magnificent. I had the lobster bisque, Tomato Infused Grilled Bistro Steak. My boyfriend and I both got the Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and Devil's Delight. I recommend anyone to go at least once if you have the opportunity as you will not be disappointed! On top of that, how can you not love the view! #MustGo

C4M40XUaECcHamK2k7nHfg.text: We just moved from Florida and I was looking for a Restaurant with great food, service and a great view to celebrate my husbands 61st Birthday on Friday. It was suggested by a friend to try A Different Point of View... We are so glad we did... Let start by saying the drive up the cliffs to the restaurant was an adventure my Kia wasn't happy about but we made it.. AMAZING views... Greeted by a valet who had plenty of energy and was very informative. We picked the elevator to go to the 4th floor as opposed to the stairs... We were seated in a corner window table with views beyond belief! Greeted by our server , Larry, he wished my husband Happy Birthday and brought a passion fruit drink that was delish compliments of the Chef! Nice touch... Ask for Larry if you go.. he was right in tune with our special requests... We ordered their Signature Salad and I said we would share it... Larry had the kitchen serve it as a split.. Larry made the dinner and celebration very Special. My husband ordered the Rib Eye but my husband doesn't like any thing on his rib eye and doesn't like anything else on his plate with the meat.. Larry must hears this all the time and he explained exactly how it will be plated and assured him that no sauce or veggies would touch the meat. See pictures to see our meals. I held my breath until the plates came out and my Husband loved it- it was perfect. He ordered it medium rare and it came out perfectly cooked and full of flavor and it cut like butter. I ordered the Pork Tenderloin and it was tender and full of flavor the corn cakes were like little polenta pancakes they were delishish... The bread and the specialty butter and pesto and goat cheese dips were also full of flavor...   The dessert was a Chocolate Espresso cake also very good. The sun was setting and the lights were twinkling-- Just a wonderful experience..   I can't wait to go back when it's a little cooler to sit outside...Don't miss this wonderful casual affordable piece of Heaven!

Ss42p2m5WYyVEj-7rFPoXA.text: DPoV is a great place for celebratory dinners and such and it isn't cheap but in my opinion it is very much worth every penny The view is breathtaking and I love the floor to ceiling windows  The host/servers are very professional, friendly, and not over bearing  The crowd is very diverse but mostly older (30+) When dining here I was the youngest one and everyone was having wine, whereas I was having a cocktail.... I felt young... but my cocktail was nice and sweet!  I had a three course meal which consisted of Appetizer- Grilled Pancetta Wrapped Shrimp  Main Course-Coffee Brown Sugar Seared Pork Tenderloin Dessert-Chocolate Hazelnut Brown Butter Brownie  Each dish was prepared brilliantly and the presentation was exquisite  I was very much in love with my main course, the Coffee Brown Sugar Pork Tenderloin  I don't drink a whole lot of coffee so I was kind of iffy in having my pork tenderloin coated with it but I was surprised  It was so good!  Also, the restaurant allows you to go out to the patio and take photos or just take in the magnificent view

b1PWEzRSSifz2krshjYAVA.text: Decent service. Overpriced drinks- Minty mountain spice and seasonal buck are very good. Kobe sliders were cool like they sat out not very appetizing but the fries were fantastic. View well worth a visit for just a drink or apps.

lISMrmL86AkTgYXykjNCtw.text: Different Pointe of View is the restaurant that makes you feel like every meal is the best meal you've ever had. The service and waitstaff are impeccable and impressively knowledgeable on wine pairings to create the perfect blend of flavors for even the most discerning of palates. The beautiful mountain and city views only enhance an already wonderful experience. Highly recommend!

gFjrpg-ekAb15JdouS1eog.text: This place is easily the BEST restaurant I have eaten at in Arizona.  The fiancee and I had come to this establishment in celebration of our Anniversary weekend.  The restaurant is perched on a mountaintop inside the mountainside resort, so you will have to drive up a bit to reach it.  However, this place is completely worth it and more.   The first thing we noticed as soon as we were seated was the view outside the restaurant.  Even though we were seated inside (outside dining area was closed due to heat temperatures), the south side of the restaurant was comprised entirely of floor-to-ceiling glass walls that gave a panoramic view of the entire Central Phoenix area.  Once we were able to take in the view enough to focus on the menu, our server immediately and consistently came to our table for any service we needed.  As we couldn't decide what we wanted to eat, we took the server's recommendation of ordering the Chef's Special which was a five-course gourmet meal with optional wine pairing with each course.  It was not until we were served this that we realized the full extent of the service that was about to be provided.  Our table was waited by not 1, but TWO full-time servers who brought out each course, explained the origin, methods and tastes of every single food item on each course.  In between courses, the restaurant chef (finding out it was our anniversary) sent over complimentary offerings (this was the first time I have ever had chocolate-covered pop rocks).  We literally felt like a wealthy couple that was being pampered and attended to in every single manner.   After the meal, we went outside with a bottle of wine and took in the jaw-dropping view of the Valley from the outside seating area.  The only downside of our visit was that this area was closed for dining as the temperatures were too hot, however that wasn't on the restaurant and hence why I am still rating this place as 5-stars.  Our servers graciously took our pictures from various views and locations, and afterwards my fiancee and I sat back on couple of the lounge chairs and took in the night skyline view with wine and relaxed.  All in all, it was the best meal I have ever had in a restaurant and easily the best service the both have us have ever experienced in a restaurant setting.  The after-meal view and drinking was so relaxing we didn't want to leave.  The only thing that may deter the average customer is the price; this was also one of the most expensive meals I have experienced, however the service and the experience is more than worth the price.  This is the best restaurant in overall ambience, food, service and views in all of AZ.  The view alone from the restaurant is enough to trump most establishments here in the Valley.  If you are looking to take your significant other on an anniversary, birthday or surprise proposal dinner, there is no better place than Different Pointe of View.

DJpBUwATZKYAUjBDBrkEOg.text: Great venue for a romantic sunset dinner.  Glass of wine outside during sunset and greay city views during dinner.  Great menu and service.  Catered to a special menu request above and beyond.  Thanks

z5TK1_ajV7y2rFiPKaA3KQ.text: Came here to treat the misses. Lobster bisque was delicious. I would have a gallon of it. My entree was the chefs special, which was filet mignon and lobster tail, it twas delicious. my wife had the chicken which she did not like. the service was first class and prompt. The View from our table was awesome, you can see the whole valley from up there. Good place for a romantic date with your girl.

0DmsCMADHs9VXWMywrXpDw.text: The lobster bisque was excellent, as if I was sucking that gooey stuff straight from the lobster's head, LOL.  The entrees were good too, I sampled everybody's selection, even the desserts were good. Don't take my word for it, you gotta try this place yourself.

HnDEPW_9RPvntQYIZnhZzQ.text: I admit it. I don't think Phoenix and fine dining in the same sentence. Perhaps it's time for a Different Pointe of View!  Was at the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort for a conference we were giving. Booked a reservation on a Saturday night. From start to finish, everything was fantastic.   They had some of the best lobster bisque I've had in my life. I ordered scallops and they were cooked perfectly. Albert, our server was great. Funny, knowledgeable and fast. He also brought out this apple creme dessert that is beyond description.   Of course, the views and surroundings were amazing. Highly recommend and can't wait to bring the significant other back!

fMTqmCxAECx9i1iMNipuXQ.text: This place was amazing. View spectacular and the food and service top notch.
