cn0fuTwYsyXRXlReOk6CVA.text: Came here a while ago for a birthday dinner with friends. This place is fancy, upper class.  You need a sport coat at least to get in, I think, well it feels like that. The food was really good from what I remember but the view is even better. It is little expensive but it's worth it on special occasions.  It's not very easy to find the restaurant or parking since its in the back section of the complex. After, dinner we sat and drank wine and beer outside and had the most perfect view of Phoenix.

ujF0NfnWCvTuzI-wd7EGCw.text: Awesome, Delicious, Yummy...!! No words to explain....!! Excellent Service...!! Especially by Louis. Worthy place to enjoy your anniversary. Scenic view of the Phoenix city...!!

esuaABPmpjgC4TiSNMb9LQ.text: I love AZ Restaurant Week!   The fiance and I had a lovely dinner here the other night during Restaurant Week. The best time of year because we can have an amazing meal and not break the bank.   DPofV is the best choice. It has it all, ambiance, view, awesome food, the best wine list anywhere, and a wonderful staff.   1. The view is something you can only understand by seeing it. Looking out over the city, down town Phx, it's perfect. Get there in time to see it right at sundown then late int he even to see the lights. With the hot Phx air it looks like the lights are dancing.   2. The food, wow the food! We had the blue crab salad, spare rib ravioli, hanger steak and pork loin chop. All awesome! The blue crab is as good as you can get in this part of the country (far from the coast)! They were very accommodating to Jon's mushroom allergy. His hanger steak was so tasty and my pork was like butter. And brusstle sprouts, umm hello my fave!!!   3. The wine list literally is the best world. It is like 45 pages long. A bit on the excessive side for me, but I was beyond please with the Cab we picked out.   4. The staff: I think the fact that the two people we had the pleasure of meeting had both been there over 15 years speaks volumes of the place. It is obviously a great job to have, they had a great attitude, and performed perfectly.   5. Last but certainly not least, the desserts. Wow! We each ordered the Creme Brule, and somehow when dessert arrived we got "bonus" deserts. The chocolate turtle and their sorbet were wonderful, completely over shadowing the creme brule.   We were both in heaven when we left and almost needed to be wheeled out since we were so full! I highly recommend them for your next evening out! So good!

oWcYWXtjYvWC76PArU4w_g.text: I really want this place to be more than exceptional but after the second visit (months after the first) I can only say this:  you pay too much for the view. The service is very old-fashioned and very doting but the menu needs a re-think.  Times have changed but this place is stuck in the 90's.  bottom line, it is an overly expensive resort restaurant with OK food and exhorbitant prices.

RdLv9SwUHTiuR9fQQXpEyg.text: My wife and I decided to celebrate our anniversary with the tasting menu.  Our waiter, Luis was absolutely amazing, going well above and beyond his job description to make our bight perfect.  The food was mouth watering and it was one of the best meals we have ever experienced.  The view was also breath taking.  It was a perfect evening to celebrate the beauty of our relationship.   If you want to experience something heavenly you should really give Different Pointe of View a shot. I don't think you will be disappointed!!!

dJ_C-toHcVD_8YYdLLffig.text: Dined on Friday, 2/22/13. My wife and I recently moved to the Phoenix area from Chicago and I really had no idea about where to dine. It was my wife's birthday and I wanted to dine at least at a 4 star restaurant- so I came to Yelp for advice.  Our reservation was 8:15pm and we arrived at 7:55pm. We were invited to sit in the lounge area, which we did, and I expected to do so since we were so early.  We sat in the lounge for about 10 mins and were not approached by a server. In fact, I thought there were no servers since I saw none on the floor so I went to the bar and ordered myself, just like I would at a Chicago neighborhood bar. (Irk#1)Drinks were good and strong, but REALLY pricey- $26 for 2 drinks.  Around 8:30pm, we went back to the hostess desk as no one came to get us for our reservation yet, (they said they would find us in the lounge). We were told our table still wasn't ready and to wait by the fireplace. I was a little peeved now and Iwould have expected to wait if I was late- but we were sufficiently on time I thought.   We were seated after waiting another 5 mins or so. (8:45pm-30 mins late)(Irk#2) The wait staff, I thought, were pretty good overall. They did a lot of table "hopping", i.e. covered each other's tables, so diners were well taken care of yet not too pushy or chatty.  We both ordered the lobster bisque soup. I ordered the halibut and my wife ordered the scallops. Bread was not brought to the table until after we ordered dinner- which was 10 mins after we were seated. (irk #3) The sourdough bread was excellent. The focaccia bread was kind of bland and dry. There were 3 dipping sides offered with the bread, which were very good.   Lobster bisque was quite delicious. They put this "hydroponically infused" basil seasoning on top of the soup that was very good. I thought the soup was a little overcooked (sitting in the pot too long taste) but still good. My dinner arrived hot and the halibut was bland and little overcooked. (pan-fried). I asked for 2 more pieces of the sourdough bread to eat with my dinner and we were told they were "out" of sourdough. (irk#4). Friday night dinner service and out of bread? Really? My wife's scallops were cool as well as her vegetable sides on the plate. (irk #5)The waiter didn't check on us until 10 mins after the dinner was serves (irk#6) so it wasn't feasible to send it back to get reheated. The waiter offered us comp deserts for the trouble, at least.  The last irk (#7) was that we asked for a bag to put our left-over take home boxes in- 3 total boxes. The waiter said they "were out of bags". He checked twice and the 3rd time brought us a Home Depot bag. I asked if he went to his car to get it. How difficult would it have been for the restaurant manager to go down to the gift shop and grab a couple of dozen bags?   Maybe my expectations are too high since I'm from Chicago(?), but when  a restaurant is rated 5 stars by all of you Yelpers, I expect a little better service when dropping a couple of hundred bucks. Other than the view and the ambiance- I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

0nB4udif3xTxw0RGA8L-qg.text: I don't get it. I went all the way to the top. Was I in the wrong place?  People have said such great things about the food. I wasn't impressed. The inside of the restaurant looks more like a business meeting type of restaurant vs a romantic restaurant.

YEs0po5KNdB5SCrZ9tpL6A.text: BIG NO !  We went there for a 2 bday's party and 10 ppl were upset  First the light system , we felt like we were sitting in a spot light all night  2. The food -for $40-$50 dish you think you will get full so of course not . The give you the meat or fish or whatever and next to it they put a little peanuts and they tell you enjoy  3.they fact that you have a good view ( we will get to the view ) doesn't mean you have to consider yourself as a fancy restaurant bc honestly it's not  To serve in big plates almost nothing doesn't make it fancy restaurant ( more like your chef watched to many ratatouille movies )  4.the service was nice can't blame them , but for some reason they had the gratuity to the bill without say anything before ( and %20 )  5. They all point of this place is the view so whoever set up this place should think how to make sure I will enjoy the view   And one more thing  If you looking to find your way up there good luck . No signs ( maybe if you really looking )  No host not a fun place

z6wSCO68hAASHVrqRxIomg.text: If you're new to Phoenix this place is a good spot to visit. Had the tasting menu on Valentines Day & it was okay, the view was beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9apqUo5dQbbk9sLBBbh24w.text: Views are great, service is good, but the food isn't close to what I expected for the hefty bill. Unfortunately, everything tasted pretty bland, portions were very small, and there wasn't as much of a selection as I had hoped for.

zHMpXwrdZPbRz46XIFpmfQ.text: If the main dish is $50 it can't be cold =/ if we have 4 dishes you have to work out how to keep them all hot when served..... You know the basics.   Main issue two: desert..... Had the ice cream sandwich becuase the peanut butter and chocolate was sold out (now I know why). It's a muffin cut in half with cheap ice cream in the middle. I mean 2 dollar a gallon type ice cream. The muffin seemed old and dry.....   So what gets the one star? As of right now it's at zero. The view is insane. Can't think of a place in the valley that I would rather be to have such a picture perfect view of the city. Truly breathe taking.

aCz3riEHHFNRJmkR5-0KQA.text: My wife & I came here for our anniversary with high hopes. We sat on the patio & the view was absolutely stunning-the best part of our overall experience, hands down. The server was very knowledgeable, he gave us in-depth descriptions about the items on the menu. We started with 2 bowls of lobster bisque and a salad to split. The lobster bisque was good, but not worth $12+ per bowl. The salad was brought out split, and my wife & I looked at each other in disbelief at how teeny-tiny the portion was. Definitely not worth the $12+. The tables around us got their entrees long before we did. It was awhile before they arrived. I ordered the lamb entree and my wife ordered the lobster entree. I love lamb, and this meat tasted more like pot roast than lamb. The portion was on the smaller side too. My wife's lobster was very rubbery. She only ate a few bites before passing it over to me to see if I thought it was as bad as she thought. She did not finish her portion at all, and was highly disappointed in the quality of her dish. We then ordered a slice of lemon blueberry cheese and 2 coffees for dessert. The coffees came and our waiter brought a creme brulee over to us with a little "Happy Anniversary" chocolate on it. We are that while waiting for our cheesecake, and eventually I asked the waiter if it was still coming. The waiter said he hadn't ordered it and therefore, it was on him. He then brought it out, and my wife & I again looked at each other in disbelief as it was a slice as long and thin as my finger. It was good, but not worth $11. The check finally came and we saw that he charged us for the anniversary creme brulee which we had not even asked for and had assumed was on the house when he brought it over to us. All in all, I had a nice time because I was with my wife and the view was beautiful, but the food was extremely disappointing and highly overpriced-we agreed the free bread & spread was the best part of the meal. The service was ok. We don't go out much as we're on a very tight budget with 2 kids, so this was a big splurge for us and we both left wishing we'd gone elsewhere.

xLiunMBuVUvVKybdqfDtRQ.text: I've been wanting to go to this restaurant since I got to Phoenix nearly two years ago.  And now during Restaurant Week, we finally made it.   So glad we chose this place tonight.   For starters, the steep drive to the top of the mountain is a thrill, and then upon entering the restaurant we were greeted by a cozy room and the best view of downtown Phoenix I've seen.  The staff was friendly, professional and on point.   We first ordered cocktails - two perfectly made Cosmos.  Their specialty cocktail menu was limited and a bit too funky for us, but they gladly brought us these yummy drinks.  And then there's the food.  Appetizers were to die for.  A summer salad with apricots and goat cheese, and a seared ahi tuna in possibly the best sauce ever!   Then for dinner, a glazed salmon over cheesy shrimp risotto, and pancetta pork tenderloin.    Both were delicious!!  And to top it off, a very unique serving of carrot cake and a s'mores ice cream sandwich.  We made all gone!  The perfect ending to a wonderful evening at Different Pointe of View.   This place is a perfect location for any special occasion.   We'll be back.

m0FExBzB23EzXqcb5Ho4OA.text: Probably my favorite spot in the valley! Discovered this gem during restaurant week, the view is breath taking, the staff is so attentive and friendly and food is worth every penny! This will likely be our new spot for date night, special occasions, or take guest out! Wish I could I give 6 stars!

zL5d4nuEL2Ijdrrj5xEyFA.text: 5 stars for service; server was fantastic. He was funny and outgoing. 3 stars for food; came for Restaurant Week and got the tomatoe infused steak dinner- meat was not very tasty and a bit cold. Hummus Appetizer with toasted pita was actually really good. Dessert; Creme Brulee which is my favorite which was favorite part of food. Seemed but overpriced even for Restaurant Week

Bd9zDvGUs5dBZgXvBHDpAQ.text: Simply amazing from start to finish!!  Upon arrival for dinner, we grabbed a drink and sat on the patio overlooking the city!!   Then we were taken to our table for a delicious meal!!   Every entree was perfect.    I highly recommend this place!!  The views are spectacular and so is the staff and food.

hN5NfDuspw0g8pJ73ygxTg.text: Great view from the terrace and just for the view it is worth to come to this place.  Food was good. Service was friendly.  If I had to complain about something it would be the outdoor seating and that they do not have any cushions on their chairs. The chairs are out of metal and I am a little sensitive when I have to sit on a hard metal chair.  Overall I can recommend this restaurant!

mPHEQdMy_02qOiW77tdlZg.text: It was 18 years ago I last visited this restaurant and I remembered the view. This time it did not disappoint. Our waiter was an older gentleman and very good. The food was excellent and well timed. They could do with a fancier bread service for the price of the restaurant but it still was memorable.

ALHanaGQO5O8WehbKbTYQQ.text: We had a corporate event here last night.  It was beautiful!  Great food, good wine, and gorgeous ambiance! That view is stunning !

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breathtaking

aNOn_IIkaKuG3M0tTtbHNg.text: Was there last night and we were about the second table seated.  Lovely view from our window seat.  The service is among the best I have ever had, anywhere, and I am a world traveler and extremely picky, to a fault.  The food presentation was amazing.  Very professional.  The wine was also great, a Killikanoon Shiraz from Australia.  Superb.  The prices, while upscale, are very much in line with the dining experience.  I recommend this restaurant.

TXB61u2g78uG-au3Vn9GtQ.text: Great date night!  This spot is perfect for anyone celebrating a special occasion, date night, or if you just want to enjoy yourselves, because this place is cool!  Service: is seriously on point. They do not lack in service! 5/5 . View: this place is known for the view, which is incredible!! Def 5/5 . Food (taste):  and toppings were very tasty, appetizer was delicious, main course was just ok/good-it had lots of bold flavors, dessert was amazing. I would say over all a 4/5  for overall taste of food. Food (presentation): everything looked like it was made for the food Network! Very unique and beautiful looking, super cool. 5/5 . Selection: decent selection as far as options. 4/5 . Atmosphere: elegant, tranquil, fancy, open space, 5/5 . Price: so for me, it's very expensive, though I know some people can ball out like that like it's nothing. 2 people with one bottle wine, we spent $175, and that's with the summer special pricing too! Very expensive. So that's why I said only special occasion for me! Lol 2/5 . Cleaniness: very clean place. Bathrooms were very clean and stocked. 5/5 .  So the server Austin (wasn't even technically our server), he was super friendly, helpful, and chill. A real nice dude and an awesome server. We tried to find the manager last night, but they couldn't find her, so hopefully this gets to her one day!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Presentation is beautiful. And it was crafted perfectly too. Only suggestion goes to the restaurant itself. Use LavAzza or Tilly espresso.

OkVKguKtSuDAeXXo5kPp9w.text: The first time my wife and I went to Different Pointe of View, we were not at all impressed by the service, and the food was good, but not excellent.  In other words, not a decent value.  About a year later, we were back, this time for Restaurant Week.  Boy, am I glad we came back.  This time, service was absolutely spot on, and the food.  The food was superb.  Coupled with the marvelous ambience of this place, the food and service have totally changed our opinion.  We will definitely be back, and as long as they keep the standards we experienced this time, will be back over and over again.

2CTXR3K1xBROFKHC9YJqxg.text: Very tasty meal in a gorgeous setting. The restaurant is located near the top of a mountain looking down over Phoenix. The setting is absolutely stunning and perfect for a romantic date or celebration. The drive up to the restaurant winds around and around, but keep driving and you will eventually find the restaurant at the top.  The service was spectacular. We were seated right away and a wonderful table next to the window with a gorgeous view, and our meal was started with the delicious bread with three different toppings. These included a tarragon butter, a tomato pesto spread, and some sort of a lemony aioli.   I went with the prix fixe menu, which included an appetizer and entree and a dessert for $40. For my appetizer, I had the lobster bisque. This was very very flavorful (too buttery for my liking) and a smooth in texture, without any lobster chunks. My entree was better. I tried the tomato glazed steak, which was flavorful and a very generous portion. The steak was perfectly cooked to medium, and served with the delicious truffle sauce and some potatoes. The highlight of this dish for me was dessert. Creme brulee! It came with fresh berries and a small cookie, and was absolutely perfect. I would come back just for a glass of wine, a dish of creme brulee, and the gorgeous views.   Overall, this restaurant is fantastic in terms of the service setting and views (they have a lovely and large patio that is great for after dinner pictures, or for dinner itself if you can stand the heat). Great for a romantic evening out.

hNZUb3RPOyNoKX1FnviIlQ.text: This is a really great spot to bring a date. A serious date that is. The menu is small but very well curated. I had the pork belly appetizer and the steak. The pork belly was a really generous portion that was crispy on the outside and wonderfully tender on the inside.   The steak was a 8 oz offering that seemed more like 12. The quiche accompaniment was a great pairing.   In terms of fine dining I would've expected this place to be pricier but it was very reasonable giving you are paying at least 20% extra for the incredible view.  My only qualm was that for such a nice restaurant you could at least serve warm bread.

WylgwpuyHpqKSMmZ8WCGKw.text: Wow! What can I say except the Pointe is seriously overrated.  Saturday night and almost nobody there except a huge (maybe birthday) party that screamed and yelled during our (five star) experience. The entrees were served with many weird sauces and uncooked vegetables, many of which were inedible. Great view, bad food. How is this supposed to be a high end restaurant. No table cloths, fake candles on the table and a rest room that is like one in a Applebee's.   Totally unimpressed. Do not go, you will not be happy. I forgot to say we went for our anniversary and the restaurant comped us with about a tenth of an ounce of chocolate.  They should be embarrassed with this. Don't give anything if all you can do was that.

PiaE_ETd8r0XymgRcDiDGA.text: The view from the top is priceless.The Ambience is pleasing, great for a romantic evening while sipping some wine,holding hands, intimate conversations... It's the kind of place you take someone you want to impress.The drive to the restaurant is quite charming, from the moment you enter the resort gates navigating your way through the narrow lanes surrounded by spanish architecture you know you are in for a treat.  The Valentine special four course dinner menu was priced at $110 per person with $50 for wine.Some of my favorite things on the menu were the pan seared scallops,lobster bisque,citrus butter poached lobster and the creme brulee.The food was good but quite frankly it was the atmosphere that was more pleasing.  With such prices i expect nothing but perfection.The service is impeccable and the staff is very courteous.I would recommend going on days when they do not have a "prix fixe" menu that way it's much more affordable or you could sit at the terrace room section on level 3 which also has a wonderful patio with the same view and order a few drinks and appetizers (They do not serve Mains here).  Reservations are recommended.It's really difficult to get a table here last minute.  Cheers!

6LER7go47h_z4aB0pkw_bg.text: Great location, great view and good food. The customer service is top notch too.

S2UoYPM4-KwqDExhzB9Fqw.text: Great food great atmosphere wonderful view chef Anthony expert in the culinary arts and Ethan an expert in wines and customer service!

M0PuFd33zkZqHiwB6Ru0PQ.text: I just got engaged here last week!  FANTASTIC views of the valley!  EXCELLENT service!  When making my reservation, I explained that I would be proposing that evening.  They made sure we had the best window table in the place.  I also had it prearranged that if I hadn't proposed at sunset, that I was going to do it between appetizers and dinner.  I have to give special thanks to our waiter, Luis, as he absolutely went above and beyond.  He made sure our dinner order didn't go in when we placed it(to insure I had plenty of time to propose outside on the patio overlooking the valley), and he even took my camera and snuck outside to take pictures of the actual proposal when I dropped to 1 knee.  The food was excellent and so was the wine selection.  It's a little on the pricey side, but worth it.  We both had the lobster bisque and the filet, and both were excellent.  I was pleased to see Cakebread wine on the list, as that is one of my favorites.  They also brought out complimentary hot cocoa from the chef, champagne to toast with, and a special dessert that had "CONGRATULATONS!" written in chocolate on the plate.  We spent 3 hours there, from start to finish, and we were not rushed once.  Parking was easy, since you just pull up to the front and they have valet.  There is also a full bar 1 floor below the restaurant that is spacious and classy.  The patio areas of the bar and restaurant also connect together outside, which gives the place a much more spacious feel to it.  The outdoor firepit and fountain area also a nice touch.  Overall, I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a romantic place to take your "someone special".  You can't beat the views, and you can even eat outside when the weather is warm enough.  Just make sure you call in a reservation well in advance to make sure you get a good window table.

9TaYT_9SANytsx1itB7edw.text: This place gets a 5 star in a heart beat. Absolutely romantic restaurant at the very top of a mountain in Phoneix. It gives you a breathtaking view of the city. Beautifully decorated patio area, with gorgeous flowers, nice breeze and excellent service. The food is perfect. This is an upscale restaurant you want to go to with a significant other or to celebrate something nice. It's soooo nice! :)

RDkUVH_hoqY8YmWMIyFGyg.text: The best view in the valley! The patio overlooks the valley,  what a great place to relax and sip on some wonderfully prepared cocktails with your significant other.  The food is always something special,  artfully prepared.  The staff is always on point and ready to please.

jNl8kjn2LJSGf_OtGF820w.text: I reserved a table through open table. The reservation was just right. I requested a table with a great view, and we received it. The food was visually stunning and quite tasty. It was a bit expensive. If you are going to have a drink and some wine with dinner, be prepared to spend about $100 a person.

w7B4NZd5p0IVtvpA0nq4ug.text: Ambiance, location, view and service by our fantastic waiter, Richard W all were outstanding. I would have rated it 4 or 5 stars but several of our courses (Appetizer and entrees) were way too salty. I do not know what it is about chefs these days but they need to learn that less is more. Food would have been great with MUCH less salt. Not sure I would return. Just not healthy or tasty.

D1fFpVK9f-xhIvW7T4eB1Q.text: My wife and I went here on a Monday, April 2nd for our one year anniversary.  The reviews we've read definitely made this place seem like a winner.  I made a reservation for 6:30, just shortly after the restaurant opens.  The drive up the mountain was steep but the resort is beautiful and you could just tell that the view at the top would be amazing.  Were we ever surprised!  The valet parked my car and we went inside to be seated.  Unfortunately the patio wasn't open for service but they sat us by the window so we had a great view of downtown Phoenix.  One complaint we did have about our table was that it felt like we were in the path of all the server traffic.  It was also right next to a door to the patio so a couple of people tried to come in and out but the door was locked, so that was a little distracting.    Our server, Lenny I believe was his name, was very friendly and informative.  There were so many people that came to our table giving us water refills and bread and clearing our plates.  Lenny helped me pair a wine with my dinner.  My wife ordered the duck ravioli as an appetizer and I had the lobster bisque.  The lobster bisque was phenomenal, every bit as good as the previous yelpers have proclaimed.  And the duck raviolis were excellent as well.  The ravioli was cooked perfectly, just aldente enough so that it had a nice chew, the way I like my pasta cooked.  For dinner, my wife had the lobster and prosciutto wrapped prawns.  Both were so flavorful because they were braised in butter, which adds flavor every time.  I had the scallops over a bed of rainbow cauliflower and some sauce.  The sauce was a little too citrusy  for me and the scallops were almost better without it.  There were also a couple pieces of black garlic, which I forgot was in the dish.  So when I took a bite of one not knowing what it was, that sent my mouth into shock and I immediately had to wash it down with water.  Minus that, both dishes were very good.  After dinner, we walked out onto the patio and down to the bar section to take some pictures with the city in the background.  The weather was amazing and we were so lucky to have the cityscape as our backdrop.  Dinner was a little pricey but I was glad we could share a fancy dinner on a special occasion.

MCRuE2_fbkS_iatxspGSvQ.text: I am a fairly regular customer of the Different Pointe of View but they regularly close the restaurant for major events like weddings or company sponsored events.  Tonight was a good example. Although it was a Tuesday and closed there were no signs telling visitors or guests the restaurant was closed to the public. If you have every been to this restaurant you would know it is a long drive up a steep hill for quite some distance. Once you get there again no sign or anything to tell you the place is reserved or closed to the public. It is only when you try to enter they tell you that you can't enter. Tonight I brought a friend who just moved to Phoenix to show them the restaurant and bar area.  I was told very rudely that I could not go in and was not able to show my friend the restaurant. I explained that I did not want to enter the restaurant or terrace area bit just show them the facility. Very disappointed in the lack of courtesy or at least a sign to show the place is reserved. Welcome to Phoenix and the Hilton Hotel.

U3yK2JcDimV2wH1svJss4w.text: I would give zero stars if possible. Four mix-ups before we could even make it to the table. Staff was rude, unhelpful and uninformed. We flew in from Detroit and made reservations over a week in advance to ensure a memorable evening. It was memorable, but definitely not a positive one. We will not be back. I recommend going to Top of the Rock instead.

r0v4hCXP6XUuXxTofZZKXQ.text: Wonderful views and exceptional service by our waiter Luis. He made my husband and I feel so special.  Exceptional food, wine, and a great atmosphere with a beautiful sunset. If we are visiting Phoenix again we will make sure to come back.

RTkOTcmQna8EYJmrDO7gUg.text: View was nice. Dim romantic setting. Food didn't even really taste all that good for it to be that expensive, but i'm assuming they're charging for the "experience". I got the Chicken and risotto. Babe got the scallops & said they were good. We both tried the lobster bisque and it was extremely rich, i must say. They also had a great wine selection. Try the plum wine. its the only one they have, i forgot the name lol I probably wouldn't take my business here because im more about the taste of the food besides a view, but it was a very nice, romantic setting. I enjoyed myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bN0ULWKk3HKRjJ0eTK5FPQ.text: My friend wanted to eat here for his birthday- This place was not worth my time view was great but food was awful  small portion worked out great when you can't eat the food , who serves a stake already cut ?? Don't you idiots know it gets cold? service was below standard you expect from the cost, I had to go find my own water.  saw waiter twice , when he took our order and when he brought the bill . I would not recommend this place to anyone after readying some reviews I come to the conclusion some people area just stupid , give them a lump of crap call it pate they won't know the difference how can you give this place 5 stars when all you wrote about was how bad this place was. Helllo  1 star = bad 5 star = good

MI94kEUfeGpJ_eeBEGxEkg.text: The view was great!! It made up for our server's attitude. I'm sorry, but for the price that came with the meal, I expect a server to be kind and friendly. Our server was rude and not too pleasant. The food was great (servings very small though). Pricey! The view was excellent though. A great place to be around sunset. :)

kl-H5a2imFn2nlPntvTvoA.text: i didn't think my little red pickup would make it up the hill. it kept going up and up and up, and then....we were at the top! for the Yelp event!!!!  the restaurant was beautiful. all the food provided by the restaurant was excellent. my favorites were the lobster bisque and the scallops. the cheese station with various olive, artichoke, sun-dried tomatoes, etc was also very tasty.   of course the name sake sells it all. stunning overlooks of the valley on this crystal clear night. fire pits dotted the patio area, with several seating areas to offer different options.  it was our first time here and we were thoroughly impressed!

2M0VmVrsAzdLArGospkF2A.text: The scenery alone makes it worth coming to this place.  Get there early so you can get one of the tables next to the windows.  Overall the food here is very good.  My wife and I went here recently for the first time midweek and were not very impressed.  However, every other time we have been here on the weekend, the food and service have been great.  I would recommend going on the weekend.

1vgeTsKDHVJF_9F8LUavVQ.text: Dined here for my Birthday. Had the lobster ravioli dish it was amazing. I also had a birthday dessert; a decadent chocolate cake that was beautifully presented. It is, definitely, a great spot if you want to make someone feel extra special.  The view on it's own is exceptional.  Perfect spot for a romantic night.

QPeVbBBLs4KxcI-qJizeog.text: Sat outside, ordered the five-course chef tasting with wine pairing. View was amazing. Service was perfect, drinks never empty, plates removed right away, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Food was fun, fresh, beautiful to look at, and delicious. Two house of dining enjoyment. Great for romantic dinners, business dinners, and small parties.

FQRT6Qay4eNw0iQdwGc_sg.text: It's is pricey, but the food, service, and view is worth every penny. The Chef made hummus (made fresh everyday) is amazing.  The Chef's special (Halibut) is a definite. Our waiter, not only described each meal, but also described how it was made. Glad that we able to experience this wonderful display of culinary excellence.

CVTev_d9c5KjLBhAQN6Fxw.text: I was here for a yelp event. The food was amazing, and the view was spectacular.  I'd like to bring a date here sometime.

WNdZ0Z5VWJDuK8ZuzYRSqg.text: If I was going to review the view, then I would give it 5 stars (though driving up to the view almost made  sick with fear....) I met my friends for dinner on Friday night...there were 8 of us, but the service was extremely strange to me and there were a few mishaps that I felt need to be addressed.  While I thought it was strange that the waiter - who I am tending to believe had some weird social skills - took the order of the ladies first and then the men.  He was gracious enough to ask us if we wanted our bill split by couple.  But when he was taking our order, I knew that he also may have had ADD issues. It took forever for us to order (The waiter said he thought we were still looking because some of us had the menu open...)  My friend next to me ordered the scallops and a side of gnocchi. He asked her if she wanted to start of with a soup or salad.  When he took my order, I said the Halibut.  Did he ask me for a starter?  Nope...he said "Wonderful...make I take your order?" (To my friend's husband)    I wish that I did order a bowl of the lobster bisque.  I was able to try that and it was amazing.  Our entrees were delicious as well.  My friend's short rib (I also go to try) was cooked to perfection.  I heard great things about the lobster and the chicken.  My friends did tell me that the rice was a little undercooked and the gnocchi was a little heavy.  Now I wish I could tell you that my dinner was amazing.  I was enjoying the halibut with shrimp, asparagus and purple mashed potatoes.  I finished the shrimp and still had most of my halibut and mashed potatoes when I set my fork down to look at my phone.  (My fault I guess...)  Because the next thing I noticed, a server took my plate away.  There was no "Are you finished?" or "Would you like to take this to go?"  Nothing...just took my plate away.  I noticed that he stacked my plate, so there was no way to retrieve my food.  My friends were finished with their dishes....so when I said "I am sorry, but you took my plate away and I wasn't done", the waiter said that he was sorry and was about to go back to retrieve it.  I told him that I didn't want it now, so he did offer to have the chef make me a new one. (NO!) or if he could refill my drink.  (I was driving, so NO!) I would have thought that I would have gotten a complimentary dessert but I didn't.  I was being treated for this dinner, but still,  the dinner wasn't even comped or had a percentage taken off.   I would love to try this place again since the food and view were great.  I would just hope that my service next time would be better.

F0L76L-kn3oHKxukT8ByIQ.text: Was very happy with our visit to this restaurant. View was nice, service was perfect, and the meal was divine. I have a gluten allergy and they could not have been more helpful, in fact most of the dishes are gluten free. It was worth every penney.

5x7mvuT9iXZ0QjEcTsttRQ.text: I was excited by the view and the outdoor seating.  I sat down, was handed a menu and nearly fell off my chair after looking at the price of everything on the menu.  I am from SF so to come to Phoenix and see prices higher than many of the fantastic restaurants in SF was a bit of shock.  Once I got past the $39 dollars for chicken I decided to enjoy whatever.  I started with the caprese salad.  This is a dish that is good in its simplicity, however, it was prepared with jelly that tasted like a key lime pie.  I was not thrilled by this dish.  This was all saved when the entree arrived.  I had diver scallops with lobster on a pumpkin cornbread piece with some vegetables.  I cannot explain how rich and beautifully done this was.  The scallops were the highlight.  I was a bit disappointed in the lobster(a little tough), but the flavor was just fantastic.  My husband had the ahi, which was also really well done.  It was plated with baby squash sandwiches stuffed with blue crab.  It was really great.   I want to give more stars because I did enjoy the food and the service, however, the price was not justified.  If you are going to charge starting price of $40 an entree, there have got to be little to no complaints. Great scallops though!

9JIGSKYS594RikTCFp4Zuw.text: Amazing view and good food equals a win win. Attended a private dinner here which was about as perfect as they come. However, I didn't see the whole menu as a result. The filet was great, but not nearly as good as enjoying a cigar and some drinks on the patio prior to and after dinner inside. This would be a perfect place to take a date and have a nice glass of wine while taking in the view of the ever sprawling Phoenix area.

llRJPV67IpYDp8M9rJw-pA.text: We chose this restaurant as a special treat to wrap up a week-long vacation in Arizona and Utah. We knew from reviewing the menu online that the restaurant was classy and expensive, so we were prepared for this and have no complaints about the prices. The service was attentive and very friendly. The wine menu is extensive. We shared the diver scallop appetizer, and it was perfect! The coffee crusted pork tenderloin and the veal osso bucco were both delicious. The apples on the rocks and the brownie desserts were great finishers to a perfect meal. We were staying at the adjacent Hilton hotel, which offered shuttle service free to and from our room. This was a special evening which was enhanced by a perfectly, delicious meal. We are from the suburbs of Chicago, and wished we had something this special close to home.

76AZYIIqbclFNYKjIjgD0A.text: We went up here for a party a few weeks ago and wow, what a beautiful place.  The drive up was incredible and the view was just amazing.  The service/food/drinks were great the entire night and what a wonderful night sitting out by the fireplace looking out over the city.  Great place for a Party and I can't wait to go back for a nice little romantic dinner for two.  Maybe I'll be back with 5 stars?

UIid4stdqdQPsGOEkjqIpg.text: I have to say that the view here is EXCELLENT, the food is almost always wonderful... the inconsistancy is the service.  It is a great place to bring friends from out of town, or to bring your parents when they wonder why you live in Phoenix instead of wherever they live.

jYN9a0BbQrNIu5mibMNurA.text: Best experience overall during our mini vacation in Phoenix.  Pricey?...a little but best setting, quality and service compared to many simarly priced venues.  Ancho pork fantastic, filet great, pork belly tasty.  Service a little distracted.  Romantic?...could be but large groups increase the noise level consiserably.  View? Fantastic. Would highly recommend.

ShZPJhuyckqI8ONKmRmLfg.text: Simply put, this placed sucked. My husband took me there for my birthday and we were really looking forward to it but came away SO disappointed.  First, in a restaurant full of available tables (it was nearly empty), they sat us next to the loudest table in the world.  When I politely asked if they could move us, they happily accommodated us - and moved us one table over from the loudest table in the world.  They knew it was my birthday and said nothing; we sat for 15 minutes, put in drink orders and an appetizer order (we had studied the menu at home and knew what we wanted because we were starving), and we STILL had no menues, and probably would have sat there all night waiting if I hadn't finally asked for some.  We inquired about the 5-course tasting menu, and our waiter admitted he knew nothing about it and said he had to go ask the chef.  No problem, we understand - what we DIDN'T understand was why, when he returned, he still couldn't tell us a stinkin' thing about the 5-course tasting menu - he literally named only 3 or 4 of the ingredients for a few of the courses, and then said "Uh, I can't tell you anything more, I know know how anything is prepared."  When I inquired what the "salad" was comprised of, he he said "some lettuce."  Gee, thanks for the detail.  Finally, the food was really salty!  I'd seriously give this place 0 stars if that were possible. My husband chose this place based on the mostly positive reviews but I guess we are the exception.     I will, however, say that the view was amazing and it's not as though the people were't kind because they were. But for the $, we'd have been better off just going to Mastro's.

_hq9FsIFAmsng5E5E0Pmww.text: It gets all three stars for the view.  For the prices charged the food should be oh, so much better.  And the selection is very limited.  But if you are trying to impress a date, and aren't too hungry, this is a very romantic location...

AtsCfPVVwxoPlgc5y58AjA.text: I've eaten ion fine dining establishments all over the globe for over 30 years and this one is in my personal top 5. Not cheap or even reasonable by anyone's standards but this one backs up the tab in spades!

7LjHTeWWR0Y-lDs2OcHfhg.text: What a fantastic experience!   We made our reservation with OpenTable, mentioned that it was our anniversary, and we requested a booth with a view if possible. That is exactly what we got. There are only two booths available but from what i could see there isn't a bad seat in the restaurant. We started out with a couple of cocktails and went over the extensive wine list. The captain helped us out with our menu selections, and what really impressed me was that he didn't just automatically recommend the highest priced entree. We asked to share the Lobster Bisque and they brought it out in two bowls. It was fabulous. My wife got the Pork Tenderloin, I got the Ribeye.  Not sure what varietal to pick, we asked for the sommelier, who again to our surprise, recommended a few reasonably priced Syrahs. After discussing a few of the choices we went with a 2006 T-Vine which was perfect with both entrees.  The entrees were full meals, with excellent sides. Very filling too. From the captain to the busser, the service was great. The timing was perfect throughout. During the evening, both the assistant manager and manager stopped by the table to see how we were doing.  We shared a dessert that came on a Happy Anniversary plate. Toward the end of the meal we advised the manager that we had planned on a cab ride home. He took care of getting us a cab and told us to just relax at the table until it arrived. My coffee was kept full until the cab was announced and we got home safely in a nice Escalade for a couple of dollars more than one of the discount cab services. ( that was a nice surprise too!) We will definitely come back and are happy that we found a 5 star restaurant in our neighborhood.

__8GaZVjxvWHm1Hip5dH8w.text: Terrific view. The food is just okay. Come for dessert and cocktails and enjoy the twinkling lights of the city below.

lFx3EzBcGtwxA5UXw6KeEQ.text: My boyfriend and I went out on a thursday night for a last valentines day celebration at DPOV. Everything started off nice and were really enjoying the view and each other... The place started getting busier and our team of servers began stopping by less and less... By the time we had gotten our entrees they were pretty much nonexistent. Our food was just above Luke warm and our wine was empty.... After about 30 mins of waiting for some one to come over one of our servers came by to clear our plates. He didn't ask how our food was and didn't offer any dessert menus. We aren't really the complaining type but considering the price of the food my boyfriend got up to discuss our issues with the manager whom removed the entrees. This place really needs to improve their customer service skills. We decided to go to one of our favorite places for dessert. The  Rokerij. We won't return or recommend this place.

hru7ZeEX6HB1hYtkZxmDnA.text: For a restaurant that supposedly prides itself on its five star service I was very disappointed. First off the waitress looked completely disheveled, messy hair too small faded black shirt and cheap looking black pants. Then when we placed out order for the mussels we were advised by her that they are very fishy this time of year. My husband had never tried them so we took a chance. We also ordered the Kobe beef sliders and the tomato salad. The Kobe sliders were so well done you could call them burnt, the salad was tiny with wilted lettuce and the mussels(surprisingly) were good. By the time we saw our waitress again we were finished with our meal. I asked her about the Kobe sliders and commented that they are always prepared well done and she quickly brushed off my comment and walked off.So much for the customer is always right. Needless to say my husband and I were very disappointed to spend a hefty amount of money for so-so food and terrible service. Needless to say we will not go to Different Pointe of View again and will NOT recommend it to our family and friends.

UoB6Zzi8V5idVGjwUC7hSw.text: beautiful setting with a great view and great atmosphere. definitely high end and maybe a little overpriced, but it's worth it every now and then, even with the ocassional snooty people around.  we've been lots of times, and i have never been disappointed by the food. service has been slow on occassion and not always friendly, but never rude or lacking.   the filet mignon is fantastic! (well, was.. it's been a while since i was here last). the chicken dishes are kind of boring and my mom's had stomach upsets a few times, but she's ridiculously sensitive, and otherwise, this is a really nice place

ThIHna3PRI0IOr_jlk6n9A.text: I had great expectations for this restaurant as I have stayed and dined at various Point Resorts and restaurants in the valley and heard nothing but great reviews for Different Point of View. I even liked the cleverness of the name and was looking forward to a nice experience, but unfortunately I was sorely disappointed. While the view and atmosphere were very nice our service there was inexcusably poor. We ended up with a guy named Larry who was extremely inattentive, unfriendly, and all around just unprofessional. When he would finally come around he would walk away literally after two minutes WHILE we were still speaking. He was curt and abrupt in his responses and almost hit me with a knife when he dropped the silverware and did not even excuse himself or apologize. Unfortunately his brusque, rude behavior was not merely limited to our table. However, the hostesses, bussers and other waiters around us were all great, so much so we were tempted to move to another table. Maybe he was having a bad night, but for this type of establishment and for the amount of money you're laying out you would expect half-way decent service. The food was hit and miss. The Kobe short ribs were great- flavorful and tender- the tangyness of the balsamic reduction was a nice foil against the mild sweetness of the perfectly creamy polenta. Consequently, we had great expectations for our entrees- if the service was bad at least our food would be good, but alas to our dismay again we were somewhat disappointed. The central elements of our meals, the steak and halibut, were both flavorless and overdone though the supporting casts of sauces and sides were very flavorful and well prepared. The shrimp with the lemon fennel reduction was fabulous, but it could not mask the dryness and lack of flavor in the halibut. The steak was tough and flavorless and when sent back returned somewhat less tough, but still flavorless. Definitely not at all in the caliber of a Ruth's Chris, JnG, or even Fleming's or the Keg. The creme brulee was nice though nothing outstanding and the chocolate amandine had a flat pre-packaged taste- after a few bites we left the remainder. There are too many other great restaurants in Phoenix with fantastic views and ambience to waste this type of money on poor service and mediocre food.

nGRdByOt5X-hG_lV5RhNgA.text: It's been 5 years since we moved to Phoenix, and visiting Different Pointe of View has been on my list of things to do since we arrived here.  On Saturday we finally made it, and I wish that we hadn't waited as long as we did.  This restaurant was fantastic, and far exceeded my expectations.  I am always skeptical of restaurants in this price point, especially when you assume that you may be just "paying for the view".  Not True at all.  The food at Different Pointe of View can stand up to the creativity and quality of any other high end restaurant in town.  I had the Port Cabernet Braised Kobe Short Rib: Fresh Sweet Corn Polenta, Chanterelle Mushrooms, Endamame & Blue Berry Balsamic Reduction as an appetizer.  It was delicious and unique, and my only complaint was that there was not more of it.  My wife had the lobster bisque with Heirloom Cauliflower & Lobster Timbale, it too was remarkable, but I was glad that I got the short rib.  For entrees I had the Cedar River Prime New York Strip: Pancetta Chervil Rosti Potato, Braised Artichoke Heart & Portabellas Sherry Caramelized Onion Reduction.  There was a lot going on in this dish, and I appreciated every bit of it.  The steak was perfect and the carmelized onion reduction was incredible.  My wife had the Palo Verde Farms Pork Tenderloin with Chorizo Stuffing: Piquillo Pepper Parmesan Risotto, Sweet Corn & Baby Zucchini Succotash, Caramelized Tree Ripened Peach & White Balsamic Olive Oil Emulsion.  This had a ton of flavor and she loved it.  The risotto was really my favorite part of the dish, but the pork was excellent.  We both had some standard desserts - i had creme brulee which was good, but nothing special, and she had the Chocolate Amandine: Milk Chocolate Mousse and Vanilla Amaretto Cream, which I wish that I had gotten.  We did not sit on the patio, but I cannot imagine a more beautiful place to eat, and I will certainly reserve my table well in advance on our next trip to make sure that we sit outside.  This place will not disappoint, and it is definitely NOT just about the view.

bdMZxWD6FgB2az40oY-GQw.text: We were staying at the resort for a July 4th "staycation."  We decided to splurge and have dinner here the night of the 4th. What a great decision!  The food was excellent, the view to die for, and being able to watch the fireworks around the valley from the comfort of our window front table was phenomenal.  I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

MnzVFZqBD7yyg2EJtDtYkA.text: We requested outside seating and indicated that it was a special occasion. We were bumped inside because of a larger group and were not made to feel special at all. I had to ask that my water glass be filled and the waiter was very rushed. Everything that came out of the kitchen was very good but whomever is in charge of the dining room has a lot to learn about running one. Still it is a wonderful place and if they get their priorities right it will be a great place. Vibrant Bar Scene, Fit for Foodies, Good for Groups, Great for Outdoor Dining, Late-Night Find, Neighborhood Gem, Notable Wine List, Romantic, Special Occasion, Scenic View, Hot Spot

8AU5NJrbBbBWQyaLXB9vPQ.text: This place has been on my list for awhile. For sure did not live up to my expectation. Let's get one thing straight, the view is to die for! Absolutely gorgeous. I wish I could see the sunset or rise from this place! The food however was lack luster. It was ok. Nothing to write home about. Started with lobster bisque which was yummy! Then I had the scallops which were huge and well worth the price! However the risotto it came with, I didn't enjoy at all. Normally I love all risottos, but this one was off, some flavors that didn't belong at all. Also had the crepe brulee, which was good. Overall I don't think I'd return except for the view.

wL4FUbaHsF4SyTZQc4cyDQ.text: The view is good. It is totally True. But the drinks are weak, the staff seemed less than professional for an upscale joint, the food is good - but not commensurate with the price good, the carpets and walls were dingy and the whole place seems like it is resting on its laurels... which is that aforementioned view. I'd been here maybe 15 years ago and it seemed a lot more buttoned up, now it seems like they're just going through some of the motions of being fine dining.   If you are on a prom date or maybe taking your older relative out for a celebration, I guarantee they will see nothing past the view and you will be a hero. If you want to have an incredible fine dining experience, I don't think this is it any longer.

mR9bGn_KpIQugM5KNIDWHw.text: This is the best meal I've ever had in my life. Disclaimer: Work paid for it and food tastes even better when it's free. I have listed out some of the food I tried. This is definitely a special occasion kind of place. It's in the mountains and a little hard to find. I parked at the bottom of the mountain and went to the lobby and asked for a shuttle to the restaurant.   Recommendations/What you HAVE to order:  * Starters - Seared Berkshire Pork Belly - Lobster Bisque (share this soup. It's a little thick but still good)   * Entrees - Grilled Filet Mignon - Maine Lobster (scallops are to die for) - Pork Tenderloin  The complimentary bread with PESTO sauce is the best. They have you 3 sauces (pesto, goat cheese and garlic butter) but the PESTO is the best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp !
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Belly appetizer
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster Bisque Soup

ikJdlTyVoKAzyrMreUgDOg.text: Oh. Em. Gee. My fiance took me here on a surprise date night and I don't even know where to start. It was beyond amazing, definitely ranks in the top five restaurant experiences I've had.  First off, the view! Unbeatable.   The food was not only delicious, it was so beautifully plated I almost hated to eat it. We shared the seared pork belly for an appetizer, which was so tender and so flavorful. My fiance ordered the prime filet, which he said was phenomenal. I ordered the scallop and lobster dish as my main course. It was absolutely amazing. We shared a creme brulee for dessert, which was pretty good as well.  The prices are, I think, very reasonable considering the level of dining and the experience. They are extremely gluten-free friendly as well, even offering to bring out veggies to substitute the bread at the table.  I would highly recommend DPOV to anyone, whether a visitor or a native. It's really a must-do.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pS9Tp0Z4apL1hat1ifACqQ.text: Great location with great food and amazing views. Secluded atop a mountain with 360 degree views overlooking desert scenery and views of downtown phoenix. Servers are overly polite and food is of great taste. Entrees are small in size and price is high but understandable for atmosphere and level of culinary service. End of the night the executive chef made rounds to each table. Great location for special occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops

HQjIXRL-ND1WyhuSOGTFvw.text: No one answers the phone when you call, finally got through and the lady told me the last Reservation is at 8:30pm even-though they close at 10pm. I can already tell service is going to be terrible, so gonna skip trying this one.

kal5D3pb-XQAZw_qXrNjiQ.text: DPOV is a very special restaurant in the area. I highly recommend it for visitors who don't live in Phoenix because it really is a spectacular view accompanied by delicious food. I will say, the drive up is a bit arduous, but it's worth it once you arrive.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

n0arSxnIUjVFm2_XENqVbw.text: 2 words for this place: the views. The view are absolutely amazing. If you are looking for a romantic restaurant with some of the best views of Phoenix, then I really don't think that you can beat this spot. Our party of four all ordered the pre fix 5-course tasting menu at $89 per person. The dishes included a shrimp, scallop, sea bass, duck, and dessert course. I will say that the majority of dishes were very pleasing with my favorite course being the scallop course. I was surprised to find out how large each course was as well. Typically if you do a tasting menu the courses are just a few bites, but these courses were super generous. With this being said, if you don't have that big of an appetite that day then I would not recommend the tasting menu because it was very filling, especially because they offer complimentary bread as well. Make sure to get a window seat, it will definitely enhance the experience. The servers and the hostess were great. A had a few small issues with a couple of the courses which is why I can't give them the full 5 stars but nonetheless it was a really great experience and the views alone were enough to visit this place.

CtKgAbSwZYzmNqC_4MCbAA.text: Tonight we tried a new restaurant and were not dissapointed! The food, staff, service, and views were excellent! We had a fabulous time! We will be going back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pWsK7dFXfl6w1SSmHhK5dA.text: The waiter and staff were very personable and accommodating, the wine guy needs to practice his pseudo French accent, the food was weird, maybe my tastebuds are linked to my socioeconomic status  next time it's pizza and beer...

Hq_xXRVXrWPPE2vQ0aqkyw.text: The worst service and experience in all history. My whole family stayed at the resort where this restaurant is located, we took a shuttle to get to it. It all the way at the top, highest mountain, and that's where the good view comes from. It was my sisters birthday and decided to go somewhere of a more "fancy dining" kind of feel. My family and I are Latinos ok, as soon as we got to the place we were getting eye rolls from every direction. Pretty sure we were the only Latinos in that whole restaurant and for some strange reason nobody was fond of that. Our waiter sat us down and immediately was very short and not welcoming at all. Our food took 2 hours long!!!! And I know that's stuff that the "kitchen" is responsible for but our waiter didn't make it any better, he never came to check up on us or ask if we were doing ok, or needed anything?! 2 hours to get your food is just unacceptable!!!!! I hate this place ruined our whole trip!!!! They were so rude!!!! I was embarrassed with my family that I took them here... never again! We traveled from Vegas, we know what fine dining is!!!!!! This is NO FINE DINING RESTAURANT!!!!!!! And you sense racism the moment you walk in!!!!!!!! Ian was the waiters name.

s3iatTCoq_438pM1B19hTg.text: When it comes to high class dining with a beautiful view, Different Pointe of View can't be beat! Reservations are recommended! The views are incredible and the menu delightful. We visited during Restaurant week so we were able to have an appetizer, main course and dessert. Not a rushed meal which I like. Excellent wait staff and beautiful presented food which was also filling. Great place to bring out if town guests or to celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate peanut butter
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short ribs
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Halibut chef specialty

1QjObOsAju4BIrxPbS3f6g.text: Come for the view, have a wonderful meal.  The menu does change but if you see the spare ribs... those are worth ordering. I had the lobster bisque which blew me away.  Dip in the bread and enjoy! I also had the lobster and scallops which I hate to admit, I could not eat it all....  Also at the table, we had the pork chops and the chicken and for appetizers we also had one of the salads and the pork belly.  All unbelievably good...  The place is 4 diamonds over and over and can be pricey, but worth every penny.  Go here and enjoy it. There is not a bad thing on the menu and the location is beautiful.   Nash was our waiter.  He was on spot.  Attention to detail and knowledge of the wine cellar, as well as the menu made him a brilliant conveyance of the meal.  Thank you, Nash.  We did get to meet the chef.... and he cooks every night.  On the line.  Perfect dishes.    Why this place works... longevity.  People work there for decades. They are professionals - all of them.  Each one knows their role and support each other.  Customer service and food service is a skill that this team has established.  If you need to entertain or have a peaceful, well prepared and hosted dinner - go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar view

_hf5iltY5iU4P32FwOprAw.text: We went here for our 28th wedding anniversary celebration, and all I can say is, why didn't we go sooner?  The view, the service and the food were all excellent. Best scallops I ever had

HsAdLVieTq6GDS8wVaRalQ.text: Mother's Day brunch was way overpriced. Food was very blah, nothing special that worth $70 a person. Will not try again for brunch. Beware that they have 2 levels, so if you are going to an all you can eat, being seated on the lower level would be very inconvenient, imagine stairs and plate of food in your hands, so don't wear high heels and long dresses. There is an elevator, however, do you really wanna wait every single time you get up to get food?!?!? My very first thought when they sat us down on a lower level was " if I have to walk that stairs every time I need food, I'd rather have a bowl of pho and call it a day".  They moved us, but for $650, we could have eaten better. The view during the day is nothing spectacular, rocks, mountain, cactus, if you wanna see this, go hiking. However, I'm going to give this place another try at dinner, hopefully food is better at dinner time.

wMkeUL0XdiydSCsrOJEI7A.text: My wife and I went to the Different Point of View to celebrate our 18th anniversary in my opinion one of the top two restaurants in the valley the other would be Cafe Monarch. Unlike Cafe Monarch the Tapitio Cliffs offers the best view in the valley and both have excellent cuisine. We opted for the "Chefs tasting menu" a complete five course dinner for $89.00 per person with they offer a wine pairing option for an additional $39.00 the 1st course was a braised pork belly over root vegetables delicious. The 2nd course was a seared Diver Scallop with a pesto sauce a butter lettuce salad with citrus dressing amazing. Next we were served seared center cut swordfish with quinoa with charred vegetables and a pomegranate beurre blanc.The 4th course or main was filet mignon over crimini mushroom risotto which  was superb. Last a banana anniversary torte to top off this 5 star meal. The Different Point of View has won many dining awards and they are well deserved enjoy the pictures.

bT9fRRMhqNLed9AOIOJDrA.text: This was a truly magical experience. Set atop of the cliffs with amazing scenery was purely breathtaking. The resort offers a complimentary shuttle to take you to the top.  The atmosphere is very intimate with a grand wine cellar. Then starts the amazing service and fabulously paired culinary cuisine. This is truly a must have experience that everyone should partake at least once in their life. You will be thankful you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor scenery. Your able to walk out and take pictures. If outdoor seating is not available due to inclement weather conditions
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate Mousse. This decadent dessert was definitely a sight for the eyes to enjoy. While tasting as beautiful as it looks

Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef sirloin with a potato puree, asparagus. These asparagus are only available two months out of the year. Cooked and paired to perfection

M_Z1RVIDnl0QRR1hC25P-Q.text: Another magical night at the Different Pointe of View at tapatio in 7th st. This is definitely one of the best restaurants in town with an incredible cliff top view. Our waiter, Ian, was over the top incredible, probably some of the best service I've ever received. His recommendations and the way he described how the chef was preparing each dish, had us drooling before we even looked at the menu. And he suggested terrific wines to complement each course. The lobster Bisque was to die for, as well as everything else we ate (lamb shank, short ribs, shrimp, etc).  Truly a memorable meal all the way through. This is the perfect restaurant to impress a date or for friends with amazing food and to showcase the views of the valley.

Alvhg8MSXXE5PAo0FT_Z9g.text: Easily one of the two best Phoenix area restaurants we've visited. Unbeatable view, classy and open space. Austin was our server and he and the service team were excellent and appropriate. Good selection of wine and cocktails along with a full bar. Seasonal stables and a seasonal course selection (June - August). Bread service with a unique mix of pesto, flavored butter, and cheese. Tried an appetizer, salad, drinks and entree. Our server treated us to a champagne toast for our Anniversary which was a nice touch along with the staff being happy to take a few pictures of us with the amazing view. All and all a great spot for date night and a very good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. City view
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing sunset
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu (Entrees)

ifJATkv4TKMe7tLfoGJFUA.text: My hubby brought me here to celebrate an anniversary. First of all, the view is phenomenal! We had already had dinner with family prior to our surprise (to me) reservation here but Let me just say I was super impressed with the menu. We enjoyed some drinks and the night lights (which he knows I love so much) then we shared the absolute best creme brulee I've ever tasted. Romantic atmosphere and perfect way to conclude a special day.

MnRtpR_uvMGmRQa634D82g.text: IN SHORT: Anthony DeMuro crafts an elegant menu on top of one of the best views in Phoenix. Reservations are key for that special occasion, but the palette of flavor developed throughout the meal will surprise you at every bite.  THE STORY: Different Pointe of View is one of the finest pieces of culture in Phoenix. Nearly every table can enjoy miles of city and mountain views that lend an understanding to the city's form so rarely found.  The wonder doesn't stop at the atmosphere, however, as the food and and drink never stop wowing. The salad options change seasonally, but be sure to include one in your meal as an appetizer or small second course. During my most recent visit, I enjoyed the phenomenal Poached Pear and Micro Herbs salad, which included a cinnamon-cider poached pear, dried goji berries, Humboldt Fog cheese, toasted pistachios, and a d'anjou pear and tarragon dressing. Presentation is one of Chef DeMuro's greatest talents, and each ingredient truly shines as it arrives on your plate. The Blueberry and Rocket Arugula salad was also a favorite, with dried blueberries, goat cheese, Marcona almonds, shaved beets, and a sweet cabernet lavender vinaigrette that was astonishingly light, floral, and fresh.  For my entree, I ordered the Vanilla Brandy Poached Maine Lobster, which came beautifully served against 3 lobster and parmesan raviolis, expertly cooked with the perfect bite. The smokey lobster buerre blanc sauce added another hearty, yet southwestern element that finished off the dish.  Of course, service is impeccable, and our waiter and sommelier truly acted as if they were happy to be serving us. We were tended to often, and frequently asked about each course. Needless to say, Different Pointe of View is just perfect for a rare, relaxing, beautiful, and immensely satisfying meal in the heart of Arizona.

jAx7sEwfHX2Qg1okXZrBkg.text: This was a nice and romantic place to go on valentines day....but the food was not good. There was a special menu for the evening with no other choices which was fine but i did not care at all for the way the food was prepared. The drinks were weak too. The service was amazing and all the staff there are friendly. I just didn't like any of the food and for that price its unacceptable. We are glad we went but will never go back.

FxNW1HENzgGUEMP-HY9UMQ.text: 2 ppl, 2 drinks, full meals came out to about $200. Food was great and paired with the view defiantly worth it.   You could come and spend half what we did not getting appetizers or drinks. But I'm not going to not get a makers old fashion when overlooking the city lights from a mountain top.

ZGC35GBd--TJSFLs7fhbBQ.text: Me and my wife had dinner there 2 days ago and the food wasn't as good as we thought. The food looked good but as far as taste we were disappointed. One thing is Amazing is the view. But other than that it's ok

5BHSJTlzhDGYUjpn68duTA.text: This restaurant delivers on taste, presentation and the view.  My wife and I came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  We enjoyed their gourmet  duck dish and a fabulous creme brulee  for dessert.  Service was impeccable!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oAH8XvsKDQ5kXq1CpuFInQ.text: Pros: great views, great ambiance, great service Cons: overpriced, food was over-seasoned, presentation was mediocre, lobster bisque had no lobster  I brought my wife to celebrate her birthday. The views were breathtaking and the wait staff was kind and helpful. She got the lobster bisque and the scallops. Lobster bisque was the worst we've ever had with no chunks of lobster. Her scallops were WAY too salty (and we like our salt) and her corn and herb quinoa were overly seasoned and fragrant. I got the pork belly and the duck breast. The pork belly was amazing - strongly seasoned but still tasty. I've had duck twice before and they were both far better than this. We ordered potatoes and mushrooms for our sides but both were forgotten when the entrees arrived. Dessert was on the house for this error and it did not disappoint; however, we'd rather have stellar entrees and no dessert than what we experienced here.  Bottom line: perfect for a great photo op but go somewhere else for a great meal.

8TwMWdsGE2LMCv6BT7yiFQ.text: This is one of my favorite places. We went here tonight for my daughter's birthday and it was amazing again. Luis was great as our server. His recommendations were spot on and I love guys who are True expert servers. It is an art. It's great service and fantastic food like this that keep us coming back.

y0b7-XZyqG-tFbLZgdnpdw.text: The view is to die for, the food is excellent and the staff was great!  Definitely worth the trip and the money!

iO3Cu0RikrBRHEZi4-oolQ.text: No doubt food is incredible.  View is second to no restaurant I've seen in awhile.   Props.   Great service.  There was a fly problem at our particular table.  My fiance had a fly go in her drink, and there were several friends of that fly hiding at our corner table.   Though that was slightly annoying. The great service, food, and view really made up for it.

JkVUB1iBLlZmkYcz8N0LaQ.text: Follow the steep, twisting, turning road to the top. This upscale restaurant offers valet and vivid views, south facing, panning virtually 180 degrees.  Food is top notch, service is attentive, prices are competitive considering the ambiance. This is not your Friday night family dinner for most people. If you're looking to impress- bring 'em here. Highly recommend this restaurant.

tzPXRv9haWtmRlcvarCGuw.text: Perfect date night/celebration spot!! The steak was perfectly cooked and the risotto makes for a perfect appetizer. There's truly nothing like it in the Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing view! Very romantic :)
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Risotto for appetizer.. Highly recommended!
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak.. Amazing!

ro-9OGA3AxGUhCIoPnOkWA.text: We were staying at the hotel and decided to make reservations here for dinner.  We wanted to come here a couple of years back but didn't get a chance to due to scheduling so we were pretty excited about finally being able to come here for dinner!  If you're staying at the hotel by the way, no, you can't walk it, especially if you are in heels.  Don't even try.  It's not worth it.  The hotel has a service where they will drive you up there ... I'm pretty sure it's complimentary but check with the hotel.  So we get in and nobody to greet us.  I was disappointed and a little confused b'c for a minute there, we had no idea what was going on.  When the hostess finally showed up, however, we were welcomed and seated promptly.    Our waiter (Bob I think was his name) was exceptional.  He told us about the evening special and was very attentive throughout the entire evening.  My husband and I aren't really fancy people so coming to places like this kind of intimidate us but he was very personable and I'm pretty sure he knew we didn't "fit in" with the crowd there.  The view is awesome.  WOW.  We really enjoyed having a view of the city in front of us as we dined.  I had the lobster and the husband had the duck.  Both of our meals were delectable.  We also shared a side dish of risotto which was also very savory and delicious.  The lobster tasted fresh and succulent.   I was very surprised considering we live in Phoenix!  No dousing of the lobster in butter to make it tasteful - it was perfect just the way it was (as it should be!).    We also shared a dessert ... I can't remember the name but it was chocolate peanut butter something-a-ruther with Snicker's ice cream I think?  Anyway, that was good, too.    This place definitely ain't cheap but for the experience, it was well worth coming here.  We'd definitely come here again in the future if the occasion arises!

TWIaA4dmNCmNWdH47duYmA.text: Food was amazing did the executive chef five course meal with wine pairings.  Service was excellent and views were amazing!  Definitely recommend it.

-eughBUVDA9o1a-xjym9tg.text: This was the best seafood I've had in the valley. The scallops were large and perfectly seared. The lobster was delicious. The service was wonderful and friendly. We had a beautiful view, even at night. It was expensive. But it was worth every penny. If you have a special occasion, this is a place to go to. We mentioned it was my 30th birthday and with my dessert came a little chocolate that said happy birthday. Of course they did not sing -thankfully this isn't that type of restaurant.

NdSsiluRrnaGnWN7Bz-Rbg.text: Excellent location. But very disappointed with the food. We went for dinner, ordered Short ribs, Duck, Lamb, Lobster Basque soup. Food was just ok. The soup had strong tangy taste. I would no go back there.

p0qK3MxDJXiivN8B9R9YMg.text: What a great dining experience.  My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here recently and will return. We both enjoyed our meals, appetizers, beverages,  and dessert.  My wife enjoyed the scallops, delicious. I enjoyed the pork loin, fantastic.  The wine list was humongous,  and everything was reasonably priced.  Our server took good care of us which pushed this to a five star review. Remember that dining should be a great experience and in my "point of view" this' Point of View' checked all the boxes.

w_XNu_I2-Q90fx-6huK8RQ.text: This restaurant is amazing. Not only the view was amazing but the food was some of the best I've ever had. My waiter was Luis, which he also said i could also call him "Pablo". He was a great waiter and he made the experience so much better. I went for my mine and my girlfriend's anniversary, and he made us feel very important to be there. Their summer deal gave you an appetizer, an entree and a dessert for 40$ a person which is an amazing deal. We sat and watched a beautiful sunset and ate fantastic food all for $40 a person. Definitely worth the money in every way, I highly recommend this restaurant.
