DZ8377j6bt7VXFrZO1X-8w.text: Came here for a small bite and some nice drinks on one of the nights I was in Phoenix for work.  Just an amazing view from the top of the mountain and a relaxing atmosphere and fresh air since you get to sit at the table outside.  Got a couple of appetizers and dessert, delicious but super small portion.  I will definitely recommend it as a must have experience in Phoenix.; however, you will have to pay a lot in order to get full here.

So many fabulous choices and beautifully designed. We love going outside on the patio and having a beverage and enjoying the beautiful view of the city.

wdOeZeUvKRlJLK1VPFdSgg.text: Different Point of View is a Lovely Restaurant with Breath taking Views. Most of the food and Service I had was very good. This would be a Four star review if a few execution problems didn't occur. I am basing my rating on price point.  Both entrees were less than warm especially the New York Strip. I don't order steak often but when I do I look forward to a very good steak that's tender, tasty and hot like off the grill.  My husband thought the steak was cold but I say it was room temperature. I didn't send it back or say anything because it was tasty and cooked nicely and I didn't want it cooked more and I also didn't want my husband's Pork to sit more. My waiter did come to check on us and asked how it tasted and I said fine because it did taste fine.  At this point I was teetering between three and four stars.  But another execution problem occurred with the Chiffon Date Cake. The cake is made ahead of time and kept chilled in a refrigerator. I am certain that freshly made the Pistachio Cream is delicious but after chilling it just turned into hard putty that you can't eat. Other issues with this dessert are I didn't recognize anything in the Chiffon Date Cake as Dates. I don't know if the cake had dates in it. I don't know if I got the wrong one either.  I tasted the cake and to be honest it tasted like a dry sorta sponge cake. I do note the coconut lime saffron sorbet was delicious and I used that to soak and moisten up the dry sponge of cake. I did question the waiter about the cake and he assured me I had the correct one. He also said the pastry chef was on vacation.  Even with the Summer Menu Pricing I feel three stars is an accurate rating for the execution of the steak and dessert in an upscale place.  Possibly a slightly off night.

Very upscale environment with amazing views and floor to ceiling windows. The pork tenderloin is awesome so make sure someone in your group orders this. The complimentary bread with three dips is delicious. Always a great experience.

oVaCSV88GjLa2iDchTtS3Q.text: I was really looking forward to a night out on my company at one of Phoenix's better restaurants but was not wowed. Lobster Bisque was excellent and is a house specialty.  Pea Shoot Salad is badly conceived and almost inedible. The shoots were tough and the table knife I had was oddly useless and would not cut them. When I did get a few to taste it was like eating pieces of hay and just as tasteless I tasted a friend's kale salad and that was the better choice The Duck Confit was just ok. Risotto was good, not much to the duck  Dessert selection was ok but I missed a pure chocolate selection.  Service was excellent - that deserves 5 stars

x7BE3gACZ_X2tDEVgUx4Yw.text: Been here and it's so amazing and romantic!!! The food and the ambiance is 5 Stars!!! The chefs and waiters are so professional.

rEPE0H4XXGoGMq6jDlp0nQ.text: The view is definitely breathtaking. I brought my wife here for our anniversary and she loved it. Will possibly make this our anniversary spot.

UVwQXDQ8JRJhbZhdRu-khw.text: I made a reservation here for our anniversary dinner through Open Table. We arrived early and sat on the downstairs patio to have a drink - the server who saw us in was less than accommodating and definitely not super friendly. She looked at her watch, told us we were really early and shoved a couple of drink menus to us and walked off.   Fortunately the service significantly approved after this. They gave us a table by the window with a beautiful view and our server was wonderful! Very knowledgable about the menu and various offerings, provided some great recommendations. The food itself was VERY good - no complaints there. For dessert, I was stuck between two choices and the server surprised me with both :) They even put "Happy Anniversary" chocolates on top of the desserts.   Overall a really great experience that comes with a spectacular view. A little pricey but that's to be expected.

muc14Kt8tPvzs3RJeUorcg.text: This place was Great for our company event  Good food Amazing view and he venue is amazing  Highly recommended

ARJ2GZeDB987WJdUg4zoVg.text: What an incredible place... the awards and accolades are well deserved. The view is unreal so try and reserve a table close to the window! I would recommend making a reservation- it was busy even on a Tuesday night.   Must try: lobster bisque to start, sea bass main dish, and the lemon/blueberry cheesecake dessert.   Aside from the views and food- The staff went above and beyond! Made the experience even more amazing. Do yourself a favor and try this place out if you're in AZ.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UIrcdQ6G2sX8mb7F02h9pw.text: My husband and I came here for dinner a couple nights ago for our anniversary.  The view is absolutely incredible! I definitely am not leaving a 3 star review because of the view. However, I was not impressed with the food and I felt the service could have been better. We ordered the pork belly as an appetizer which was delicious! The bread that is brought out while waiting for our food was mediocre. Although the spreads that came with the bread were very good! I ordered the filet mignon, and it was ok. I did not think it was worth the $47 it cost. I have had incredible steak at other restaurants in the past, and I did not think it was worth the cost.  Our server was an older gentleman and was nice, although it took him awhile to check in with us. He brought dessert menus and we ordered the chocolate and PB which was very good, and had a cute "happy anniversary" chocolate on it. I was a little taken aback when our dessert was not comped as we were there for a special occasion and spent over $150 between my husband and I. Then after bringing the check, it took about 20 mins before our waiter came back.  I would probably come back again for the view and the drinks, but would probably not eat dinner there again.

OTRgH1CqTQheMjF509yYBw.text: I really loved the scenery and the servers here were really nice. I will come back definitely.   Food was great too

-Mn2sCBhZ-KmN4Ph-Ql1eA.text: My boyfriend took me here for my early birthday dinner. It was nice that they knew it was my birthday but he had requested outside seats and we did not get it unfortunately.  It was Arizona restaurant week and there were amazing items to choose from. I don't have a picture of the lobster bisque but let me tell you, it was the best lobster bisque I've ever had. My boyfriend had the pork belly and it was delicious as well.  The entire dinner was delicious. No part of the meal was disappointing. Everything was flavorful and came at a good time. Our server was very attentive. The bread and dip was incredible as well. The pesto mixed with the cheese was out of this world.  The only thing that would have made this better was getting an outside seating since my boyfriend requested it a week in advance.

quC0gLehIulKOruqFlymAQ.text: My wife and I came here after driving here from Los Angeles.  The view is amazing and the food was equal to the task.  Our server guided us through the summer pre-fix three course meal with wine pairing.  We both started with the lobster bisque which was paired with a prosecco.  The lobster bisque was very rich and loaded with flavor.  The prosecco was excellent since it wasn't overly sweet and more on the dry side.  My wife ordered the sea bass, while I ordered the steak.  The sea bass was paired with an excellent Sauvignon Blanc while my steak was paired with a very nice Chardonnay.  I have to admit though the steak was good the sea bass was the highlight of our dining experience.  We finished our meal with the passion fruit caramel creme and the chocolate sorbet.  Though we were both full, we enjoyed the refreshing desserts.  We are glad the front desk staff recommended this restaurant and that they were on Open Table so it was easy to make reservations and we also got points on top of it.

SR8kfYkuIT8FDOZcGhWJJg.text: The name says it ALL! Amazing view from the restaurant. Sits on top of the mountain and you can see the city. It's breath taking! We went at 7pm and caught the sunset and also night views!   Celebrated my anniversary with my husband there and the staff was amazing right as we sat down the first thing they told us was Happy Anniversary because when my husband made the reservations he let them know it was our anniversary. Very romantic and definitely a date night kind of place.   We had a 3 course meal and the food was so delicious! At the end they brought us a desert with a chocolate that had "Happy Anniversary" written on it, I thought it was such a cute touch.   Grab your best outfit and head out for a wonderful date night or girls night!

gdFKF7D5diToXo3KV11Vaw.text: Came here for a special dinner with friends because one of my best friend's was getting proposed to as a surprise! I helped organize the dinner, we had to seat 10 and potentially with an accessible table so they sat us in the very entrance of the restaurant in which the lighting during the day was not prime for picture taking. Since it was a busy Saturday night we went with it, but I moved the surprise proposal outside. I let the hosts know and asked them to help me determine where we'd be able to get a good group shot, and my friend photographer (a friend with a camera - no professional photographers allowed, by the way) to hide. We decided on the west side outdoor patio area as there were no other people there. The host let the bar manager know of the surprise and I asked for 10 glasses or champagne  to toast to our friendship outside, still, under the guise of the surprise proposal. When the bar manager came out with the champ she said "congratulations!!!" To the table And almost ruined the surprise but we tried to shrug it off and it recovered quickly.   The views here are spectacular. At almost any point of the restaurant. The food was absolutely delicious, as were the cocktails. We shared a few appetizers and they were also well-seasoned, well-prepared and quite gratifying.   We did feel as though our server was not in the cheeriest of spirits and seemed to somewhat be rushing us, which wasn't very enjoyable. I don't know if it was because we were laughing and enjoying ourselves so heartily but for the amount of money spent and time we spent there - we shouldn't have felt this way at all.   They automatically added 20% gratuity, which is expected, but we added quite a bit additional because the food was so delicious, and the views - as I mentioned... breathtaking!

wP-z6aL8EXnKfGcUpfBURg.text: Awful service.. extremely rude and uptight staff. As guest of the hotel we were looking forward to a nice meal at the restaurant but ended up leaving and dining elsewhere after waiting for several minutes and a rude encounter with a server.

pinJg5uZruI5a85InnD6nA.text: Disappointed to be leaving a 3 star review here.  My boyfriend surprised me for our anniversary dinner and made a reservation at 5pm. I will say it was the perfect timing because we had a window view and sunset was at 5:25 pm.  Service: Exceptional. Richard was our server and he was great.  Ambience: Amazing with views of the city you can't beat.  Food: Medicore  For our appetizer we ordered the pork belly ravioli and that was pretty good. They also brought out bread with 3 different spreads (raspberry butter, a pesto sauce, and goat cheese sauce). The raspberry butter was pretty good but the pesto sauce was definitely the best!  For our entree we both ordered the filet mignon and that's where the dinner took a turn for the worst. It was covered in a bleu cheese sauce that completely threw off the entire meal! It was so disgusting I tried so hard to eat it but it was smothered and I HATE bleu cheese. The potatoes that came with the filet were good but we wasted $47 on a steak I couldn't even eat.  For dessert we got the Carmel apple cheesecake and that was good but so small it was a joke.   Great view but food was not worth the money at all.

xYWCSrZAx0mtnOIWuKIVpw.text: Great food, amazing views and wonderful service what a good combo.  We came here for the first time to celebrate our anniversary dinner and we enjoyed every moment of it. This place is very romantic and special, set on top of the hill with an incredible views.  We had beet salad to share it was delicious! I had the duck for entree and my husband had pork loin, we loved it! For dessert we had peanut butter and chocolate, it was delicious. We enjoyed every meals here because it was a perfect amount of food with perfect flavors except the bread was cold, so we sent it back.  We will definitely come back for another special occasion. Thank you Different Point of View!

OC72Ub20U0H9slEDC_h2Hw.text: I've been here twice in last 3 months (both times for birthday celebrations) and ordered the tasting menu. On both occasions, the meals were absolutely perfect. Everything was cooked perfectly and the wine pairings were perfect. The view, romantic ambience and service have all be perfect as well. The meals were so perfect, I've overlooked the inconvenient truth that in both occasions, large insects needed to be killed by a server that was observed by several people trying to enjoy the evening. Overall, I'd rate the dining experience a 4.8/5 because of this. We will return again soon. It's worth it THAT much.

bAL-pOjYkLsxYzKgIbxlCw.text: Decent place and has a breathtaking view. Went for a birthday party and had a good time. It is reasonably priced with the most expensive entree being around 50$. Had a great summer prixe Fixe menu deal for 44$ which included an appetizer, entree, and dessert. Service was good but not great, same with the food. It didn't take my breath away but I enjoyed myself. I personally had the sea bass and wasn't terribly impressed but it was a generous portion size. I feel as though there was a lack of flavor, and it could have been developed more. Scallops are a favorite, and the garlic thyme steak looked very good.

x8cnzSjeBOWFRoAXhltvKQ.text: If your looking for a special place to view the city and have a real taste of class then this is the place. For years this restaurant has been one of the go to places in the valley. From the mountain top at 6pm when the sunsets this is the place to be. Watching the sun settle over the valley as you sip on your favorite drink and eat some of the tastiest meals that tickle your palette.   My most recent experience was last Friday. I did a double date night with out of town guest. We arrived right in time to watch the sunset as we sat inside near the window. The perfect view for a late night affair. The four of us were proudly served by two gentlemen Nash and Tunde. These two served some of the pickiest eaters in the world, however had the most patience and polished menu enterprise a patron could admire. Every suggestion from the drinks, appetizers down to the entree were amazing. Not one person at our table complained. If anything we were planning our next date night experience here.   I have to appreciate not only was the food amazing the level of sincerity and calmness the staff had. Everyone we encountered was friendly. Making our over all experience feel very welcomed.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carmel Cheescake
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate Sorbet
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fingerling potatoes

NO_Ab9unviR4u2qbPa6dqA.text: We went for a special occasion. Really hoped to rate this place higher. The main reason for only three stars was the service. The second item that lowered the overall rating was some of the food was good, not great for the price. Here we go.  Atmosphere: hard to beat the view at this place. We sat at a table by the window after the sun had already gone down. Beautiful city light views, hard to beat. The restaurant does feel a little dated. We sat on the patio after dinner, but this place closes pretty early and they asked several of us couples to leave because they were closing. They were very friendly about it, but it was a bummer since it was still pretty early and we were enjoying the view. We did have a cool experience and saw a snake on the outside front stairs on our way out to our car. We really did think that was cool since this restaurant is built on the mountain. Overall I give the atmosphere an 8.5 out of 10.  Service: this is where the rating really suffered. We arrived and found nobody upfront to lead us to our table. Not the end of the world, but not great. Our waiter, a middle-aged gentleman who was thoroughly forgettable, was not friendly at all. I don't believe in the two hours we were there that he smiled once. He was not helpful or prompt in any way. He was decidedly not-excited to share specials or make recommendations for those of us who had never eaten there before. It seemed apparent that he did not want to be there and was entirely uninterested in providing positive, quality service. He genuinely dragged down the overall enjoyment factor. I would rate service a 5 out of 10, and only that high because our serving assistant/bus person was friendly.  Food: the food was good. Not exceptional. My wife's meal was outstanding, I remember mine was good, but we've already forgotten what I ordered, clearly it was unremarkable. I do also recall that the portion size was not large, just adequate. The various sauces and butters for the bread were so bland that they weren't enjoyable. Wine was not great. However, the overall quality and presentation of everything was good. I rate food 8 out of 10.  Value: reasonable, a bit on the expensive side for the quantity. I rate value 7.5 out of 10.  Overall: the big question is, would I return? I would give "A Different Pointe of View" a second chance if I knew we would have a different server. It probably would have improved our overall rating by one additional star. Would I recommend you try it? I would, but with cautious optimism.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Night view, beautiful!

Dzkx8cBYAJQDLV8is6GKQQ.text: Nash was our server and he was wonderful. Very pleasant, great sense of humor and knowledgeable. It goes without saying, the view was spectacular, ambiance was perfect for this special occasion and food and drinks were superb. We are definitely going back to hopefully catch the sunset view from the beautiful patio area.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great Patio, especially at sunset
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

waHFuVk9BsvqPd8vn5Lapw.text: I love this place. Expensive, but gorgeous view and great food and wine. This time they even brought marshmallows for the group to toast while we were having cocktails. My one critique is that they should offer a vegetarian/vegan option, but the hummus is heavenly, the salads without cheese are still tasty and unique, and last time I ordered the side of vegetables and they were amazing (granted I was a few glasses of wine deep at this point). Must visit restaurant in Phoenix.

3G8n1rkGY16UEZ13xuRzLA.text: We had another Fantastic Holiday at Different Pointe of View!! Our first time was the Thanksgiving Buffet, we were so Impressed!! So when we booked for the Christmas Buffet, we knew we would be in for another delicious meal overlooking the Stunning View!! The service was Amazing for how busy they were! The buffet was stocked with Everything one would desire for a Holiday Feast!! Everything piping hot and prepared beautifully!! This is quite a skill considering the amount of traffic there...servers always bringing out additional goodies so nothing looked sparse or unappealing!! Our table was on a balcony so we had Superb Views even though we weren't near the window!! Thanks for another Wonderful Holiday!!
