JpXr3EsKT1oTQLzsRm7I5A.text: Beautiful view, try going at sunset. The food was great, but did not seem up to par for the elegance of the restaurant. I would still go back and give it another try.

Q-szH9mjQFf7YkCJyzpigw.text: Lovely setting, excellent service, outstanding food quality combines to make this well worth the trip.  Highly recommended.

7vfkiEWrWJMuOe37gGtM8w.text: Here's the theme of Different Pointe of View- you're there for the view, and you're paying for the view.  Entrees run from $25-$39, and it's completely worth the cost, especially at sunset.  There is an expansive outdoor terrace if you need to be in the open air to take in the panorama from South Mountain to downtown to Squaw Peak and everything in between. After dark, the valley lights up like stars laid out on the desert floor.  The menu is American with some French, Latin and Native American influence. Don't pass up the scallops. They're amazing.  Halibut is also a great pick from the entrees. It was cooked perfectly and the portion size was almost enough to have leftovers.   The wine list is just gratuitous, but you can find some affordable and decent wines by the glass for under $10.  Service was attentive without hovering, and due to the dimly lighted atmosphere, the servers sometimes use a small flashlight when serving your courses and explaining what's on your plate.  Great for a romantic meal, a special occasion, or to bring your out of town guests for drinks and for the view.

W86espPmBFaeLSDYQtEr0w.text: Dinner and service was amazing! Had a great deal which was a 3 course meal for 44 dollars. I got lobster bisque which was to die for, salmon, and creme brulee. Every thing was delicious! And the view was so beautiful. My boyfriend and I had a lovely time. Ask for Luis, he is a great server and will take very good care of you!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w6Wy1guUtHXwJNg4YuUW6w.text: Been here twice. The food is good. The risotto with farm poached egg is to DIE for.   Ambience is nice, especially at sunset with that AMAZING view!  Both times I've been the restaurant has been more than half empty, which makes you wonder if you're missing something that others have figured out...

boqPkxAqdJZs2lhnvsTzUw.text: I'd first off like to say that my experience at this beautiful restaurant was amazing. Amazing waiter and amazing service. The food was great I had the chicken Fulton, which tasted good until arriving home. Soon to realize I had gotten food poisoning, from this amazingly rated restaurant. I'm so disappointed, it's unreal. I expected a lot more than to consume contaminated food. I will not be returning due to the nature of my horrific ending to this food.

-vNGfnokxTiMZMzkCbEBOw.text: Yet another Fantastic YELP ELITE EVENT....WOHOOO....let me spell it out for you:  F.....for Fabulous Food A.....for Awesome Atmosphere N....for Nostalgic Nightlife T.....for Tantalizing Tidbits A....for Awesome Ambience S....for Superb Service T....for Tempting Treasures I.....for Invigorating  C.....for Complementary Cuisine  Yes at A Different Pointe of View Restaurant all of the above can certainly be enjoyed however it's True value is the VIEW of the Valley of the Sun.....it is unmatched. The manager said if we could find a better view in Arizona....please let him know....well I don't know about the Entire state of Arizona....but as for the Valley maybe the view from the Wrigley mansion would come close.....but it can't touch the AWESOME VIEWS you can witness at A Different Pointe of View. Don't take my word for it....just try it for yourself and I think you will see things from a Different Pointe of View as well. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!

N-QuqSRw4Cxso9BH6SeuwA.text: The view is beautiful, however the service at to front was obnoxious. The hostesses had zero business working in a restaurant. We had reservations and when we showed up we asked for an outside table and were told "Your third in line so you're going to wait". We were then told to go to the bar and wait our turn. We ended up finding a beautiful table at the bar that is one floor lower when one of the hostesses came and got us and told us our table was ready. We left our table to go the restaurant, only to be seated inside even though we had specifically said we would wait for an outside table. When we asked the hostess again for an outside table, she said to leave the table and go to the lobby. When we got to the lobby, they said that if we wanted an outside table we should have put it on our reservation and now we can stand in line. We ended up leaving the restaurant and eating at the lounge one floor below. It has great service and beautiful views without the unwelcome ambiance of the restaurant.

EJFSGzB8QPoGAy3Iu0Fqaw.text: Who knew Arizona had views? :) I took my boyfriend here for his birthday after a rough week of school and this establishment was perfect, it even RAINED and we still had the best time.  I wanted to take him to a restaurant with a view, and we were growing tired of the Downtown Phoenix/Scottsdale restaurants so I decided to try this place. The vibe of the place is very dressy, sophisticated, so come in your best dress. Reservations are flexible (I used OpenTable) and we were seated promptly near the window, with a gorgeous view of the city on a Friday night. If you have time, be sure to go to the Terrace Room for drinks, so you can have a cocktail and sit atop the hill and warm up next to the fire.   Once seated, our waiter was super courteous and funny, even the busboys were extremely gracious and polite. I never felt pressured to order anything (though they DO have a $9000 bottle of wine on the menu!) and was never intimidated by the atmosphere. We had focaccia bread the lobster bisque to start, and it was very impressive, be mindful that the texture is smooth, not chunky, and the flavors are very complex. We loved it. For entrees, I had the grilled endive and apple salad, which was surprisingly refreshing and not too sweet! The boyfriend had the duck breast and potato cakes, which had a perfect cook and looked just beautiful.   We finished by sharing a Birthday chocolate cupcake, which was cold but free :P As I think about it, I think the food was pricey mostly due to the location and the view, but I really can't say anything negative about the food, it was great. Take your loved one to this restaurant for great food and the experience. Definitely one of a kind in Arizona.

-gjutkrwmn5WS86KRki2Wg.text: Simply amazing. Breathtaking views. Excellent service. The food was incredible and best of all the now fiance said yes. Be prepared for the price but I guarantee you will not be disappointed. They even gave us free champaign and dessert. Will definitely be back for our 1 year anniversary. Four stars or four diamonds either way this place is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Picture does not do this place justice. But trust me the view is incredible.

De3p02KPP60rao05juSVwQ.text: As Valley residents for over 30 years my wife and I have long been aware of the Different Pointe of View, but had never dined there.  We had been to Different Pointe in Time several times, but never "up high."  For those who don't know, DPOV offers a nice view of downtown Phoenix along 7th St, especially during the winter and spring when the sun sets relatively early.  It perches high atop a mountain peak adjacent to the Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs resort.  Bear this in mind because, while DPOV is often considered a great spot for special occasions for local residents, it is a resort and there is no apparent dress code in the restaurant.  The night we were there we observed patrons in flip-flops, shorts, T-shirts, and baseball caps worn backwards at the dinner table.  Not what you'd expect at a nicer restaurant, but it is a resort and these folks are on vacation and didn't feel like dressing up at the least.  This resort atmosphere may also explain why there are no table clothes here, just a wooden table.   Others here have commented on the drive to the top, the restaurant's atmosphere, etc.  Although many reviewers praised the service, we did not feel it was up to par.  The pace was extremely leisurely and at times very slow.  We waited over 10 minutes for our dessert, and the restaurant was not at all busy.  The pace was so slow that with a 6:30 pm reservation we didn't depart the restaurant until 8:45 pm. For appetizers my wife had the beef cheeks, which was fabulous.  Skimpy on the portion for $15.50, maybe 1.5 oz of meat, but what a delightful flavor.  I had the parmesan risotto with poached egg and black truffle for $13.95.  Again, just excellent.  Unfortunately, these dishes turned out to be the highlights of the evening. My wife had the poached pear butter lettuce salad with Humbolt Fog cheese, which we both love, candied almonds, and pomegranate seeds.  We both thought it was good, if a little skimpy for $14.00. For her entree my wife had the duck confit.   She loves duck and thought this was delicious.  I had a bite and it was good, if a little dry.  Now, for $36.00 you think you'd get more than a leg and a thigh, after all a duck is not a large bird, but that's all you get, maybe 3-4 oz. of protein, on a risotto bed.  If you have a big appetite I suggest you select another entree.  Local Christopher's and Crush Lounge's, at the Biltmore plaza, duck breast confit for about the same dollars is far superior. I accepted our waiter's pitch for the daily special of prawns, served on a black bean puree with squash pellets.  I know the difference between prawns, both biologically and size-wise, and what I got was just large shrimp, 5 pieces.  They were okay, a little overcooked, but they were not prawns.  For $38.00, I could have fed both of us a shrimp dinner at Red Lobster and there would have been little difference in taste.  .  I should have complained to him but he so rarely stopped by the table to follow up that it didn't seem worth the effort.  Plus, I didn't want to wait while another entree was prepared. For dessert my wife ordered the carrot cake, another major favorite.  The presentation was different because she didn't get a normal slice, but three half circles of a tubular carrot cake.  Again, for $9.50 we've had better.  The flavor was not overwhelming and the texture resembled fruit cake.  I recommend you try something else. Overall, I'd say the restaurant's emphasis is on plate presentations, which were outstanding, rather than food quality or quantity. With three glasses of wine and tip the bill was over $200.00.  I never mind a tab that large if the value and ambiance are there.  Neither of us felt they were and probably would not return.

SqBzFgp777xYpV4qApP6aA.text: Hotel restaurant.... Overpriced for mediocre food and terrible service; right? WRONG!!  We had gotten out and about while in Phoenix but finally decided to stay local and went to the Pointe which is on the top of the hill from the resort we stayed at The Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort.  We walked from our room, not for the faint of heart, and the grounds, and the building are beautiful, rocks, fountains, landscaping and all.  The third floor is where the main dining room is and as we past the second floor leading up we past a Christmas party which looked sheik, and I thought wow, that's a good sign if locals go here. The view is breathtaking and my pictures don't do it justice but their web site does. We were seated by the window and Corey took care of us along with an unnamed busser who was equally skilled.   We started with Blood Orange And Rocket Arugula Salad, and Roasted Butternut Squash Ravioli. Both Outstanding in the WOW category. We followed that up with:  Pan Seared Diver Scallops charred organic rainbow cauliflower, roasted sun chokes, black fermented garlic, apple basil evoo emulsion And: A filet Mignon that today I can't find on their site the way we had it. With mushrooms, and blue cheese. See picture.  We closed with: Classic Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee lemon cooler cookie, fresh berries  and coffee  We were not rushed for an hour and half, and the service was perfect. There, pleasant and efficient as we needed and disappeared when we didn't.   It is pricy. What restaurant with outstanding view, ambience, service, and food isn't?

zrytNK8onRblbFxzaaREnQ.text: Absolutely breath taking views with amazing food! Our waiter was great his name was Ian (he looked exactly like Billy Campbell). I would recommend doing a reservation between 6:30 and 7:00 that seemed to have been the perfect time. We ordered the bass and pork tenderloin and both were amazing. Also had the goat cheese potatoes as our side (Ian let us substitute) and a side order of the gnocchi (which I'm still drooling over). Then for dessert we had this amazing cinnamon pudding sponge cake with ice cream and it was delicious! I will definitely be back and would definitely recommend this restaurant!

UHr-nBaxjKkRKm48QaKM8A.text: Overall, decent place. Excellent views. Good service. No complaints. It's a bit pricey but you're splurging. Is what it is.

pfmbauMVuxIrDsGjWB9_hg.text: Overall this place was great. The service was great, our server was excellent, the hosts were kind and everyone there works together to deliver the high quality experience. My reason for not giving five stars is because the quality of the food just didn't WOW me. It was fancy, don't get me wrong, but the overall taste just didn't seem to match up for the price paid. I picked this restaurant over all others specifically based on the high reviews and apparent quality of food and I was hoping to be WOW'ed. I'll visit again but just for appetizers, which really WOW'ed me!

4J94LJLsxfMN7dQPL3HvFg.text: Maybe the best oysters I have ever had.   Would think about coming back to Phoenix just to go and eat them again.   Everything was excellent, but those oysters.....

M-yqub4iOgEpnhZWnlYWww.text: Finding the address is easy (just follow 7th Street), finding the restaurant a little trickier as you have to drive past the entrance to the hotel first and not be tempted to nab one of the open parking spots - you've got a ways to go yet. Keep ascending and eventually, when your car has almost given out on you, you'll find Different Point of View.   Valet was free and friendly. Up one flight of stairs and you'll find yourself in the bar. Up one more flight of stairs and you'll find the restaurant.  Decor is classy, but a little dated. Of course, not many people will be looking at the furniture when they see the view. A floor to ceiling glass window facing south, with downtown Phoenix in the distance. We were lucky enough to get one of the tables by the window as we had an earlier reservation (6:30) in order to see the sunset. There is a patio outside which would be a great location to sit and watch the sun go down, if only it wasn't 110 outside!  The wine list is very good, and expansive. There seems to be something for everyone, from multiple thousand dollar bottles of Premier Cru Bordeauxs to more affordable domestic wines. The only comment I would make is that there wasn't as much variety in the by-the-glass selection.  In addition the the regular menu, they offer a three course prix fixe deal for $40  - select the options that are printed in red and the selections were surprisingly good. The second prix fixe option is the Chef's choice seven course meal for $79pp with the option to add a wine pairing for an additional $29pp. The table next to ours had the Chef's choice and it seemed to be a great deal. We weren't that hungry and the OH wasn't drinking, so we chose the 3-course menu.  For apps the OH ordered the watermelon salad, which was good, but a little boring. A slice of seared watermelon and some mustard greens or rape. I ordered the lobster bisque and thought it was excellent, but would have liked to have seen some lobster meat instead of everything being pureed. It had a great flavour.  For entrees I had the daily addition, which tonight was Beef Short Ribs - delectable, melt in your mouth, amazing. She ordered the Trout which was perfectly cooked and served on a bed of shrimp and enoki mushrooms.  Dessert was Classic Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee and Chocolate Turtle. They were both good, but the creme brulee was in a league of it's own. You can see why it is their signature dessert!  Service was very good and my water glass was never close to empty. Luis was our server and he told us he had worked there for 11 years, he said there were other servers who had worked there for much longer. His service was very professional, although a little pandering at times.  Summary - This is a great place for a date night. It's romantic, the service is good, the food very good and the view spectacular. You should go.

j6wTMwCg2Lnhy_lCoVVq6w.text: Great view. Awesome service. Delicious food. I recommend the lobster bisque, and filet.

nx2h56a_XwFazo3xgyws7A.text: If you're looking for somewhere romantic to eat this is the place. I took my girlfriend here for her 21st birthday and we absolutely loved it. We can't stop talking about how great our waiter was. His name was Nash and he is by far the best waiter either of us have ever had. If you're going to eat here (you definitely should) ASK FOR NASH. You will not regret it. He will go above and beyond to make your night that much more enjoyable. He's got a great sense of humor and he's an over all great guy that knows how to take care of his people. Nash if you read this thank you for a great evening and we will definitely be coming back asking for you.

NISoRhixY8KIhow5IUY_Ig.text: Wonderful dining experience!  Fantastic view.  Great service.  the chef's tasting menu was a outstanding.  Adding the wine pairing made for a great meal. Each wine was outstanding and a very generous pour.

Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dqEz6vdTFO7BwjYbqub7WQ.text: We went here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we we're not disappointed at all. The place was very romantic, service was exquisite and food was detectable.   We ordered their "Cheft's Choice Menu" and we we're not despondent at all. Everything was mouthwatering and the attendant was very enthusiastic in assisting us in whatever we need.  The price was NOT bad at all with what you're getting.

m5QEVmkboX2A2_uyNyUhFw.text: This is one of the most beautiful views you'll find of the valley! The restaurant is at the top of the mountain and you have your choice of indoor or outdoor seating - but the wall of windows for eating indoors makes you feel like you have a view of forever.  The appetizers are all amazing - we've tried them all!  Any of the fish recipes are the best I've had in the Phoenix area.  When you are done with dinner, they have an outdoor firepit area that is truly incredible.  It's good for having an adult beverage and a good cigar if that is your thing.  Highly recommend you visit.

NfVrU4RasDSHoj0g5oWyyQ.text: My first time and I love it. The service was great. I feel very relax. The food is very good. I'll will go again and bring my family and friends next time

psOtMkpmKECNoetWsbpHIg.text: Yes, the view is amazing, but the service is also top-notch. The atmosphere is very upscale and you feel that beyond just the decor and sport coats. The sommelier was very helpful and friendly and seemed more interested in telling you the story of each wine of interest than he did making sure you got the one with the highest price tag.  Food was amazing, of course, but you'd expect that from a place of this caliber.

SBvhT2Xg8pjokBWDSDefgQ.text: My boyfriend and I dined at DPOV last night for our one year anniversary, it has been on our list of places to try for a while now, and I'm so mad we waited so long! We were blown away by how amazing everything was! We have both been in the service industry, and truly felt like we were treated so special! Food was amazing!! Wine pairings were spot on. Our server Luis was so knowledgable and personable, that we can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RMFeMMIAf05F3uQsOUzaLw.text: The restaurant created a very unwelcoming and negative experience. There was a waiter that was very snippy and curt that kept coming to my table. He spoke in a condescending manner towards the guests at my table. The rude attitude coming from restaurant staff set the pace for the whole evening experience.  The subpar service was so bad we had to swap waiters. It was a big disappointment for what could have been a nice evening.  Equally important, I ordered Hydroponic Bibb Lettuce Salad with baby tomatoes, crispy pancetta, toasted brioche croutons, sweet garlic parmesean dressing. I thought the salad portion was very skimpy and served on a large plate.  Next, I ordered The Chef's Daily Featured Dish which was a Grilled Halibut over a bed of Creamy Risotto and a small portion of Asparagus. I was more disappointed when I lifted my fork from the risotto and human hair came out. This is not what I should be finding in my food at an establishment like this. I ordered a Peanut Butter & Chocolate dessert. It had milk chocolate with peanut butter mousse, peanut butter carmel cream and butter honey ice cream.  I addressed the issues with management. The management spent a lot of time making excuses and arguing.  I ended up leaving the restaurant feeling very disappointed, dissatisfied and unhappy with the evening. It is a shame because the view of the city is unique.  However, the city view and dinner is not enjoyable or worth the expense if you end up getting the same type of dinning experience I had.  The food might look appealing but, it isn't very appetizing if you are going to be finding things in the food that should not be served in it.  Therefore, I find it difficult to recommend Different Pointe of View to others. The restaurant needs to work on creating a welcoming atmosphere that guests can enjoy.  Also, they need to improve the level of service provided for the premium price they are demanding.

znAD9eA4TnJ4wTnWMG1xeQ.text: My wife and I dined at the Different Pointe of View restaurant, located on the property of Pointe Hilton Tapatio Cliffs Resort, on Saturday evening July 23, 2016 AD. I apologize for the late review.  It was our first wedding anniversary and I wanted to pull-out all the stops! I wanted an elegant restaurant, fantastic cuisine, top-notch service and a view of the sunset and city lights that would memorialize the evening forever!  I +highly recommend+ this restaurant for anniversaries and other super-special occasions! You will want to dress-to-the-nines - bare minimum would be a suit, collared shirt or vest with tie and slacks.  Be sure to book reservations as far in advance as you can! They have valet parking so be sure to bring some cash for the tip. Valet is the only way to go for a night like this! Bring a decent camera - the valet should offer to take a photo of you and your party next to a beautiful fountain as you enter. Gorgeous!  The hostess told me when I booked the reservation that she couldn't guarantee a window seat, but that I could arrive 30 minutes early, check-in and they could work on a window seat then. That is exactly what we did and only had to wait 10 minutes. IT WAS WORTH IT! I also told the hostess when I made the reservation, that it was our first wedding anniversary and requested any special treatment they offered. When we arrived at our table, we had two glasses of champagne to greet us! Perfect!  Our server was awesome and the food was spectacular! It is a 5-star restaurant with 5-star pricing. It was well worth it and we will be back in the future to celebrate special events with our family!  After dinner we walked to the Terrace Room lounge, one level below the Different Pointe of View restaurant, and went outside to look at the city lights. The lounge is nice and would be a great place to relax before or after dinner.  The hostess and staff of the Different Pointe of View restaurant could not have been better! I will proudly recommend this establishment to all of my family and friends! Keep up the great work! Thank you for making our first wedding anniversary truly memorable!  A solid 5-stars!

hETj4KH1AUqk8-NzOI7S1A.text: I always love coming here! I've never had a bad meal here. The food is quality and has a higher end feel without being over priced. Love the Christmas dinner buffet and the summer prix fix menu, too!   And obviously.... the views.

B9Pif3FC9oI4qDLcxskwNA.text: Do not hesitate. Go. Now. What would you like to hear? Service, food, selection all excellent. That's would one likes in an eatery. On top of that, yes, location, architectural nuances, exceed expectation. Oh, and that view? All the way to South Mountain and everything in between.

sEJVlerciZxVrYwX8klk1w.text: Beautiful location for an evening experience. The view of Phoenix as the sun set was inspirational as well as relaxing. The food choices were tantalizing. My wife is a vegetarian who often feels left out of the culinary experience. She was pleasantly surprised. The Chef came out to make sure we were satisfied. Nice touch! Cory our server was excellent! We did not feel rushed at all. However, we never became restless waiting for anything. We will be back.

PuPB3ASMILg8Z33w5Xh0hQ.text: Beautiful location in Phoenix - perfect view for a nice evening. It was very pleasant when we went there. We went to the bar area which is equally good - you still get to see the view that you see from the restaurant - just from a slightly lower height. Food was okay, not much of a selection for food on their bar menu.. drinks were good! Location scores over everything else - I can just spend hours over there

rbTzUuuBAgxs9sBrkiqKDg.text: One of the best views in the city and the food is incredible. I took my wife here for our anniversary and the service and food were all excellent. Would definitely come back.

XLHL4zLJOWKwzXFlOg_glA.text: I was here to celebrate my birthday last night. After choosing between Durants and a Different Point of View, I cannot be more happier to have chosen this place in the end. The atmosphere was as beautiful as I last remembered it. The amazing view from our dining table remains unchanged. I cannot think of a better place to end a perfect evening with friends. Last time I was here was over 3 years ago. Their menus (especially the dessert) have changed a lot since then. They currently offer a summer pre-fix menu (appetizer, main entree and dessert) for only $39.95. Normally, a single dish alone already cost just as much. If budget allows, I highly recommend you to come here before this special ends. Since I didn't see anything that caught my attention (until I tried my friend's dishes after the fact), I've decided to order it from the regular menu last night. For my main course, I had the Roasted Duck and a Classic Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee for dessert. Roasted Duck was a bit dry for my taste. Overall, it was still tasty. My dessert had just the right amount of sweet and it was beautifully decorated. All of my friends ordered 3 courses prefix menu. I was able to try a little bit of everything (benefit of having foodie friends). I wish I would have ordered the Seared Stone Fish instead. The portion was generous and delicious. My other friend was a bit disappointed at the Shrimp Ravioli (Basil Pesto, Summer Greens, Garlic Chips, Sweet Corn Reduction). It was tasty, but it only had a tiny bit of shrimp in it. My second choice in dessert would be the Peanut Butter & Chocolate (Milk Chocolate Peanut Butter Mousse, Honey Caramel, Cocoa Peanuts, Caramelized Banana Ice Cream). All dishes were beautifully decorated; atmosphere is amazing and service was outstanding. Which is why a Different Point of View has earned a 5 star review from me. I will definitely come back here again on special occasion. Be aware when you are driving up to the restaurant. The road is narrowed and parking is a bit hectic. Valet is available. Even though formal attire isn't required, I highly recommend it :) P.S. Reservation can be made through "Open Table" and here is the link for their summer prefix menu: tapatiocliffshilton.com/...

6YU88ghlh0Osfx_KusYyCw.text: I love Different Pointe of View!  I came here for Restaurant week, made reservations, and watched the sun set. My fiance thought it was the best view from a restaurant he has seen so far!   Service was spectacular - first course, Buttermilk Fried Soft Shell Crab Honey Sweet Corn Polenta, Asparagus Puree, Piquillo Pepper Emulsion. It was a whole small crab and I ate that thing like it was no one's business!  Second course - Seared Blue Nose Sea Bass Crispy Saffron Parmesan Risotto Cake, Rapini, Peppadew Pepper Reduction. My oh my! It was so deliciously scrumptious!  Third course - Peanut butter cheesecake was so damn yummy! It was a good ending to a great meal! We went outside right after the dinner on to the patio and the view is breathtaking!   Even with restaurant week prices, you do spend more than $50/pp with tax, wine, and tip...but it was worth it!

6H8RuO74KaSMHWA8UiQpGw.text: We had the privilege of meeting Austin who had excellent customer service. He was extremely kind and always on top of catering whatever need we had. He was one of the best waiters I have ever came across. I hope in the future the expand their menu to offer some vegan options!

adfDZO-KbZrIrG1RD3HxHw.text: I came here on a Friday evening with a girlfriend visiting from California and wanted to show her a place that exemplifies the beauty of Arizona. This definitely is an awesome spot to take someone for their birthday, anniversary, or any special occasion. The view is definitely a part of the experience and a gorgeous place to catch the sunset. The staff was very gracious and courteous from the moment I stepped in.  Since we came at 6PM right at opening, we got one of the prime tables inside facing the view! The staff were so accommodating and took pictures for us before we had our dinner. We both wanted to try out the summer prix-fixe menu ($39.95) which included an appetizer, entree, and dessert. My gf got the mirin & lime seared ahi tuna salad, day boat California bass, and peanut butter/chocolate mousse. I got their famous lobster bisque (which has been a staple for 30+ years and made from real lobster), porcini crusted pork tenderloin, and stone fruit clafouti. Since we both love food, we shared everything. The ahi tuna and California bass were fresh and delicious considering the fish was obviously not from Arizona. The lobster bisque was very rich and smooth, but I was slightly disappointed that there were no lobster chunks in the bisque. The pork tenderloin was quite dry and I only had a little piece in the restaurant so I could take the rest home to recook with more moisture and marinade which actually tasted better the next day. The peanut butter chocolate mouse was decadent and tasty! Finally the clafouti. I actually had no idea what it was and was told it was like a cobbler. It tasted more like a soggy piece of floppy pie so I do not recommend it!   Overall, the food was pretty decent depending on what you ordered, but the view was impeccable!

8pZyxsDE1uYM7nF-8eI3rg.text: Great restaurant. Food, service and atmosphere are all on Pointe! Try the Bibb and apricot salad the flavor architecture is phenomenal, it keeps evolving as you chew. The seafood is so fresh. The drinks were very generous and absolutely great. Have them make you a Maker's Mark old fashioned. Ian was our waiter, one of the best waiters I have ever met, he knew everything about the menu. Chef Anthony came by to talk with us after our meal and was happy to hear the praise, we had no criticisms here. The view was absolutely spectacular. The night was finished off with a delicious creme brulee on the patio overlooking the city. I cannot wait to go back.

Y4P6jZJbPmRO4e_EcIGwiA.text: This was the first time I was there, Friday, September 28, 2018.  Nothing can beat the unbelievable beautiful views at this place...however, I could hike a mountain to see gorgeous views.  I was very disappointed at the servers' bad attitudes (several) and inconsistent mixed drinks out on the patio in the evening.  It truly makes or breaks a good experience.  Perhaps some customer service lessons from the Scottsdale Fairmont Princess is in order.  I hope they correct this soon.

A0HDjG9xffdrmTXjJ3BszA.text: Lovely views, great ambiance, food and service. We had a beautiful view of the city at our table and got to watch the sun set while eating. Note that all the window view tables seem to be 4-tops so large parties will probably be seated more towards the center or the other side of the restaurant.  They are currently running a prix-fixe summer special. For $39.95 you get your choice of starter, entree, and dessert. The choices were varied enough that we could choose from the prix-fixe menu and be satisfied with our selections. I had the lobster bisque, stone fish, and ended the meal with a strawberry shortcake. I also sampled some of the short rib, bistro steak, and duck (Regular menu item).   We started our meal with some complimentary bread and a selection of maple pepper compound butter, pepper sauce, and goat cheese spread. The goat cheese spread and the pepper sauce were excellent but I couldn't taste too much of the maple or pepper flavor in the compound butter.   The lobster bisque was rich, creamy smooth, with a concentrated lobster flavor. It was superb.  The stone fish entree was a True delight. The fish had an even crispy sear on it with perfect tender succulent meat. It was perched on top of rice, mushrooms, shrimp, and onion. The colors, textures, and flavors meshed well with the delicate taste of the fish. The only negative was that the lobster soy mushroom broth was too salty for my tastes. The other dishes I tried were cooked to perfection.  Dessert was a delightful "tres" strawberry cake, with a trio of macerated strawberries and rhubarb, strawberry cheesecake ice cream, and strawberry sauce. We had an additional complimentary set of rich, luxurious chocolates with toffee(?) pieces in them.   Service was impeccable. Thanks to Darren for helping to make our night wonderful!  The restaurant can be a little difficult to get to, since it's so high up the mountain and a lot of the road here is one way, steep, and narrow so drive with caution (Especially with all the touristy folk driving about). You have the option of valet or self-park.  One thing to note ladies: This is not a heel friendly venue, so walk with caution or prepare your footwear accordingly. The walkway, although beautifully designed, is made of natural rough stones which make for an uneven walking surface. Once you reach the restaurant you'll have a slightly steep flight of stairs to walk up before you meet the host/hostess.  Overall 4.5/5.

ADStti9irP5DzhGbp5Blyg.text: Excellent dining for a romantic place for you and your significant other , staff is great very attentive always ready to serve you. Food is good but not anything to brag about would recommend for a romantic dinner

MvJney5rg016XFeak7eRVA.text: My daughter and I ate there to celebrate her graduation and my birthday. We sat next to the window and had an amazing view of the city below. The Bison Steak, Pork Loin and dessert were all AMAZING. THE service was top notch, as well!!

YU-ofNWQQUTocZOGaaHC9A.text: I didn't know what to expect food wise when I dined here. It's been my experience, in the past, that when a restaurant has a great view, the food can be lacking.   That was not the case here. I had the tuna tartare, and the swordfish. Both were amazing and did not disappoint. I was on edge about the tuna, as I had never had it, but it was excellent. The waiter suggested a nice dry rose to complement the meal.   Service was a bit on the slow side, but this is not a place you go to rush through your dining experience. Watching the sunset with the mountains as the backdrop was the cherry on top for us.

owQND1ewMS_jKoksO-BINg.text: Had dinner here last night. My daughter will be getting married next month and I was in town for the week for her bridal showers. I wanted to have a special evening with her and made reservations here with a couple friends while staying at the resort. The place is beautiful. We had a good table by the window. The food was delicious and cooked to perfection. I had the chefs special of the evening which was halibut. My daughter had the filet and friend had scallops and lobster. Everyone was satisfied with their dinner. Service was a little on the slow side. Also, it was a special occasion which they noted on the reservation but never mentioned when greeted or throughout the dinner. Would have been a nice touch if that was recognized since it was noted when the reservation was made. But overall we enjoyed ourself, loved the food, and got some good Picts! Our waiter was kind enough to take some pictures for us.

okPVnl9PFhq_HLCEtCV5Dg.text: Stopped there primarily for the view and have a few drinks on the patio, but ended up staying for the prix fixe dinner. The halibut was overcooked, it's not chicken. The best thing was the dessert: peanut butter chocolate mousse with carmelized banana ice cream. It was kind of a haul on Uber from the JW Marriott. But I'll probably pop in there again next month to have drinks under the stars and listen to the coyotes.

dkIXnyRQCrFEssR-Qws9uQ.text: This was such a great experience! The view was unrivaled - the food was incredible - and the service was friendly. We went on a Tuesday night and ordered steak, it wasn't very crowded so we were able to get a window table. However ; my dad and I are both very patient and we both felt for such a low key night that the service seemed slow . Don't come here if you are in a hurry! It's def best for slow sipping wine and enjoying your company. I was with my dad who was coming to visit me for the first time in AZ - but this would be perfect for a romantic couple. Also , be prepared for the steep drive up! It's very fun!

DoxXZZ3W7HSBSMhm4clNFw.text: We were really excited to try this restaurant for our anniversary while in town. The views are incredible and the wine list is quite good. Unfortunately our service was really disappointing. Perhaps he was having a bad day, but our server barely spoke to us. I told him I couldn't decide between 2 dishes, and instead of giving me more detail about each, or sharing with me his favorite, he said, "Its up to you." Our server was very slow to the table, and rarely came back to check on us at all. We were never asked how the meal was, or if we wanted another drink. We had to flag our waiter down to get another glass. Our food was okay, the Scallops, while a very generous portion, were pretty salty and the pork tenderloin was average at best.Perhaps this is a good place to get a cocktail in the bar, but I'd skip the dinner.

HRjFM4YxYE5W6kN2unghxg.text: Had such an amazing dinner!  My mom and I came here for a nice way to end our vacation and it did not disappoint!  I made a reservation about a month in advance, we were seated inside right at a window with a stunning view. This the best place to see a Phoenix sunset.   We had the mussels to start and they were very tasty (so was the complimentary bread with various spreads!).  I had the filet mignon and it was sooooo tender.  Very well flavoured and a nice portion size.  The grits it came with seemed a little salty to me at first but once I put some on the filet, it was a perfect match!  My mom ordered the other cut of steak. It was extremely flavourful, she found it to be a bit tough of a cut for her liking but she enjoyed it. The potato galette that came with her meal was phenomenal too!  We order a side of veggies and decided we could have done without them.  The entrees came with enough food themselves. We also found the veggies to be a bit mushy and had an odd seasoning on them that we could have done without.  This didn't take away from the amazing meal at all, we just thought we could skip it in the future.   The view is to die for! It is definitely worth seeing.  We will be back next year!

Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Starter mussels on a bed of salt.  Very flavourful!

dD5-7XpuwfvA036C9-84sg.text: A Different Pointe of View is a different type of place. This isn't the typical hotel restaurant serving burgers or the average steak. A Different Pointe of View is very... very different. As you follow the narrow, winding ave up the steep climb to this 'pointe of view', you sort of wonder where you are headed. The valet finally greets you as you find that perched atop a high pointe is a lone building known as A Different Pointe of View. Inside the building is full of grandeur. We did not have a table on the glass and at first I was a little disappointed but we had an elevated table and you could see the city lights below from every table, it seemed. The wine list is ample but I felt there should be more French Champagnes and California sparkling wines by the split or glass for a place of this caliber because there are only two. The menu is amazing though; there is a chef's special too. Tonight it was a venison with a citrus cranberry finish. I ordered the Duck with Salate Ricotta Ravioli and started with the Lobster Bisque. Other menu items at our table were the Porcini Encrusted Pork Tenderloin with Goat Cheese Risotto and the Chef's Special for this night : The Venison recommended with a medium rare on temp. We started with bubbly and then a fabulous Pinot Noir to pair with our festive meal. The bread that was placed on the table was TO DIE FOR! It comes with three butter/sauces: a basil cilantro ; a strawberry butter; and a parmesan dipping sauce. But honestly, I loved this bread all on its own. The bisque was also amazing. Could have been my entire meal! A sweet start with a tad bit of a tang on the finish. Take a piece of that amazing bread and dip it into the bisque ... it's okay that it's a 4 Diamond restaurant.. NO one will notice! The main course arrives and clearly the chef is all about his presentation! This meal looks like art on a plate! My roasted duck is perched on charred cauliflower with three stuffed ravioli. At first one may think they aren't going to have enough to eat.. You will. The food is rich and delicious! The duck was the right amount of crisp and yet still juicy. Shredded duck was inside the ravioli which surprised me! Perfect palate gift with the ricotta and pillow of ravioli. My husband's venison was perfect and not a bit of game taste. The fruits complimented this dish well. Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable with wine pairings to meal and a perfect humor. The dessert menu looked heavenly but, we had no room for dessert but macaroons arrive when your meal is complete. There is a tasting menu for $89 that I can not wait to come back and take part of. I also know that next time, I will come at dusk and request a table on the glass to take in all the beauty of this place that sits atop the city and perched upon a mountainous rock! A Different Pointe of View is different and it's lovely in all of its fanciful ways. This is a perfect date night spot or special occasion place that's worth every single cent. My pointe of view is that this is a 5:)

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beautiful entrance up to the restaurant..
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a salad! Yes. A chopped salad!

mTnhKxhVoc-yHCW541KIsA.text: For upscale dining with arguably the most spectacular views in the Phoenix area, make sure you dine at Different Pointe of View! From the italian architecture that greets you at the entrance way to the open air patio with fountains and fire pits, you won't be disappointed!  My companions and I dined inside with a panoramic view of the surrounding mountain peaks with the city lights sparkling below. For appetizers we had Chef's Fresh Hummus of the Day Shrimp Ravioli, Lobster Bisque, Chopped Romaine Salad, and Seared Berkshire Pork Belly.  The ravioli was savory and fragrant. Eat it in tiny bites to squeeze out every bit of sumptuous flavor. The pork belly was the absolute best I have ever had and beats out any restaurant's preparation of it in my lifetime (no kidding). The pork belly was a generous 1.25 inch cut and so tender that it nearly melted in my mouth. Seasoned and cooked to perfection, it was a completely satisfying combination with the mashed potato and mushroom reduction.  The lobster bisque maintained a delightful creaminess while being so thick that it did not drip off my spoon. It has a deep, smoky quality that I've never experienced with a lobster bisque in any other restaurant. If you've had lobster bisque before and either thought it was good, or have been disappointed, come here for THIS lobster bisque, which can outperform or redeem any experience you've had before.  My companions had the Seared Diver Scallops for a main course and I had the Aleppo Seared Ahi from the starter menu. How many ways can I say "never had anything so good in my life?" The tuna was just spicy enough to bring warmth without overpowering the more delicate tuna flavor, the Amaranth, Cilantro, Cucumber, Lemon patty on the plate was a mouthful of fresh, cool, and a perfect counterpart to the spicy tuna. The Roasted Jalapeno Avocado Puree tied the spicier tuna and the cool and refreshing vegetable and herb patty together with savory creaminess.  While we were dining, sun set and the lights of Phoenix below provided a spectacular backdrop. Be sure to stay for cocktails or a bottle of wine with friends on the outdoor patio on one of the elevated seating areas, or settle by a roaring fire pit. On warmer nights, sit near the cliffside fountain where the burbling water will make you feel cool despite the desert heat.  Our taste ambassador, Cory, was amazing. I cannot call him a server or waiter - he was an exceptional ambassador to the wines as well as the menu offerings. The Executive Chef, Anthony DeMuro, even came out to our table to greet us. The old saying is "never trust a skinny chef." Trust THIS one! From this culinary experience at Different Point of View, I feel spoiled and have a sense that I'll need to let the memories of this restaurant fade before I can enjoy another.

TyQxVz-I5hCMSPoQZ4fjog.text: Celebrating my 27th. wedding Anniversary here this past Saturday, I was very excited to dine here based on votes, reviews and awards. Off the bat, the VIEWS are SPECTACULAR!!!  Reservations were at 7:00 p.m. Saturday. The restaurant was a little hard to find, but once we found it, there was a sign "valet parking ONLY." As we walked up the stairs there was clearly a wedding going on and that is why I suppose "Valet Parking ONLY".  While the view was spectacular the restaurant was an outdated "older" clientele restaurant. Our server Lenny was very good, the table we had was on the 2nd tier with a view. We ordered Lobster Bisque with (Lemon Zest Creme), the Rosemary Scented Duck Confit Raviolis with (Creamed Corn, Piquillo Pepper Pesto, English Pea Puree, Grated Ricotta Salata, Sauteed Rapini) and the Seared Aleppo Chili Crusted Pork Tenderloin with (Crispy Honey Sweet White Corn Polenta, Baby Summer Squash, Black Bean Parmesan Puree, Jalapeno Honey Glaze).    The Lobster Bisque was good. The Raviolis were so salty I had to send back. The pork was was also salty but not overwhelming and by the time I got my new Raviolis my dining partner was 3/4 finished, so I ate one and took the rest home. Do I think this is a 5 star restaurant? Sorry No.   ... And to top it off when we went to pick up our car at the "Valet ONLY" because of a wedding, my dining partner tipped the guy when he delivered the car. Obviously the valet guy was not happy with the tip and muttered under his breath so it could be heard.  View SPECTACULAR, service very good, food OK, and valet obnoxious

IBhXW2NRa8ngKKiHWqM5Wg.text: Everything was amazing about this place. The food was absolutely delicious. The dessert was the best I ever had. The view was great. The staff is very nice and pleasant. The waiter even offered to take picture of us. That was fantastic. If you haven't tried this place it's definitely worth trying.

huQfJVNu1rTKhnmStcJmTg.text: Absolutely stunning. I'm not surprised that this place has been awarded a Four Diamond Rating for 25 consecutive years. It's at the top of the Pointe Hilton at Tapatillo Cliffs with an impressive view of the entire Phoenix skyline at night. There is truly no restaurant in the city with a better view. It's dark and romantic, also with a patio outside. The patio has several fireplaces and tiki torches, adding to the ambiance at night.  Service was amazing. The waiter knew every detail of the menu and offered great suggestions. He paced the meal incredibly well, and was attentive St not intrusive. This is the mark of an excellent waiter.  They start you with homemade focaccia and ciabatta bread, accompanied with maple butter, pepper pesto, and a goat cheese emulsion. Each of the three spreads were amazing. I could be happy with a few baskets of bread and call it a night.  For appetizers, the oysters were served with horseradish and bacon. Unlike a lot of heavy oyster dishes, it was light and refreshing. The other appetizer was a pork belly risotto with a poached egg and black truffles. Probably one of the best appetizers I've had in my life. And I order black truffles everywhere, so I can say that this was one of the best truffle dishes!  The entrees were lamb loin and duck risotto. One of the most tender pieces of duck I've seen. It could be cut with a fork. The lamb was cooked to a perfect medium rare.  Overall, excellent food and views.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck confit risotto
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb loin
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black truffle pork belly risotto

DYs-1WwnHywsbnfpNbdFLQ.text: Great restaurant with amazing views of Phoenix.  But the best part of the experience was truly outstanding service. One person to specifically call out was the guy who said he is not a waiter but a busboy but he literally went out of his ways to take the best photos of our group with the breathtaking view behind. His name is Austin as I wanted to make sure I note his name in the review.

A6yPuqr5KkCOD-ZInLLdpQ.text: We chose this restaurant for our anniversary for the amazing view we were told it had. We were not disappointed. The view was incredible and the great weather made it a spectacular evening to sit out on the patio. Unfortunately, the food and the service were not as great as the atmosphere. We asked to switch our table to an outdoor patio table since the restaurant was very slow. After thirty minutes of no acknowledgement we made the request again. I will say that during the wait we were very polite and patient as to not ruin the mood of the evening.  Eventually the manager did approach and agreed to relocate us but seemed very bothered. He made no apologies for wait or the lack of acknowledgement. My husband and I both noticed that he did not smile once during his communication with us, he couldn't even fake a smile when I thanked him for helping us. As mentioned the view was beautiful and we and we anxiously awaited our dinners. I ordered a Scallop dish that was delicious. My husband ordered the Filet, medium rare. Unfortunately his filet was well done when he received it. Our waiter did offer to bring out a new filet but we have never feel comfortable sending food back so he ate it. We also ordered a side of Artichokes that were flavorless and tough. Overall, I would recommend the restaurant for the view. Your food may be hit or miss. And the service can definitely be improved.

LzcEIXb5DIR-OMT6gArsnA.text: So, I have lived in Arizona now for a few months and, the reality is... I haven't been impressed with much of the food... I mean I was spoiled living in Los Angeles and traveling, but it is what it is... So, friends and I decided to go to DPOV for dinner tonight to celebrate my son turning 13, and even though I heard it was ridiculously overpriced, I thought sure why not... He is turning 13. So like any gay dad would do, I made a reservation, and it was quite wonderful. From the moment we walked in everyone greeted him with a happy birthday.  The food: Yes, while it is overpriced... It is spectacular... between all of us eating we had: Bistro Tomato Infused Steak (my choice, which was amazing , beyond amazing and delicate), Duck Confit (probably the best, but apparently everyone at the table thought my risotto was better), Coriander Lamb (the mustard sauce was great, the couscous was okay), Basil Chicken (sauce was amazing), Lobster Bisque (extremely layered and wonderful), Peanut Butter Chocolate Moose, and the Mocha Espresso (pretty amazing and rich), and coffees. (I had a double espresso that was thick and wonderful)....   The Service: It was beyond exceptional, and patient as two of our party got lost and we took up the table for quite some time.  Ambiance: Gorgeous, the track lighting really does showcase the food and creates an intimate environment. It definitely is a great getaway for a date or romantic fling as it is attached to the resort.  Overall it was a pretty beautiful evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Different point of view

g02xTFQt69jQIbsdjaqpHw.text: Anytime a person decides to go out to dinner a person wants to be impressed by the flavor. I was not only impressed by the flavor but the views and scenery were just as delicious. Yup, that was my experience at the Different Pointe of View. Been in the valley for many years and never heard of this place until I got a romantic invite. Lots and I mean lots of stairs, made it an ascension to paradise. My food and service was great. I'm not  sure if it's possible but ask for Tunda & Nash. Both were so much fun and made my experience worth while. I will definitely be back!!

ioDBeUdRflwvGeuJcD1hlA.text: The view was amazing, the food was not.  We were very disappointed.  Our soup came out cold and we sent it back twice, then just gave up....the waiter seemed more annoyed with us. When our dinner arrived the waiter never came back......my over cooked sea scallops just sat getting old and cold.   The time the waiter came back I wasn't hungry since my friend shared her steak.  It was my surprise birthday dinner......I was surprised all right, since I didn't get to eat anything I ordered! Well, I always have next year!

oFHK7qXQPVdDQggMb7x5jQ.text: 5 stars - HOWEVER....   5 stars for food, service, view and pork.  I think though that $12 for a few leaves of a salad was very funny. It was good but this is exactly how it tastes at home (ok I make good salad)   I can imagine this to be a great place for someone who wants to rest after a stressful day and watch the city lights from a place tucked away on a mountain - and doesn't mind spending minimum $65 per person.  Maybe it is a good idea to check if the pork, or any meat is grass fed - which would justify the price, or are the prices justified by elevation of the restaurant - which, at least for me, is not worth it.

SOGJudjs-1XsSDex5jZIPA.text: Took my girlfriend there for her birthday and she totally loved it. The food was awesome and the service was on point. The view was worth every penny

photos.caption: Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bistro steak
Photo of Different Pointe of View - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great meal

-TUXy6f4R30aMTJ4zv-FrA.text: The views were AMAZING. Everyone visiting phx MUST visit this restaurant and it will not disappoint you!   We had sliders, lobster soup, French fries.... So hard to pick knowing that the view is gorgeous.  I could sit on the patio all day before the Mosquitos starting attacking lol

Is8UI7YpLHCMIzcLCOTr2g.text: My husband and I came here for dinner while staying at the resort I'll start off by saying the view definitely does not disappoint. After looking at the menu we decided to go with a five-course meal prepared on the spot by the chefs it was $90 per person but it was well worth it, every bite of every course was absolutely divine the scallops cut like butter the steak was the best either of us had ever had although crazy overall was such a wonderful experience great service and divine food will definitely be back

hpYrjkqlB1cFdN923QMHOA.text: We made a reservation to eat here for one of the nights of my sister's bachelorette party, and we are glad we did. The city view and sunset makes it totally worth it to drive out and eat dinner here. It was busy, but the service was still great. We got the bistro steak, short ribs, chicken, and salads. It was a wonderful experience thanks to the manager Kaitlyn for setting it up!

my6XqZvS_LUtwQT1W5y1Vg.text: Great place to bring out of towners. Beautiful views of the valley & great wine.

fHngkIYK9BmKDZWboq-QBA.text: Priir to visiting Different Point of View... i made the mistake of reading too many negative reviews/comments.  This place was an exceptional dining experience.  First, the view is amazing.  You need a shuttle to get to the top of the mountain from the hotel property.  There is a bar downstaits from the dining area where you can have a drink inside or out. Outside has an amazing patio (1/5th of iy can be seen in my picture) which overlooks pheonix.  While having drinks, i noticed they were underpoured SEVERELY and cost $14 each.  After several.. I was begining to get annoyed by the size and made a commeent to the waiter.  He apologized and gave me an additonal Macallan on the rocks on him.  So although yhe drinks were severely underpoured, an attempt was made to please me.  The food ordered to the table: CHOPPED SALAD LOBSTER BISQUE SAUSAGE RAVIOLI DUCK SPECIAL SHORT RIB (BONELESS) VANILLA BEAN ICE CREAM  The lobster bisque was very very tasty and the other person in my party enjoyed his salad.  We split the ravioli appetizer which consists of 3 raviolis but we each received 2.  They had broccoli rabe sausage and a nice filling.  I forgot to mention the two types of bread for the table came with a selection of 3 amazing spreads:: blood orange butter, pesto, goat cheese reduction.  The duck was a great taste but I ordered the short rib and only "tried" th e duck.  The short rib was a tiny bit overcooked but i am mentioning it for the sake of being accurate... it wasnt bad and didnt take away from how good it was.  The polenta and veg inckuded underneth the shortrib also had a great taste.  It's important to note, 4 scotches (one complimentry), 2 bourbons and an additional 2 orders of ice cream were added to the bill before seeing $187.50.  To dome this may dound a bit much, but I dont believe those people travel to New York.  Furthermore, I understand price should be relative to the geo location and I still dont believe it was OVERLY excessive.  This place is great for those who want a mountaintop dining and drinking experience with high quality food.  My trip consisted of visits to Tomasos, The Mission, & Different Pointe of View.  Different Pointe of View would come in second to Tomasos.. but just because I am italian and love pasta :-)   If I am to be in PHX again, it will be a must gor me to visit Different Pointe of View again.... wiyhe the misses most likely.
